content:
Located some distance away from the mrt. The omelette, fried rice and red wine chicken are good. The cold trotters wasn't to my liking as there was just much more skin than meat. Overall taste is reasonably good but nothing especially outstanding.

Price wise seems quite standard.

Make a reservation so that can save time in waiting.
Food is served very fast and swift.
Loves the fresh cockles with its lotsa garlic that is seasoned so well.
Sweet and Sour Pork is crispy and tasted great.
Steamed Sea Bass is Fresh and meat is tender.
Fried Toufu is so so soft and delicious.
The Xing Hua Bee Hoon and Lor Mee have that nostalgic taste.
Fried Yam is well crispy and soft.
Overall taste is like the Putien Restaurant and price is simply half of it.

Quality of food is always there 😋 for the past 2 yrs. For 3/4 of us, we  ordered small size dishes and medium for noodles;  pretty good value for money.

Need to queue a while during Friday night dinner hours.

One of the better Heng Hua food around. Been a customer for many years. Quality has been consistent so far. But it’s a small shop, and only has a few tables. So try to come earlier unless you don’t mind waiting.

Service was fast and efficient. The Bee Hoon quite dry and too little vegetables - 3☆. The deep fried chicken Thai style not much flavor. Just the sweet sauce to enhance the taste 2☆. Fortunately the stir fried Mustard with dried shrimp and the deep fried Tenggui Fish are the winner 5☆. Mustard is simple and crunchy. Fish is fresh and crispy.
Ordered takeaway Lor mee and fried Sliced Yam which should be good.

Food - 3.8/5
Waiting time - 1/5
Service - 1/5

Food:
More affordable than putien restaurant. Taste decent, like any good standard zhi char stall, but wont say extraordinary. Menu was comprehensive.

Waiting time:
Dabaoed food for Sunday dinner. Placed order at 6.10pm, which i thought was pretty early. But only received the food at 7.10pm and after atleast 5 times of asking to check on my order.

Service:
Understandable that shop is crowded and everyone was busy. But when i keep asking the helpers to check on my order, they always ask the main guy directing the flow, and in the end no reply was given. Went directly to the main guy to ask to check, he didn't even look at the orders he had in hand and told me to come back 15min, and say its cooking already. Went back 10min later to check again, and asked if the dishes even started cooking. And he finally went to take a look and hurried his chefs on my order. Just felt he should be honest about the situation. If the dishes were not cooked, just be truthful. At least we can better estimate our own waiting time and not be a fool standing there and waiting. Also they seem to have another order line which people call in and ordered, and paid when they come to collect. Those orders and those eat in orders seemed to be prioritied compared us who took the effort to walk in and order, and even paid upfront. Really upset about this whole situation.

Those who intend to try the stall can perhaps catch them at the off peak hours, or try calling in to see if u can pre order. All the best.

Journey to the North for affordable Putien Food. Aside from the must order Heng Hua Style Fried Bee Hoon & Heng Hua Style Lor Mee, highly recommended to try their Stir-Fried Sliced Yam. The Yam cubes are slightly crispy on the outside coated with some sweet sauce while it’s soft and mushy inside. I can just order this as a meal for myself, it’s so good!
.
Location: Heng Hua Restaurant, Yishun Street 72, #01-212 Block 748, Singapore 760748
Good food and fast service. Yam and bee hoon were amazing, definitely should order this two dishes when visiting.
Came down here for some HengHwa cuisine, ahhh… never disappoint! Gotta make reservation if you are coming down during dinner time. Will come back!
Ordered the set for 2, just nice. Soup come w 6 fresh prawns which 3 of them are big, worth the $. Reasonable price n worth to try. Highly recommend.

One restaurant is at the end of the block. It is worth waiting (not many seats). The Heng Hua rice noodle (Bee Hoon) is a must-try; although this is on the dry side, you have a different sensory while having it. Must try the blood cockles, which is now seldom available. The braised pork leg is the highlight of the meal; however, beware of the fats. The sweet and sour fish is also quite interesting, although deep-fried, it's so well done that you might want to go back to get more. Wear light clothing it's warm eating there.
Nice food at reasonable price. We came around 11.45am. Total bill was $57.40 for 4 pax. 😁👍🏻

1st visit here since we moved to this vicinity. Lor Mee tastes like Ban Mian with a lighter touch & okay soup base. Fried bee Hoon was dry and rather bland. Best is their See Hum blood cockles drenched in raw spicy garlic and sweetish sauce.

Herbs-Food Prawns in Bamboo Shoot, Deep Fried Slices of Tenggui Fish, Braised Bean Curd Skin with Kailan, Heng Hwa Mee Sua, Oyster Omelette. The restaurant putien has its origins in a coffee shop and has grown to become a Michelin worthy restaurant. If you still prefer the good old coffeeshop style, this Heng Hua cuisine which still operates under a HDB is an option and at an affordable one as well.
Tried their 4 pax menu and we were decently full! The lor mee is comparable to many other places I’ve tried and the fish was tasty. Never tried fried yam before but I think they made it quite well.
Authentic food at economical price. Quite crowded at meals time.. better call to reserve in advance.
Rare gem found in Singapore, foods serve here was nice, you can imagine the satisfication of 3 pax from the pictures post here~ 😝(don't doubt on us, it's really 3 pax only in total)
NICEEEEE ❤️ Love the food here. Yummy. Will bring my family here to try.

Pretty decent and value for money food. Having read mixed reviews I decided to trust the average rating. Yes it is a small place in a neighborhood. Adjust your expectations a little, it'll be an enjoyable experience. Not saying it's a lousy place, it's a neighborhood store, don't expect putien in a mall experience. I ordered take away and it was rather busy with dine in and take aways as well. Recommended and will return again.
Cheap and authentic Xin hua cuisine.
Authentic Xing Hua foods. Affordable price and big portion.

Good food. I tried steamed seabass $28 , dry fish hor fun $15, homemade tofu, garlic veg, tea n coke. All food was great. Spent about 65.

They accept credit card and have baby chairs.
Nice & reasonably priced. It's a small restaurant selling 'xing hua' dishes.

Went to this place at 520pm, was not crowded at all. However, despite the low crowd levels, the waitress was still very impatient in taking our order. She got irritated when we changed our order and ignore us when we tried to confirm the order one last time and just walked away. So upsetting as we visited the place with high expectations. Poor service! The food is not bad, a 6.5 upon 10.

This restaurant has been around for>10years, churning out tasty Heng Hua dishes. Always crowded during meal timing, so expect a 15 min wait and dishes will not be served all a once, so pace yourself.
Loves the HH Bee Hoon as it reminds me of my childhood where my neighbor is HH, auntie's HH home cook Bee Hoon was fantastic. Medium Size is able to feed family of 3 well.
The HH Lo Mee is tasty, my wife's favorite, nice stock. Nice noodle texture 🍜.
Reasonably priced dishes, good menu selections.
Still have room for improvement on the attitude of service staffs.
The bee hoon was quite special because it was so thin. I liked the candied yam too. But the rest were about average.

The lor mee is alright. Found much seafood and aromatics in the soup. Like dried shrimps, fried shallots and sliced red onion. However the ceiling needs mending. Found a cockroach leg on the table and I blew it away. Fortunately, it did not end up in my bowl of noodles :/

The restaurant is far from town , but food wise is good. So no complain on that . If you had tried Putien’s restaurant food. This is similar but way cheaper. Portion we ordered for two person in small size but three dishes were way enough for us both. Price include two steam rice and added an extra rice $31. Recommended for family and friends . But this place is hot.

Worst service which made us wait for almost 2hours for our packed food. They told us that it will be an hour wait. We abided and waited patiently. However, after an hour we asked the staff to check on our orders, they told us it’s cooking so we waited and waited. We probably have asked three different staff 4-5 times to please check on our orders. They all told us it’s cooking now. All the people who came after us have taken their food and left. We were really upset and told them  off. After that they checked and one staff said that the orders were missing. They told us they will cook now. It was such a frustrating experience, especially it’s Mother’s Day and all our old parents at home waited and hungry. One staff wearing an NUS shirt was rude, back faced and yelled in frustration. The service was so lousy. No one apologise at all.. all back faced us.. only one lady told us “cooking now cooking now”. It was such a disappointing experience. Service could have done better by giving us a better service recovery or at least sound apologetic. No apology at all. Shame on them. So next time people who go there please ask to see your receipt if not you will end up like us. Such a waste of time and food standard has dropped tremendously too.

Small eatery.
Food is good, rivals restaurant standard, but prices are low like coffeeshop zhi char.
Nice to find such quality food within a HDB estate

Good and cheap everyday goto restaurant. Food is pretty good but not the best heng hua I have tried. No aircon and seatings are very tight.
Prices and pretty cheap, my dinner of 7 only spent less than $95 - we had some 8 dishes.

Location has sufficient car park slots available.
Have many sets to choose from. Overall good quality was good. The price was reasonable too.

The chilli is a must try!
Spice up the food and everything will taste better when the chilli was added to it.

Of course, do not expect too attentive service when they are busy.

Good place to go for your Bee Hoon craving...

Heng Hwa Fried Bee Hoon was light and clean - though I can feel that some people may think of it as tasteless. But honestly speaking, their chilli is so shiok that even if you are on 'bee hoon too is tasteless' camp, just smother some of their chilli on and you will be converted instantly. Another dish that I would highly recommend is Stir Fried Sliced Yam - the combination of light crispy batter and a drizzle of sweet sauce was too darn addictive. The Sweet and Sour Pork was also solid, can feel the slab of lean meat on each piece (i.e. not 30% meat, 40% fat, 30% batter like some places). Also, they are generous on portion and is very wallet friendly.

Restaurant level food at neighborhood prices. Be prepared to wait, or share tables with other customers. Patronized 4 evenings ago.

The yam was a pleasant surprise. Plain looks, but fried with a little sweet taste. Great with beer. The chilli was the best accompaniment with the other food.

The lor mee is white in color. The taste reminded me of fish soup w milk. The fried mee sua is also packed with flavors.

All in all, a hearty meal.
Food is so so other than the famous Henghua mee Hoon. Price is at high side. We were asked to share table with others! Don’t think it is right when we r in phase 2 now
Great and tasty food at affordable price. Able to make a booking on Sat night dinner and lots of choice for food.
No frills eatery with no aircon. Had fried mee sua, fried batang fish & garlic vegetable plus 2 drinks $27. Just nice for 2 persons
Love the heng hua style of food here. Especially the soft fried bee hoon. Food is serve fast.

The is a small restaurant, hence sitting is limited. Be prepare to share table if it gets too crowded. The food is good and price is reasonable. The lor mee, fried sliced fish and oyster omelette are good. I find the fried bee Hoon too dry to my liking although the bee Hoon is fried until so fluffy. We enjoyed our meal.

Normally Singapore Zin char food flavor is quite good but very heavy，jia kut. However this restaurant is not. The flavor is mild and not strong. It’s perfectly seasoning. Seems no burden to your body. The knuckle is good and no porky. The fried bee hoon is so delicious and have so many textures, crunchy, fresh , nutty and savory. Must come and try. Total bill SGD14.5.
Place offer nice spread of Heng Hua style foods. Not bad considering the price is very reasonable for zi char style. Worth a try and repeat visit

Is my 1st time to buy from this restaurant after reading many reviews.  Is really worth to buy from this place cause food are so yummy. Waiting time is not long even there are many people ordered. I really like their fish hor fun, slice fishes are fresh n no fishy smell n hor fun really good 👍👍👍👍👍😋. I will go again! 🤩

Only had Henghwa Lor Beehoon for lunch. At $4.50 a pop for small serving, you get enough carbo in signature fine strand beehoon. Ingredients fresh but not generous (inflation?) Suitable for those who dont like too starchy a gravy. Unlike other eateries, they dont dunk in fried pieces of yam. So i didnt have a chance to taste it. 😂

Tried their signature dishes, and found their Heng hua style vermicelli and "ru mian" to be delicious. The sweet and sour pork was great as well, but the beancurd skin wig vegetable was average.

Compared with the Putien chain of restaurant, the prices here are way cheaper and of comparable taste - in fact I like their ru mian better.
Order their set meal for 2 and is great value for money. Come before 6.20pm if not their reataurant is usually packed with diner.

Rather disappointing experience that did not live up to the reviews and Google rating. Ordered four dishes:
-  Mongolian pork ribs : too dry
-beancurd with prawns : decent but nothing to rave about
-Heng Hua been Hoon: rather dry as well and not as nice as Pu Tien standard
-oyster omelette: fluffy and spongy but flavour is lacking.

Overall decent meal at affordable price but certainly not anything special.

Food above average but has given four stars as I find the pricing reasonable.

Worth a visit for all Heng Hua food lovers.

Ordered fried fish, bee hoon and lor mee.. nice.
Chrysanthemum tea niice too!!
Downside is just a bit too hot.
Food still good like before. No need to go Putien

Try the Xing Hua Beehoon and Lor mee! Definitely nicer than the other dishes. We ordered both medium size, $8. The lor mee is substantially a lot more and can probably be shared between 3 people while the beehoon can be shared between 2. The other dishes e.g. deep fried crispy prawn fritters $8 has no hint of prawns, just taste like regular Ngoh Hiang, and the stir fried white clams $10 with spicy sauce was very salty. There isn’t any queue when I went there on a weekday dinner.

Be prepared to wait for at least an hour to get a seat as it is very popular n the restaurant is quite small.  But it is worth the wait as the dishes r unique n delicious.  We ordered fried sweet yam n steam mee sua which r 😋 There r many more dishes that must try eg herbal prawn in bamboo stick, lychee pork, etc...

Food is ok. The black sauce noodles was nothing but salty.. salted egg pork ribs was covered in batter w almost no meat at all. Claypot rice is the only decent thing here, guess that’s why that’s their store name. Give this a miss because in this area there is bound to have better food!

Not very crowded when we were there on a Sunday afternoon.

Ice milo is $3.60 a cup! I thought that was a bit too expensive for a coffee shop setting.

Food is generally nice. The garlic chicken was not to my liking as they cooked with curry powder. Stir fry la la is very nice. The sauce is good. Claypot rice is generous with the salted fish.

We had a small traditional claypot rice, a small claypot seafood fried beehoon, a small homemade crispy bean curd (10 pcs) and 4 Chinese tea to share among 4 pax. Total bill $38.60.

The food was yummy and everything was served hot and freshly cooked 👍🏻 they gave us 4 bowls without having to ask for it and service was prompt.

Indoor seating was quite cooling and we actually felt like we were in malaysia due to the setting.

Only qualm was that we were all very thirsty abt half an hour after the meal which likely meant that there was quite a bit of msg in it. Otherwise, definitely worth a try and we will definitely go back and try their other dishes!
Have been coming here regularly for my claypot rice cravings. Although portion seems to have become smaller, but the quality is still good and the medium sized is good for two

Was here on 22-May-2022 dinner and order 5 dishes. The famous claypot chickens rice was smooth and good. Other 3 dishes was alright. But the worst is the cereal prawn which cereal taste was ok but the prawn seem to either have 2 different species 1 of them look fresh healthy and the rest of the prawn was in dark black along edge of shell all over. Call for advise they said the rest in black is over oil flies and only 1 is just flies right. That’s the explain and place back the same dish on the table. Omg. Is that a good explanation and acceptable for dinner? That’s is totally and chef skill issue and was treated in these manner. Very disappointed indeed

Second time here. Service is always slow and bad despite an empty restaurant. 45 min of waiting.

All the staffs just stay group around chatting without following up on your orders.

Food is tasty.

Pls get them to work on service level.

Came here as I have been craving good claypot rice and read a review. Was quite disappointed though as the claypot rice was quite soggy and had no oomph to it. It was actually pretty tasteless. The meal was saved by the San Lao mee hoon and garlic chicken both of which were far better. That's a pity as the name of the shop is Sembawang Claypot Rice.

Ambience-wise, it's a non-AC coffeeshop space. There's no service charge or GST so don't expect service with a smile. Payment by cash only - no cards or Nets

Super fragrant claypot rice with a generous portion of meat. The San Lou Bee Hoon was crisp on the outside yet still moist and flavourful in its entirety. My friend is vegetarian so we asked them if they could do a vegetarian version of the Bee Hoon and turns out they were more than willing to accommodate our request. Top 2 must try dishes!

We were a party of 3 and ordered 6 items with the intention to sample as much as we can. The pricing was very reasonable and perhaps the food was just about as well. Starting with the least - KL fried hokkien mee was very disappointing (texture of noodle was so limp), also not impressed with the claypot rice which lacked flavor (it needed quite a bit of dark soy sauce to salvage), garlic chicken was OK (its nice having fresh chicken with all the chopped up/ odd bits). But we certainly enjoyed the 三楼米粉, 咸蛋排骨 and the spinach in 3 eggs. Will try new dishes (maybe curry fish head) if we do return.

The ambience is nice n clean , the staff there are very helpful. And the main agenda claypot chicken rice is good too. And also to add their burnt bee hoon was very nice too. Its sure worth the money to give urself a treat here..value for money..

The crispy rice bits and chilli are always highlights of the claypot rice. Garlic fried chicken & hakka fried pork are some of my go to dishes whenever I'm here. First time trying the Thai style Yong tau foo and greatly enjoyed the Thai chilli sauce that came with it - refreshing pineapple notes! Bittergourd egg and San lou mifen were also lovely.

Great for small or big groups - you can always call in advance to pre-order.

😕😟🙁 Was there two night ago. Overall experience,  ambient not there , serving so so, pay first before you eat. The dishes that I have order , Only the San Lou Mee Hoon and garlic chicken taste Okay . The Sambal Sotong not fresh and super hard to chew. The rest not worth mentioned. For me the Bao Fa Tradition Food  claypot rice at Bukit Batok is so much tasty then here. 🥴🙄😕

The claypot rice is very nice! Small portion just for 1 pax, we ordered the medium portion for 2 pax which is $15.80. San Lou beehoon三楼米粉 is nice too, while the crispy tofu自制脆皮豆腐 is tasteless, it taste like the fried frozen seafood tofu.

Given a restaurant without aircon, the price is on high side, total bill $52 for 2 adults and 2 kids.

Why no claypot rice? I asked after 20 minutes of waiting, twice in between 10 minutes interval, total 40 minutes, after finishing my 2 dishes ( as picture), the claypot rice haven't serve to us. After 40 minutes wait, one uncle ordered same time as us, he already finished his rice and left, while we still waiting our claypot rice, after asking twice on the order.

Bad service. Super bad service. There was no queue at all with many of seats available. I was here and orderded at 5.07pm. My claypot rice served to us at 5.50pm. And best part of the bad service? The rice was NOT fully cooked when FINALLY served to us.

A no frills tze char stall with decent food quality, seated quickly on a sunday afternoon.. especially loved the san lou bee hoon which looked deceptively nondescript but was super tasty. Also really loved the garlic chicken although the signature claypot chicken rice was a little mushy and lackluster. Hakka Crispy pork was a passable dish albeit a bit too fatty for my liking.

Dine in always the best choice if u wanna eat claypot. But due to the limited seat we choose to tapao.

They provide online delivery but have to meet a min $30 (will charge delivery fees)
Free delivery within 3km from the store.

Recommend their claypot & sanlou beehoon. This two eat with their chilly will be perfect.

Besides serving up one of the best claypot rice in Singapore, this location also has a large spread of other dishes that are of great quality! Calling in to make an EARLY BOOKING for your claypot is highly recommended to secure yourself a seat and reduce waiting time for food. Though I dare say that it is still worth the queue if you have to do so!

The chili sauces here are crazy spicy but go extremely well with the food.

Finding a lot for your vehicle will be the biggest challenge here. Good thing there is an underground carpark just opposite the restaurant.

Location is not so wheelchair friendly and will require some lifting. They might/should be able to assign tables closer to the entrance if a prior reservation call is made.

Have no issue in communicating with the staffs in Chinese. The food are Averagely good. The clay pot chicken have many tiny bones , not sure if it’s due to frozen chicken or overcook. The garlic chicken is garlic-ky.. can see many garlics in there haha. Meanwhile, have to wait awhile for food to be ready, not sure why but still within acceptable range.

This place is worth a visit if you like claypot rice with rice crisps and salted fish. Paired with chilli padi or the chilli sauce provided, it was heavenly. Totally enjoyed the claypot rice. But the other dishes we ordered were nothing to rave about. They were good but not great.
The Claypot Chicken rice is as good as per expected. Mee Hoon is the best amongst. However, the KL black noodles is too salty.

Only the San Lou Bee Hoon is nice (4.5 out of 5.). The garlic fried chicken is decent (3.8 out of 5). The Da Lou Mee is terrible (2.0 out of 5), but generous amount of pork lard was given. Will come back for the San Lou Bee Hoon and maybe try out their Claypot Rice next time.

This restaurant is famously known for their claypot rice, but imo, the beehoon taste better.

Thai style yong tou foo is overly oily due to their ingredients are deepfried. Salted egg bitterground is very tasty and doesnt taste like bitterground at all.
Great wokhey in the beehoon, and the crunchy rice so good. 🤩. Would give 5 star except one of our bowls dirty and needed to be replaced. 5 star food.

Heard some blogger recommended this claypot rice.
Personally nothing special about the food. Order a medium size claypot rice. Ingredients quite generous but taste too plain. Nothing special or distinctive that make me wow at all. Not salty not sweet. Not fragrance. Rice too soft and broken once we mixed it.
Ordered a side dish Hakka Crispy pork. Indeed crispy and tender meat but tasteless… not salty nor sweet. Can’t taste any special at all with the “red” crispy flour coating.
Consider “heathy” Low salt Low sugar?”
Go for the claypot rice and seafood bee hoon as they are the signature dishes. You will have to roll the dice if you wanna try other dishes.

We came at 11.10, and food was served around 11.40. Its worth the wait. I ordered sotong cereal..oh my the cereal was soft and crispy. Hint of chilli not overpowering. The claypot rice portion is generous for two person. Two dishes and one sour plum drink came about $29. I will visit again!!

Located opp Sembawang S.C.
Shophouse unit and no aircon. Fans sufficient to keep the area cool.
Claypot rice was piping hot and flavourful.
Homemade cripsy beancurd really cripsy on skin and very tasty!
Chilli and dark sauce given on the side in bottles.
Recommended! 👍
Usually will have queue at night (both weekday and weekend). Food is nice, although sometimes the waiting time for food served can be around 15-25mins.

This place features a clay pot chicken rice dish which cooks over traditional fire. As each dish is cook to order, the waiting time ranges about 20-30 minutes. The rice will leave a layer of crispy burn rice at the bottom of the clay pot, this gives a special fragrance loved by asian family. The chicken is tender and fresh, adds a protein to the food. There is also some mixture of Chinese sausage and salted fish. Add on some dark soy sauce to boost the dish to a next level.

Skipping the queue with early dinner. Reach here at about 4.30pm and order the claypot rice, San Lou Fried Bee Hoon and salted egg butter gourd. The taste is good overall but not the claypot rice, perhaps more salted fish needs to be added to make it more flavourful.

Traditional Claypot Rice, Sambal Sotong, Qing Long Cai 清龙菜. While they do have a traditional style claypot rice, I didn't feel like this place is worth making a trip down for when I have better options at Holland Drive.  The sambal sotong was not what I expected and was a meh.

Ordered the medium serving claypot rice, added a lot of soy sauce myself and made sure to mixed like siao. The claypot rice was slightly bitter giving a lot of charred flavour to the dish. It tasted quite good! Chinese sausage egg omelette was delicious, bitter gourd soup was simple and nice. There were no customers when I ate there today hence my orders came within 10 minutes plus.

We ordered the Set D and thought it was a good deal initially but realised the fish head wasn’t even half a head. The vegetables was a little stringy and the fried udon totally inedible. Claypot rice so-so. Granted it was a delivery and so expected food to be served a bit cold but I doubt I will ever be eating there in person.

Order can be taken while still in queue to minimize the wait time once a table becomes available. 三捞米粉 was good, not many place does this style of cooking. 芙蓉蛋 was below average with parts of the egg was uncooked/watery. Garlic chicken was tasty but too much non edible skin of the garlic and not much meat. Clay pot rice itself was nothing to shout about.

Since its Phase 2 HA and we were in the area, We ordered takeaway for the Sanlou Mifen which is good and the claypot rice. Expect to wait 20min. The claypot rice is quite ordinary. Ive tasted better elsewhere but could be due to the fact that claypot rice not good for takeaway.  Across a road is a tiny mall, do shopping there.

Go elsewhere for better food!! Better close ur restaurant than to hire such staffs!
Had their food twice! Food mediocre. Super Attitude- Service terrible . All waitresses busy looking at their handphones. Not interested to serve you and will argue , raise voice at you. We were the only customers in the restaurant at 5:15pm. Takeaway chicken curry taste terrible. Not worth paying the price to dine in or takeaway.  The place doesn’t have aircon. Super humid even with fan. Need to pay extra $0.50 for takeaway box. I give 1star for your chilli sauce!

The ingredients of the medium pack is the SAME as the small pack, the difference is mainly the amount of RICE!

Ordered takeaway at 6:25 pm and was told to collect the food 45 mins later. When I got back, the food wasn’t ready yet. Gave them the benefit of doubt, came back to check another 25 mins later, where’s my food?! Oh, after the second time they finally ‘checked’ the order and my takeaway was ready in 3 mins.

Not worth the wait or queue in my opinion, in terms of service, food portion and quality. Perhaps the north side just lacks a really good authentic claypot rice!

Not sure why the rating is so low. The claypot chicken rice is really decent, with the rice just nice (not too burnt, but crispy), adequate amount of salted fish, and the chicken was well marinated, albeit a lot of bones.

Quantity is also generous, like typical claypot rice places. The medium can feed 3 girls.

Chilli was not bad too.

Waited more than 1 hour, ordered claypot rice with side dishes. No sign of side dishes and claypot rice. At least serve the side dishes first la. Cannot even manage the walk in portion. Very disappointed. I suggest you all to order takeaway instead. Very inefficient staff

I feel is a bit overrated on their claypot rice. But their san lao bee hoon is the high lite instead. The queue is seriously long. There is at best 15 tables indoor and 8 outdoor. The outdoor table is by a big drain, remind me of going to malaysia eating outdoor. Qing long veg feels normal. The garlic chicken also feel soso.
Airy and spacious. Good safe distancing measures in place, even a waiter is there to take our temperature. Food is good and delicious.

Walked in and placed my order at 6:45PM. Food isn't even here at 7:40PM. Waited almost one whole hour, nothing. Not even the simplest things to cook like cabbage soup. Nearby tables already got their food when they came after my table. Will not revisit again, waste of my time.

Pardon me. I usually take photos of food after I have tasted them. We only ordered the claypot rice and a coffee.
Claypot is average as I had tasted better than this in Bukit Batok East Ave 3. As for this one, rice and salted fish pass my standard. Will not specifically drive down for this but can drop by when I’m near to this area. Potion is slightly lesser but I like the potion of vegetables provided. Oh yes, chicken texture and cut taste and look funny. Maybe is due to frozen chicken.

We ordered the Claypot Rice, curry fish head, dai luk Noodle, San lou Noodle, and salted egg bitter gourd. The Claypot Rice was really nothing impressive. There have been other Claypot Rice which are much better than this place. Especially for the price tag, totally not worth it.

However, the other dishes were very good. San lou Noodle and dai luk Noodle was good. Curry fish head was also spicy and also filling.

That being said, the very off putting thing about this place is that after you order, before you eat, you have to pay up. I did not mind the first time before starting to eat, but during our meals, when we ordered additional drinks, it was really off putting and a hassle.

Will recommend this place if your coming here for the zhi char, but definitely not for the Claypot Rice.
Nice charred rice with plentiful of chicken meat

Claypot rice was really superb, you can adjust the taste as you please by controlling the amount of soy sauce to add.
The fish head curry was very thick and flavourful, but they give you half a head of fish so we felt that it was on the pricy side.
Overall not too bad.

Dined there at a quarter past 9 on a week day. Managed to find parking after circling the neighborhood twice.

Restaurant was quiet; only four tables occupied. Was told that our claypot rice would take around 25 minutes to prepare. Lucky for us, it arrived earlier.

Ordered medium size claypot rice. To be honest, at $13.80, it does feel a bit pricey. Fortunately, it tastes okay.

Ordered a small plate of their San Lou Bee Hoon. It was a first for me and my father liked it. Yes. It's dry. But that's how it should be.

Customer service is what you'd normally get from a well-mannered Foreign talent from the middle Kingdom.

In conclusion, tastes okay. But if you factor in the price, I reckon it's a wee bit pricey. Parking and seating will most definitely be an issue during peak periods. Will come back again just to let my mother try the food here.
Be prepared for one hr wait caz the Claypot rice was cooked from scratch! Tried the salted egg bitter, hakka fried pork, and of course Claypot rice. They were amazing

We tried three different carbo - bee hoon, thick noodles and claypot rice. They were all yummy! Fortunately, for us, we ordered in advance; if not, we need to wait at least 30 minutes for the claypot rice.

Had a KL da lu mian 大陆面 which looked very authentic when served. After i tasted it.. it was simply horrifying. I thought there was what tasted like dried shrimps inside this dark sauce noodles dish, then the staff clarified that having tons of dried solefish is part of its recipe. 🙈

I have eaten many KL 大陆面before and non of them ever had dried solefish which taste like dried shrimps in it before. Can you imagine like having dried shrimps/solefish taste inside your dark carrot cake, dark braised trotter.

After this episode, In the future when i order this dish elsewhere, i will have to ask if they have dried solefish or shrimps inside their 大陆面 before i place an order. These are ingredients terrorist messing up a wonderful recipe.

Located some distance away from the mrt. The omelette, fried rice and red wine chicken are good. The cold trotters wasn't to my liking as there was just much more skin than meat. Overall taste is reasonably good but nothing especially outstanding.

Price wise seems quite standard.

Make a reservation so that can save time in waiting.
Food is served very fast and swift.
Loves the fresh cockles with its lotsa garlic that is seasoned so well.
Sweet and Sour Pork is crispy and tasted great.
Steamed Sea Bass is Fresh and meat is tender.
Fried Toufu is so so soft and delicious.
The Xing Hua Bee Hoon and Lor Mee have that nostalgic taste.
Fried Yam is well crispy and soft.
Overall taste is like the Putien Restaurant and price is simply half of it.

Quality of food is always there 😋 for the past 2 yrs. For 3/4 of us, we  ordered small size dishes and medium for noodles;  pretty good value for money.

Need to queue a while during Friday night dinner hours.

One of the better Heng Hua food around. Been a customer for many years. Quality has been consistent so far. But it’s a small shop, and only has a few tables. So try to come earlier unless you don’t mind waiting.

Service was fast and efficient. The Bee Hoon quite dry and too little vegetables - 3☆. The deep fried chicken Thai style not much flavor. Just the sweet sauce to enhance the taste 2☆. Fortunately the stir fried Mustard with dried shrimp and the deep fried Tenggui Fish are the winner 5☆. Mustard is simple and crunchy. Fish is fresh and crispy.
Ordered takeaway Lor mee and fried Sliced Yam which should be good.

Food - 3.8/5
Waiting time - 1/5
Service - 1/5

Food:
More affordable than putien restaurant. Taste decent, like any good standard zhi char stall, but wont say extraordinary. Menu was comprehensive.

Waiting time:
Dabaoed food for Sunday dinner. Placed order at 6.10pm, which i thought was pretty early. But only received the food at 7.10pm and after atleast 5 times of asking to check on my order.

Service:
Understandable that shop is crowded and everyone was busy. But when i keep asking the helpers to check on my order, they always ask the main guy directing the flow, and in the end no reply was given. Went directly to the main guy to ask to check, he didn't even look at the orders he had in hand and told me to come back 15min, and say its cooking already. Went back 10min later to check again, and asked if the dishes even started cooking. And he finally went to take a look and hurried his chefs on my order. Just felt he should be honest about the situation. If the dishes were not cooked, just be truthful. At least we can better estimate our own waiting time and not be a fool standing there and waiting. Also they seem to have another order line which people call in and ordered, and paid when they come to collect. Those orders and those eat in orders seemed to be prioritied compared us who took the effort to walk in and order, and even paid upfront. Really upset about this whole situation.

Those who intend to try the stall can perhaps catch them at the off peak hours, or try calling in to see if u can pre order. All the best.

Journey to the North for affordable Putien Food. Aside from the must order Heng Hua Style Fried Bee Hoon & Heng Hua Style Lor Mee, highly recommended to try their Stir-Fried Sliced Yam. The Yam cubes are slightly crispy on the outside coated with some sweet sauce while it’s soft and mushy inside. I can just order this as a meal for myself, it’s so good!
.
Location: Heng Hua Restaurant, Yishun Street 72, #01-212 Block 748, Singapore 760748
Good food and fast service. Yam and bee hoon were amazing, definitely should order this two dishes when visiting.
Came down here for some HengHwa cuisine, ahhh… never disappoint! Gotta make reservation if you are coming down during dinner time. Will come back!
Ordered the set for 2, just nice. Soup come w 6 fresh prawns which 3 of them are big, worth the $. Reasonable price n worth to try. Highly recommend.

One restaurant is at the end of the block. It is worth waiting (not many seats). The Heng Hua rice noodle (Bee Hoon) is a must-try; although this is on the dry side, you have a different sensory while having it. Must try the blood cockles, which is now seldom available. The braised pork leg is the highlight of the meal; however, beware of the fats. The sweet and sour fish is also quite interesting, although deep-fried, it's so well done that you might want to go back to get more. Wear light clothing it's warm eating there.
Nice food at reasonable price. We came around 11.45am. Total bill was $57.40 for 4 pax. 😁👍🏻

1st visit here since we moved to this vicinity. Lor Mee tastes like Ban Mian with a lighter touch & okay soup base. Fried bee Hoon was dry and rather bland. Best is their See Hum blood cockles drenched in raw spicy garlic and sweetish sauce.

Herbs-Food Prawns in Bamboo Shoot, Deep Fried Slices of Tenggui Fish, Braised Bean Curd Skin with Kailan, Heng Hwa Mee Sua, Oyster Omelette. The restaurant putien has its origins in a coffee shop and has grown to become a Michelin worthy restaurant. If you still prefer the good old coffeeshop style, this Heng Hua cuisine which still operates under a HDB is an option and at an affordable one as well.
Tried their 4 pax menu and we were decently full! The lor mee is comparable to many other places I’ve tried and the fish was tasty. Never tried fried yam before but I think they made it quite well.
Authentic food at economical price. Quite crowded at meals time.. better call to reserve in advance.
Rare gem found in Singapore, foods serve here was nice, you can imagine the satisfication of 3 pax from the pictures post here~ 😝(don't doubt on us, it's really 3 pax only in total)
NICEEEEE ❤️ Love the food here. Yummy. Will bring my family here to try.

Pretty decent and value for money food. Having read mixed reviews I decided to trust the average rating. Yes it is a small place in a neighborhood. Adjust your expectations a little, it'll be an enjoyable experience. Not saying it's a lousy place, it's a neighborhood store, don't expect putien in a mall experience. I ordered take away and it was rather busy with dine in and take aways as well. Recommended and will return again.
Cheap and authentic Xin hua cuisine.
Authentic Xing Hua foods. Affordable price and big portion.

Good food. I tried steamed seabass $28 , dry fish hor fun $15, homemade tofu, garlic veg, tea n coke. All food was great. Spent about 65.

They accept credit card and have baby chairs.
Nice & reasonably priced. It's a small restaurant selling 'xing hua' dishes.

Went to this place at 520pm, was not crowded at all. However, despite the low crowd levels, the waitress was still very impatient in taking our order. She got irritated when we changed our order and ignore us when we tried to confirm the order one last time and just walked away. So upsetting as we visited the place with high expectations. Poor service! The food is not bad, a 6.5 upon 10.

This restaurant has been around for>10years, churning out tasty Heng Hua dishes. Always crowded during meal timing, so expect a 15 min wait and dishes will not be served all a once, so pace yourself.
Loves the HH Bee Hoon as it reminds me of my childhood where my neighbor is HH, auntie's HH home cook Bee Hoon was fantastic. Medium Size is able to feed family of 3 well.
The HH Lo Mee is tasty, my wife's favorite, nice stock. Nice noodle texture 🍜.
Reasonably priced dishes, good menu selections.
Still have room for improvement on the attitude of service staffs.
The bee hoon was quite special because it was so thin. I liked the candied yam too. But the rest were about average.

The lor mee is alright. Found much seafood and aromatics in the soup. Like dried shrimps, fried shallots and sliced red onion. However the ceiling needs mending. Found a cockroach leg on the table and I blew it away. Fortunately, it did not end up in my bowl of noodles :/

The restaurant is far from town , but food wise is good. So no complain on that . If you had tried Putien’s restaurant food. This is similar but way cheaper. Portion we ordered for two person in small size but three dishes were way enough for us both. Price include two steam rice and added an extra rice $31. Recommended for family and friends . But this place is hot.

Worst service which made us wait for almost 2hours for our packed food. They told us that it will be an hour wait. We abided and waited patiently. However, after an hour we asked the staff to check on our orders, they told us it’s cooking so we waited and waited. We probably have asked three different staff 4-5 times to please check on our orders. They all told us it’s cooking now. All the people who came after us have taken their food and left. We were really upset and told them  off. After that they checked and one staff said that the orders were missing. They told us they will cook now. It was such a frustrating experience, especially it’s Mother’s Day and all our old parents at home waited and hungry. One staff wearing an NUS shirt was rude, back faced and yelled in frustration. The service was so lousy. No one apologise at all.. all back faced us.. only one lady told us “cooking now cooking now”. It was such a disappointing experience. Service could have done better by giving us a better service recovery or at least sound apologetic. No apology at all. Shame on them. So next time people who go there please ask to see your receipt if not you will end up like us. Such a waste of time and food standard has dropped tremendously too.

Small eatery.
Food is good, rivals restaurant standard, but prices are low like coffeeshop zhi char.
Nice to find such quality food within a HDB estate

Good and cheap everyday goto restaurant. Food is pretty good but not the best heng hua I have tried. No aircon and seatings are very tight.
Prices and pretty cheap, my dinner of 7 only spent less than $95 - we had some 8 dishes.

Location has sufficient car park slots available.
Have many sets to choose from. Overall good quality was good. The price was reasonable too.

The chilli is a must try!
Spice up the food and everything will taste better when the chilli was added to it.

Of course, do not expect too attentive service when they are busy.

Good place to go for your Bee Hoon craving...

Heng Hwa Fried Bee Hoon was light and clean - though I can feel that some people may think of it as tasteless. But honestly speaking, their chilli is so shiok that even if you are on 'bee hoon too is tasteless' camp, just smother some of their chilli on and you will be converted instantly. Another dish that I would highly recommend is Stir Fried Sliced Yam - the combination of light crispy batter and a drizzle of sweet sauce was too darn addictive. The Sweet and Sour Pork was also solid, can feel the slab of lean meat on each piece (i.e. not 30% meat, 40% fat, 30% batter like some places). Also, they are generous on portion and is very wallet friendly.

Restaurant level food at neighborhood prices. Be prepared to wait, or share tables with other customers. Patronized 4 evenings ago.

The yam was a pleasant surprise. Plain looks, but fried with a little sweet taste. Great with beer. The chilli was the best accompaniment with the other food.

The lor mee is white in color. The taste reminded me of fish soup w milk. The fried mee sua is also packed with flavors.

All in all, a hearty meal.
Food is so so other than the famous Henghua mee Hoon. Price is at high side. We were asked to share table with others! Don’t think it is right when we r in phase 2 now
Great and tasty food at affordable price. Able to make a booking on Sat night dinner and lots of choice for food.
No frills eatery with no aircon. Had fried mee sua, fried batang fish & garlic vegetable plus 2 drinks $27. Just nice for 2 persons
Love the heng hua style of food here. Especially the soft fried bee hoon. Food is serve fast.

The is a small restaurant, hence sitting is limited. Be prepare to share table if it gets too crowded. The food is good and price is reasonable. The lor mee, fried sliced fish and oyster omelette are good. I find the fried bee Hoon too dry to my liking although the bee Hoon is fried until so fluffy. We enjoyed our meal.

Normally Singapore Zin char food flavor is quite good but very heavy，jia kut. However this restaurant is not. The flavor is mild and not strong. It’s perfectly seasoning. Seems no burden to your body. The knuckle is good and no porky. The fried bee hoon is so delicious and have so many textures, crunchy, fresh , nutty and savory. Must come and try. Total bill SGD14.5.
Place offer nice spread of Heng Hua style foods. Not bad considering the price is very reasonable for zi char style. Worth a try and repeat visit

Is my 1st time to buy from this restaurant after reading many reviews.  Is really worth to buy from this place cause food are so yummy. Waiting time is not long even there are many people ordered. I really like their fish hor fun, slice fishes are fresh n no fishy smell n hor fun really good 👍👍👍👍👍😋. I will go again! 🤩

Only had Henghwa Lor Beehoon for lunch. At $4.50 a pop for small serving, you get enough carbo in signature fine strand beehoon. Ingredients fresh but not generous (inflation?) Suitable for those who dont like too starchy a gravy. Unlike other eateries, they dont dunk in fried pieces of yam. So i didnt have a chance to taste it. 😂

Tried their signature dishes, and found their Heng hua style vermicelli and "ru mian" to be delicious. The sweet and sour pork was great as well, but the beancurd skin wig vegetable was average.

Compared with the Putien chain of restaurant, the prices here are way cheaper and of comparable taste - in fact I like their ru mian better.
Order their set meal for 2 and is great value for money. Come before 6.20pm if not their reataurant is usually packed with diner.

Rather disappointing experience that did not live up to the reviews and Google rating. Ordered four dishes:
-  Mongolian pork ribs : too dry
-beancurd with prawns : decent but nothing to rave about
-Heng Hua been Hoon: rather dry as well and not as nice as Pu Tien standard
-oyster omelette: fluffy and spongy but flavour is lacking.

Overall decent meal at affordable price but certainly not anything special.

Food above average but has given four stars as I find the pricing reasonable.

Worth a visit for all Heng Hua food lovers.

Ordered fried fish, bee hoon and lor mee.. nice.
Chrysanthemum tea niice too!!
Downside is just a bit too hot.
Food still good like before. No need to go Putien

Try the Xing Hua Beehoon and Lor mee! Definitely nicer than the other dishes. We ordered both medium size, $8. The lor mee is substantially a lot more and can probably be shared between 3 people while the beehoon can be shared between 2. The other dishes e.g. deep fried crispy prawn fritters $8 has no hint of prawns, just taste like regular Ngoh Hiang, and the stir fried white clams $10 with spicy sauce was very salty. There isn’t any queue when I went there on a weekday dinner.

Be prepared to wait for at least an hour to get a seat as it is very popular n the restaurant is quite small.  But it is worth the wait as the dishes r unique n delicious.  We ordered fried sweet yam n steam mee sua which r 😋 There r many more dishes that must try eg herbal prawn in bamboo stick, lychee pork, etc...

Love the duck here. Food is good. The service is very good!! The staff is attentive and polite. They checked to see if we have food allergies & explained some of the dishes to us. I dropped a pair of chopsticks and they replaced it before I could even call for help.

One of our regular restaurant that me & parents patronize regularly. These 2 dishes  are our favorite, and the taste has been consistent.

We are always happy to be served by one of their waitress, Ah Fun. She is courteous and helpful when taking our orders. Good service! Keep it up.

We ordered a three-pax signature dishes set meal, a six-course meal (excluding rice), it was just nice for my family of four (we are not really big eaters). We signed up for their membership ($88) - you will get $50 x 2 vouchers and a whole duck, which is quite worth it!

Absolutely no disappointment I can assure you as we been their regular all this while and each visit hasn't been a let-down with this vendor over the years.

🦆Their signature Angelica Herbal Roasted Duck is a must to order for the meat eaters, it was simply savoury, meats were tender and juicy, flavourful  and simply gratifying it's worthwhile your calories believe me lol😅😅😉🙃.

🌱The lettuce with oyster sauce were fresh and cruchcy stirred fried with fragranced wok hey (the charred after taste of the wok under high flames).

Sizzling hotplate beancurd with minced meat and Pickled Vegetables was delectable 😋.

It actually came with 2 rice but we ordered xtra YiFu Mee and it blended perfectly well with the roasted duck.

Home make Barley water was my favourite drink it's not too sweet and good to the taste.

I was at their branch at City Square Mall a month ago, i shall say that they were very consistent with their taste gastronomically, you don't see sub-standard throughout their outlets with my experienced. Kudos to the teams.

Damage was around💳 $62,  worthy for 2 pax.

Waitpersons were friendly and service was prompt, attentive and welcoming 😁😁😁good job!

It's lunch time and there's enough spaces between tables it can easily accommodate big group and its not rowdy and noisy here it's comfortable and relaxing.

Ambience was also hygienic, spacious and neat

Highly recommended if you are around.Try it NOW😁

🦆🐟🍤🌶🍗🍴🥢🧂🍅🥤
🧑‍🍳👨‍🍳🧑‍🍳👨‍🍳🧑‍🍳
👍👍👍👍👍
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Love the taste of the food. Taste healthy and delicious. I would definitely return to try the other food on the menu.
Hopefully they don’t increase the price further.
I would not recommend getting the membership if you do not come often as it is not very worth it.
We had 25% off during lunch. Order before 12:30pm on weekday. Service crew was efficient and good in recommending. 👍🏻after discount our bill was about $100.
Very nice variety of food selection, from vegetarian, egg, chicken, fish, goat, duck. Definitely good for dinning in group.

My first time eating here. Really enjoyed the duck with Angelica Herb. The sweet and sour pork was quite normal, but the assorted vegetables with seafood came with a generous portion of prawns. Overall I enjoyed my meal. It was made better by using the Chope voucher, paid $35 for $50 of value. Also got a $10 voucher (min $80 spend) for paying with my Citibank credit card.

Visited again and decided to post another new review with new menu they introduced. Early bird before 12.30pm on weekdays get 25% off. It was a long overdue CNY team lunch and we enjoy the foods and had great chat.

We order a la carte dishes from the menu, didn't manage to take all the food photos. However, here is the listing on top of what had posted, Fish maw soup with seafood and wheatgrass tofu with seafood.

The foods always amaze me with the ingredients used and enriched taste in all of them. The environment is cozy since we got the table near the window and we order the Bailey drinks that were really rich, must try.

Food taste is good but portion and price have seem to reduce and increase respectively. We ordered via FoodPanda a half of the Duck Roasted with Angelica Herb at $34 which honestly isn’t enough for 2-3 adults compared to 2 - 3 years back when we had them in the restaurants.

The service is quite excellent. I like that they do not squish the patrons which I like (you don't feel that others watching you eat). The duck has maintained the standard. The boiled soup is rather too salty. The rest of the food is quite average, the portions varies from dish.

Great hygiene, always good roast duck, never disappoint.
Slightly understaffed but every crew member was doing their best.
First charge to debone the duck.
Charge for extra herbal sauce on the duck, which could be complementary on request.
Great handmade jade tofu!
Still loved their roasted duck w angelica herb.
Crowded eating place in Northpoint City. Good to join their membership pavkage to get good offer, such as one duck roasted and 2 x $50 e-voucher but restricted in using the package.
30% off ala carte is worth it during weekdays off peak hours. As usual their signature herbal duck satisfies to no end. Match made in heaven with their moist & fluffy white rice.
The roast duck was AWESOME! That's probably the most important information you need to know
Love the duck.. Worth the money. Service is good but price a bit high.

I would like to take this opportunity to thank your staff (90787 Lee Yoke Chan) of the Northpoint branch.

We knew the crowd on a Sunday (15th May 2022) and we expect queuing for a while for a table of 10 pax for our 1st family dinner in 2 years.  After staying in the queue for 30 mins, Mdm Lee received us at front of the queue. She informed us that we will need to wait for around 1 hour plus as the restaurant had only 2 rooms with table that could accommodate 10 pax. She was very polite and even apologised for the long waiting time, as there was another family of 10 infront of us waiting for a table.

At around 7.30PM, Mdm Lee asked us if we would like to have a split table 5 + 5 as she wasn’t sure how long more we will need to wait for the next room. She was kind enough to offer us this arrangement as we were already waiting for 1.5 hour. We agreed to the arrangement, and while we were preparing to order, we noticed that the customer that was in the room had completed their meal and is leaving the room. Hence we asked Mdm Lee if we could change our table to the room. She kindly agrees to our request. We were told to wait outside the restaurant while she worked to clear the room for us.

While waiting outside, we heard that the other customer behind us (also with 10+ pax) shouted at Mdm Lee. They were unhappy that the room was given to us as we had already accepted the split table. They accused Mdm Lee of being unfair and they continue to hurl accusations, insults in Mdm Lee to the verge of tears. I am writing this feedback to clarify these points;

(1) Mdm Lee is acting professionally, and even so after continuous accusations and insults from customer

(2) Mdm Lee tries hard to accommodate request and provide solution to us and the other customer

(3) Mdm Lee do not deserve the insults and accusations made against her

(4) We were given the room because we were next in the queue and made the request to Mdm Lee

(5) We heard the other customer will be complaining against Mdm Lee, we would like to provide our side of the story

(6) We would like to thank Mdm Lee for her professionalism and apologise to her for the inconveniences caused to her

The tables are stained, not cleaned properly. The glass thingy in the middle in scratched, the room has mould building up around the place. The room inside looks like it hasn't been clean for 5 days or so. The staff is a mess. And the chill we order from the start of the meal didn't even come.
Cannot request to sit somewhere else even though having many empty table around. (Still not ordering)The waitress very rude and strictly cannot sit on other table. Very bad service.

Really love the staff services from this outlet.
Excellent services 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻 appreciate

Will definitely do another review for the food :)

Will be back.
Eating here on a weekday lunch is really peaceful. Enjoyed their set lunch alot.

went to have dinner on 29 march, was told to sit 1 side of the sofa as usual, food came, and i went over to the other side to take a pic for my sponse and was being told off rudely by the cashier staff i am not allow to even go over to take picture that i will be "fine" for doing so..

come on, its 29 march.. when new Covid safety measure has lighten, i was over for less than 5sec to jus take a picture..
Friendly staff Nice services.  But product was abit under my expectations. Not going back again.

Amazing service, the staff were really disciplined and responsive to our needs. Food was especially delicious, I would recommend the Mongolian spare ribs, the heavily peppered but not so overpowering taste of the sauce and crunch of the pork was absolutely delectable. I had an enjoyable late lunch with my family!

Taste of the food is so-so.. Quite average.. Food served was not hot indicating that the food may be left at the kitchen for awhile be serving.

To be honest I would say that going to the zhi char stall is better.

Dang Gui duck was a tad on the sweeter side.

Overall food is normal price is high. Won't return.
The staffs were friendly and attentive. Definitely a good experience

Had been dining quite frequently at Dian Xiao Er branches, and the standard has been consistent. Besides their tasty signature roast duck, their pan fried cod and petai prawns are good too. 😋 The dishes can be somewhat filling, so you have to know the portions they are serving before you get a good idea how much to order. Would recommend this place if you want to eat Chinese cuisine.

Had a family dinner for 5 adults and 1 toddler on Saturday, 1 May, at 5 p.m. We were allowed in only when everyone arrives.

Dishes ordered included their famous Dang Kui Duck, lotus and pumpkin with salted egg sauce, pork ribs without bone, cha siu, and soup of the day. Every dish tasted great. Even the white rice was steamed to keep it tasting great while many restaurants are merely serving rice from a big rice cooker.

The only think that needs improvement is their Chinese tea, we ordered the pu er, individual serving.  Doesn't taste like high quality tea.

We loved the food so much that we signed up for the $88 membership to get $50x2 vouchers and 4 small dishes of their roast duck. A one time 20% off for birthday month voucher is also given. We will definitely go back again.

The food is good but the service from a supervisor sux real bad. Very rude and loud. Take note most seats do not have back rest, chair not suitable for elderly. We changed the seats to those with back rear as we have 4 elderly diner and was scolded by the young supervisor and an elderly China waitress. Suggest to avoid Yishun Dian Xiao Er and go another branch instead or try Putien further down the corner which is a grade higher.
Not suitable to hold business meal here due to the low service standard.
Enjoyed our meal with great-tasting dishes especially the duck. Prices are very reasonable and very good services and warm welcome by waitress. We would visit again for sure 👍👍👍

Suggest to avoid Northpoint branch if you have more than 5 pax but sitting separately. They won’t accept even though the group is going to be split into less than 5 with the same household and sit apart.
Waited for quite after I was sitted before someone attended to me for my order and the seats are not comfortable...a bit stuffy and warm.

Service was excellent!

Dishes tried:
XO fried rice - very good!
XO French bean - delicious!
Marmite chicken - fried chicken with marmite sauce, not bad.
Claypot eggplant - oily, generous with minced meat. Eggplant was soft. Not so good.

Bad attitude from staff, was waiting for takeaway orders. Kept having to ask if our order is ready, staffs said no but later on we found out it was ready long ago.

When took back home, found out that one of the rice packet was not air tight secured. Circuit breaker is a dangerous time, would you dare to eat dishes which are not well contained and exposed to the air surroundings of a covid infested mall?
One of the best meals i ever had. Every single dish was delicious. Prompt and efficient service. Will definitely return, thank you ! ;)
Best roast duck at northpoint branch
Go to place for the duck. Price is not cheap, but for the quality and service, it is not too bad!
Soft and tasty herbal duck. the mongolian ribs are nice oo.
It's not bad. The food is good, service good. The tables are rather small though. 7 people eaten at a table of 4 is rather squeeze....
My favorite roast duck place. Loved the dong bo rou too... Service has always been pretty good and food is served on time .
Been told by the staff waiting time half an hour but ended up become one hour waiting time. It is better to order first at home then come and collect. Don’t waste one hour to waiting here .
Great good and excellent service ! Value for money.
Yummy food paired with exceptional service
Service is good, will keep remind you the new pour tea is hot.. food not bad and the food serving is fast. Place is clean and comfortable. Will come again
Delicious duck roasted with angelice herb 👍👍👍
Best duck and chasiew ever!
Always love their dang gui  ya
A pretty good meal with great tasting dishes.  The prices are very reasonable.  I would go there again for sure 👍👍👍
Excellent Herbal Angelic duck, assam fish, baked cod fish fish maw soup. Good service. pricey though

great surprise to find a legit sichuan food restaurant in this area! The 酸菜鱼 is extremely affordable and good ($14), highly recommend! The cucumber side dish was a bit too vinegary for my taste though

Delicious and affordable Chinese food. The quality is comparable to many fancy restaurants, at a fraction of the price. Below $50 for 2-3 pax. Highly recommend the boiled sliced fish, potato salad and pig ears salad. I bought their frozen dumplings previously - which were very good as well.

no more xiao long bao :(

- skewers were nice but quite pricey. also the seasoning they use is the same, just the veggie is different. seasoning is VERY salty.
- chives & egg: looks totally different from the menu. portion is huge. no chives taste.
- la zi ji (辣子鸡) is fried popcorn chicken kind. so-so, i wouldn’t buy it again
- 饺子 is not bad, q big. $8 for 12

Came here to eat instead of 福满苑餐馆 which is just a few blocks away as I saw the 烧烤 aka BBQ skewer.
Ordered the chicken, beef, pork and mutton, but taste like a really bad knock off version of the China skewers. (After my meal I did feedback to the boss which the boss just said "of course China and Singapore spices different").
Also tried the Jia Jiang mian and the fried La mian. Was really bad, even my China friend that was eating with me was like saying this is not China food!
Overall would say this is probably like localized food inspired by China dishes.

The price is pretty affordable. Ordered the sour vegetable sliced fish soup, portion is big enough for 3 at a decent price, but the taste is normal and is not flavourful enough to go with white rice. Tried the dried wok chicken and the parts is mostly boney, suitable for older people who likes to eat on bones instead of meat. Skewer is very small in portion, not recommend to order. The pork which return to the wok is average also, I find it's not spicy enough to go with rice

Super worth it by taste, price and quantity comparison.
Diced spicy chicken was super delicious and fragrant.
Sweet vinegar pork rib was a little tough but still okay.
Five spice la mian tasted much better with the chilli's available.
Pigs ears salad was amazing! Spicy, crunchy and refreshing.
Chilli wantons could have been better if they added in more chilli oil and vinegar.
Food is really not bad just that the staffs lacks EQ and abit rude. If you don't mind service and just want some food, this could be a possible choice

Extremely worth it lunch. 12 fat, juicy fried pork and vegetable dumplings for $5. Help yourself to the shredded ginger and vinegar at the condiment station.
Enjoyed the ma po tofu as well. It's not overly spicy, but has enough peppercorns for a good kick.
Their rice is also quite pearly and of good quality.
#localguides
Yummy food. There is always a queue for this. Surprisingly, the food comes very quickly so the wait isn't that long. I love the taste of the jiaozi.
Yummy dumpling and super affordable! Kailan also good but a lot of stalks✌. Overall, service was fast, staff friendly, however, should learn more basic english😊. Keep the foods tasty and affotdable.
Inexpensive nice food. Beside lamian, they have many other food like fried fish, ma la tofu..etc. only con is place too small.
BBQ sticks taste great..
Cheapest jiao zhi / wo tie you can find in Singapore. Very popular amongst the PRC community. The rice dishes came in large portions.
Food is good. For the area and environment, it's a bit expensive
Salt and pepper ribs good, dumplings worth coming back for.
Taste no bad and price is reasonable

one of most reasonable priced eatery in Yishun.  Managed by mainlander Chinese, the food is tasty (not salty), generous portions.  My favourites have been the cucumber side dish with garlic, vinegar and parley (great appetizer), the dumplings - steamed or fried are just as great and the noodles!!  There are too many to list out.  Try it out - before noons on weekdays and prepare to queue on weekends!!
The lamian is good but taste could have been better
noodle and rice good and portion great
Price is reasonable. Most of the ramen is about $5. No GST no SVC. Taste is nice and worth trying
Wanton soup is good but the mix meat ramen is not value for money as it is just a normal dry noodle with very little meat. Not recommended to try the met ramen
Spent 50 dollars for 4 persons, including zhajiang mian, pork rib ramen, jiaozi, dumpling noodle, tsingdao beer... Good value!
Love the authentic chinese food! Price is very reasonable. Must try the dumplings!

Liked it. Good value. Guo tie was cheap and large portion.

#localguides #heartlandfood #goodvalue
The taste is good, the price is good, and the service attitude is too bad
Nice Chinese cuisine! Mostly mainland China dishes. Highly recommended!!! Will be back for more.
good，not expensive, beer Qingdao $6 one bottle,
Good chinese food stall with reasonable price, generous portion, taste good and authentic
Comparable taste to other similar stalls but has quite a lot of customers.
Authentic taste
Wide variety of Shan Dong cuisine. Don't miss the steam dumpling and Xiao long bao there!
Ambience and the Dishes are still same… good!
Food taste almost authentic to those i had in china
Food not bad, portion is quite big
Food not really nice and environment is not cosy!
Delicious Chinese food! The fried dumpling and xiao long bao are a MUST TRY!
Very good Chinese food.
Value for money. Taste quite good
Yummy and cheap china food. Highly recommended
Nice food. Great staff
Cheap and Nice
Reasonable price with good food
Cheap and nice delicious food
I like their xiao long bao than DTF
hot and spicy mala fish
Superb tasting food.
Food is good
Food nice n cheap
Not bad..
Nice food

Nice Chinese seafood restaurant with good and prompt service. Offers Al fresco dining as well. Tried the crispy pork and roast duck and they were above expectations. Otherwise other dishes like chili crab were good but not great.

Food here is better than the average Chinese restaurant, and there were certain dishes that stood out. One of them was definitely the hor fun which had a good wok hei and the sweetness from the vegetables really complemented the dish well. The duck was also really tender and the skin was crisp. I think the volcano chicken was average and the KL
Hokkien mee is definitely a miss from me. I sat indoors and the restaurant got a little stuffy as the lunch crowd came. Overall it’s a decent place to have a meal, but there’s limited parking available and reservations are recommended if indoor seating is preferred.

You know this feeling... when everything just went your way. Popped by for dinner with family after the ST article's  and boy, we truly enjoyed ourselves. Ordered the signatures and EVERY SINGLE DISH HIT THE SPOT for us. The outstanding ones are the sotong and lady finger chincalok, poached pork, KL dai lok mee paired with the oh so good and spicy sambal and the other ni. Ingredients are fresh, and the taste is natural just nicely balanced by the sauces and spices, without being overly salty, or sweet. Service is also impeccable, spacious and ambience makes for a fun evening dinner with good conversations.  Will definitely return to try the other dishes.

My first time dining in here and it was superb! It’s has the local Chinese restaurant vibe, place was immaculate and their staff were friendly and efficient. The menu had many varieties, like the geoduck sashimi which I thought was pretty cool! The food was fragrant and tasty, I really enjoyed the garlic pork and the duck! their de-shelled cereal prawn and dark sauce hokkien mee was good too. For dessert, we had mango pudding and I must say it exceeded my expectations. I’ll definitely come back here again and recommend to friends.

Was thinking this is a zicha place but didn't expect it to be a Chinese restaurant. And parking is super horrible here so please come here in public transport. Unless you're willing to pay for valet which is wth .... lol

But that aside, food is super good!! Every dish hits the spot, esp the yam ring, fried garlic pork and duck!!
Very nice tasty dishes. Eveyone of us likes this place. Dessert was so-so on the other hand. Still, it's a good restuarant to patronise.

Been coming for quite a bit. The food is awesome and the service is superb. The outdoor dining ambience and decor makes me feel as if I'm in Phuket.
Do try the curry fish head... no regrets.
Highly recommended.
The duck is not bad... The pork chops here with the green chilli sauce are really delicious! 👍
The lobster bee Hoon is very good, must try. Charcoal bean curd also unique and worths try

Quite a gem to be located far from town. Served warmly local cuisine that we all familiar with in Zhi Char. The price commanded quite high compare to the standard of the food. Came here multiple times and probably I have tried the Irish such and field KL Hokkien noodle the best! Don’t miss these 2 dishes. The fry chives with prawn was disappointing. Prawn is way over cooked and taste hard. The fry fermented tofu pork is too dry.. over frying ! The chili cockles was so so as it is too small for you to feel shiok especially the sauce used wasn’t prepared well. The fry salted egg fish skin can be improved as the skin not as crispy. The pork collar is rather so so and bland. The ouster way too big to enjoy and not briny! Disappointing wither the soon hock fish, overcooked and the meat kind too tough and dry. The other plus point was the corkage is free and friendly restaurant owner to cheer with you from time to time.

Great food but a tad too costly. going through the menu u will find prices x2 x3 x4 of usual prices. I personally thought twice about many dishes that I would have love to try. I would frequent if the cost is a bit more reasonable.
Enjoyed the braised lobster with bee hoon and leek ($120 for 1.2kg). The soup had a nice flavour. The spinach with three eggs was good.
Food is decent, price is at the higher side.

Dishes were 50-50 hit and miss. Hostess at reception seem disorganised and covid precautions need to improve.
Service seems lacking on a busy evening (late to order, missing drink orders) but improved once other tables cleared.

Food was decent. But in the middle after serving second or third dish, the food stopped coming for about 30minutes and children were left hungry and we were left waiting there for a long time when only half-done with lunch. In the end, we were told 2 of the dishes were OOS and we had to cancel.

Having Chinese New Year reunion dinners in restaurants are rarely pleasant experiences. This year's experience was no better, despite a recommendation that Famous Kitchen's food was supposed to be good.

We chose the $318 menu for 4, and had to top up an additional $79.50 because its on a per pax basis and we totalled 5. No sharing. Fair enough, I thought.

We were told to be seated by 4.45pm as dinner will start promptly at 5pm. It started around 5.10pm when all tables were filled. We felt like we were in a Chinese wedding banquet. The food streamed in unison.

Salmon yusheng was fine. No surprises there.

When they dished out the crabmeat fish maw soup, it came in a small pot which hardly filled 5 bowls. It could have filled 4 nicely. And mind you we paid for 5 pax.

Fish was OK. No surprises there too.

Broccoli was over cooked. Mushroom was  soaked way too long. Sea cucumber was acceptable. Portion seems to be for 4.

Noodles was for 3 pax. No garnishing. Plain appalling and forgetful.

Dessert was sugary water decorated with bits of fungus and chestnuts.

Service started out fine, courteous and prompt in the beginning but ended up rushed. We felt as though the restaurant had run out of plates as they were clearing them as fast as dishes were served.

Sorry for the long post. For almost $500, it was outrageous and for a first timer visiting this eatery, consider it my last. I'm surprised a renown brand will wager their reputation to stage reunion dinners like these. Shameful.

To be fair, I find it quite difficult to award 5 stars for take-aways as food quality is usually compromised during travelling but this restaurant deserves at least 4.5 stars. My family loves the deep-fried pork belly with fermented beancurd with garlic skin on. The noodles were a little on the bland side but that's okay because chilli padi and sambal sauces were given to complement the taste. The wok fried squid with chinchalok is a unique item on any zi char menu!

A nice restaurant with great food. Love the cockles here and their fried garlic pork. Best of all, it is a good place to chill at the famous Hangout with these food to enjoy the sunset after a long day at work. Will be back again.

A Chinese restaurant located in a rather quiet and unusual part of Sembawang Road. Business was good though even on a Thursday night. Interesting dishes like preserved vegetables steamed fish, lobster Beehoon, and onion salad stood out from the rest.
My only gripe is the limited parking lots - I had to do valet parking.

We were there during Father's Day celebration. The service of restaurant is still great even though they were very busy. As for the food, I think the kitchen is overwhelmed, thus the standard is not as good as normal day.

Good food there especially the assam fishhead🥰 the service there is not good even though the owner kept talking to us but the waitress didnt serve the tea or change the plate as norm. The price is ok but consider the service than it’s not worrhy😉

Quite disappointing.. the food which i ordered here taste sadly poor compared to their sister restaurant at Capitol Piazza’s Famous Treasure. KL noodles is too sweet and no wok hei fragrant. Flower crab is having promotion, buy 1 get 1, is a joke. when serve on our table i really got shock of my life. Why? Is just so small small small. The crab size is like abt 1/3 size of wat i had at capitol.  Really sad is so small and the chef overcook it and the meat become dry and shrink. And taste really no match to capitol. The only best dish is the black tofu. Maybe the chefs specialized are different at different restaurant??
Impressed by almost every dish! 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻😋😋😋
We tried the CNY menu here and found the dishes very delicious. The chef combine chinese cooking from different region of china. From fish to roast chicken , surpringly good and yummy.
Not your usual tasting restaurant. Some dishes are possibly unique to them. Salt baked flower crab 4@52. Pretty good. 3.5ish to 4... Crab and pork with garlic are towards 4.
Love the great variety of hawker food that are value for money and great tasting too! Definitely will revisit soon!
Nice foods and the laopan niang very friendly.
After long walk to Upper Seletar Reservoir and beautiful sunset view, the delicious food in this restaurant is a special bonus.
Very nice ambience with awesome dishes tastifully done.
Had this seafood pot recently and its taste was really refreshing. Slightly sour and spicy at the same time. The ingredients were fresh and certainly goes with a bowl of white rice!

The Famous Kitchen!
Maybe due to covid issue, not much ppl dine in. Food here was nice. I had choose the KL Da lu mee, assam fish and dessert is the O née (sweet yam paste).
DA lu mee got enough wok hey, taste exactly like what I have tasted in KL.
Assam fish not so sour as what I like. Fish is fresh also.
Not to be said, till now I still miss the yam paste.
Those who see this post should go and have a try.
Good food at reasonable prices. Most impressed by the baked flower crabs. Very good har Cheong gai too. Salted veg fish stew is nice, but cost ~$100.
There are some unique dishes that worth a try at the famous kitchen. However quite disappointed with one  "unfresh" flower crab that was mixed in our order!

The restaurant has been here for quite sometime. A little gem with many signature dishes e.g. the KL Hokkien Flat Noodles, Sour Vegetable Steamed Fish, etc. My favourite dish is the salted baked flower crabs, which is not commonly found in the restaurants. You can get really big and meaty ones if the season is right. Another dish I have tried is the baked bee hoon which is as good as it sounds. Another of their specialty is the spicy chilli belacan. Bona petit.

We've been here on many occasions ever since we got to know of the restaurant from Michelle Chong's social media. The Sembawang restaurant is our usual go to. There's quite a plethora of dishes but somehow we always end up ordering (not in order of preference): chilli cockles, fermented beancurd fried pork, sour vegetables fish, any tofu dish, dai lok KL noodles 安salt baked flower crab. They have an extensive alcohol list as well, which we did not fully explore (being family occasions if I'm there) but for those interested, great place to pair drinks with their food too.

Fresh and good crabs. Order the Sri Lankan crab if you go to avoid disappointment in case if full house booking.
