We had chilli crab, pepper crab and butter crab. Crab meat was thick and yummy. The butter crab had crispy crumbs which were really good.  The chilli crab sauce was so delicious and the mantou to dip in...yum yum
Book in advance as restaurant could be full like our visit tonight.
Quality of food has declined. What is that Michelin guide about? Plus - the cockroaches outside their establishment? Avoid this place. Mediocre tzechar fare at restaurant prices
Food is delicious.. live seafood.. nice service. Will definitely go back again

I'm not sure about the high rating for this place, perhaps I didn't order the correct dishes or the dishes are not to my liking. The dishes I had were just okie - sweet and sour pork, Assam fish, french beans, fried chicken Italian style ?! (The sauce was strange ), corn soup, tofu and fruit platter. I prolly won't come here again.

The Famous Fried Rice I ordered was one of the best I've ever eaten. However, nothing else really caught my attention, but do keep in mind that I am a very fussy eater. The rest of the table agreed that the food was amazing and they also praised it for its generous portion and cheaper price.

If you plan to eat dinner here, either make a reservation or come extra-early or you will not manage to get a table. Nearly every large table had a "Reserved" sign on it when I walked in.

The parking spots right outside get filled up fast, and the closest alternative (slight farther down the street, behind the restaurant) costs 60 cents per hour. There is a valet outside the restaurant that will gladly help.
Food is Good. Volcano Chicken is a must. Seafood is very fresh. Service is excellence.
Good quality is quite good .. service is good too .. was there in the VIP room and service is really good and attentive too .. will patronise again

Brought my family here on a quiet Monday afternoon. Place was as expected not crowded. Ordered the yellow chieve hor fan ($12) and hot plate tofu . Oh mine, was pretty speechless. The hor fan had no ingredients at all! Only bean sprout. The tou fu was so pathetic, that even the egg layer that comes with hot plate, was so paper thinly spread, that I suspect they barely used half an egg on it. For a moment, I thought I has ordered paper prata.

I am pretty sure this will be my last visit to this place. I had came before few years ago, and it wasn't this terrible to my memory. Perhaps the management had changed 🤔

The only saving grace to this place, is the lack of crowd, and the aircon 😀
Reservations made online on Quandoo are not entitled to existing promos or discounts.. No reservations needed anyway, they are very empty.
Very good teochew-thai cuisine...can come often.
like the fried  pork belly in fermented sauce and garlic prawns and signature thick black KL noodles amd steam chicken
Had fish head curry. V awesome. Also took the pork belly which was super super awesome. Wish I took photos but would return. Many times.

I don’t understand how this restaurant clocked 4.1 based on reviews. Neither the food or service is worth that much.

Came with 2 young kids in tow for lunch after a zoo outing.

I placed an order for crispy silver bait ( salted and pepper in direct translation) with less pepper sand explained that my kids don’t take spicy food. The dish was served  tossed with chopped chilli padi and rejected since the kids can’t take spicy food. Let’s take this as an oversight from the staff and move on.

The young server passed the dish to another waitress in bob hair and explained the situation. The bob hair waitress decided she need to investigate the situation and brought another 2  colleagues along to discuss. So, we had 3 persons standing at our table discussing while we were trying to have a meal. I find this behaviour to be unacceptable at a restaurant. Even busy cafes have better service standards.

The staff then tried noisily to sort it out with the kitchen which was situated 1 table away from us and separated by a folding screen. I couldn’t take it and feedback to the staff to sort out the issue quietly. The staff wasn’t able to understand my comment and brought back the bob hair waitress.

The bob hair waitress came back and defended her approach saying she needed to sort out the issue that’s why she had to look at the food order. I agreed but do it without fanfare.

She took the comment away and brought some colleagues to the folding screen to ‘talk’ about my comment. The folding screen blocks view ,not noise. I can hear everything that was being discussed. It’s unprofessional. An experienced customer service staff should conduct themselves better.

The food quality is average and portions are small. Hokkien Mee was their signature dish but it was a tad too sweet for my liking. Grilled pork portion was good but really small. There was a dozen slivers and certainly not the small chunks shown in the menu. The fried fish bait was nicely fried with no hint of pepper on its second try. Restaurant was only 20% occupied when I visited.

To be fair, the younger staff were diligent in changing plates, taking orders and serving customers. If the restaurant wants to do better, more attention needs to paid to its customer service level. Hire more qualified staff to lead the restaurant. The quality of food will not be able to attract returning customers. There are also stiff competition on the same stretch of road. Lots of cafes at Brooks I and Brooks II. Parking at the restaurant is also limited. We came at 12:30 and was able to secure a lot. Carpark was full when we left at 2pm.

Future goers, receipt attached. Even a MacDonald’s meal is more worth it. 吃了一肚子气和火

I just realised the receipt was changed to reflect the order as spicy. The original food order was printed less pepper. Not a honorable move by the restaurant. If the food order never reflected less spicy elected, I’m sure the waitress would not have entertained  me when I rejected my dish.

Enjoyed the food and service. They introduced 30-50% on signature dishes during the stabilisation phase so quite worth it. Had the curry fish head - half at $18++ portion was big. Garlic pork, squid with ladies finger also tasty.
Nice food, finally found the closest KL Hokkien Noodle in Singapore

Nice ambience. Only managed to try the sharkfin soup, fried squid and seafood bee hoon since only 2 of us. Food was OK but the sharkfin soup was served warm instead of piping hot. The bee hoon needs improvement. Price is acceptable. Service was OK. The craft beer was nice though not cold enough.
Nice open air ambience. Big restaurant with lots of dining space by the pond. Food prices are restaurant style steep. Food quality is alright.
Nice Nices n good place for gathering.

Great place to chill out with friends. Their seafood is pretty decent and fresh. I like the razor clam dish, they cooked just right and it's fresh too. This dish price is pretty cheap compare other seafood restaurant. Price is reasonable and service is okay.

There are hits and miss on my visit to this restaurant. Firstly i made a reservation at 3pm on the same day dinner but was given a seat near the entrance away from the pond which i prefer. No Queue when i reached at 7pm as this venue can hold quite a number of patrons. Order was taken fast and served promptly. London duck was served tender with sweet mango sauce. But the pieces was cut rather huge with bones therefore tougher to eat with utensils. As for the spinach with eggs and clams, taste just so-so like any other zhi char. As for the triple mushroom with asparagus, it has a unique truffle flavour gravy which rarely found in other zhi char stores. The pomelo mango dessert was poor standard with dried pomelo and no mango cubes to bring out the sweetness of this dessert. If have the chance, should give a try to the other famous dishes from this past Google reviews.
Very laid back atmosphere and fantastic food. Prices at the average seafood restaurant level. Chilli crab, prawn vermicelli, peking duck were pretty nice

Service and ambience is good but I feel that the price is on the high side since the Trio Sauce Chicken had many pieces of bony chicken for $14. Taste is OK.
Best dish for us was three egg vegetable.
Hokkien mee was OK too but not much ingredients.
Overall, I think you are paying for the setting and service.

Highly under staff. Service is very slow. Our cooked food took a while to reach and the beer comes later than cooked stuff, something that no need to cook comes later than the cooked ones is super weird. We need to call for the server a few times before we were "noticed".

Came here as a family group for birthday celebration. Food quality is expected given the price. Place is not crowded even though it is Sunday weekend lunch time. The server will share his opinions and to me may seem a bit too talkative. Otherwise I'll score it a bit more for service. There is no option for air conditioned seats so come prepared. BTW, it's now named tasty loong. Had problem finding the place until we noticed the new name plastered over the poster. It may be under new management.

There are other options available around the vicinity if you are looking for family friendly seafood restaurants so it's going to be tough for the rebranded restaurant.

Food was worst than I think. Rice were solid is nvm, but hard to chew and you might can swollow with water. The only thing I like is the deco of the table. **If you are not a fan of seafood or hate seafood, MY ADVISE IS NEVER EVER EAT IN THIS RESTRAUNT PLEASE!** It was horrific filled with seafood and I found meatless. Also, the rice I've mention earlier is fried rice, whoch wiol contain eggs, right? NO! Theres no eggs! Everything is meatless! Please for god sake if you hate seafood PLEASE DO NOT COME HERE. That's all.
Place says Hops&Belly but receipt says Long Jiang Chinos. Nice ambience at night. Quiet and peaceful.
Tasty food that is a highlight of the vicinity

We came for lunch on a weekday, it was almost deserted. Some dishes were fairly okay like the roast chicken. There was this salted fish tofu claypot that was quite odd and did not have any salted fish taste or bits.
Ambience is okay. Service could be improved. Some of the seafood or fish pricing seemed high.

Order some dishes like vegetable, fish skin, fried rice and noodle. Fish skin is serve promptly but the vegetables are serve after 25min of waiting had to complain to the manager to get them to prepare the rest of the food which took more than 40min to serve fried rice .. the noodle is not even prepared yet.. had to ask them for plain rice for my son first while waiting.. guess we aren't paying enough for the restaurant to notice our order..

Cheesy crab bee hoon and clay pot mutton are pretty disappointing. The cheese seems to have overpowered the sweetness of crab in the soup. Mutton was just overly salty. Ordered 5 dishes at 6.30 but only finished the meal at 8.30 due to slow serving of food. Was a busy day evening for the staff and so had to remind them several times for our beer and food. Although the service staff did their best to be friendly and helpful but ultimately it is the food that we came for. Not worth coming.
Good place to eating.....enjoy
Nice place to have a family dinner once awhile. Bring your clients to enjoy a local Chinese food. Surrounding environment is good by the big fishing pond at side.
So far the best Chinese buffet I had. Going to book for birthday lunch or dinner and hope that they allow dine in by november
Very bad service. Food quality has also gone down!
Nice casual dining setup. Good food and good service from the staff.

Invite friends from oversea for Dinner on 9th Nov, arrived and order 5 dishes at 7:48pm (time is printed on order receipt),after waiting for nearly 1hr,1st dishes serve ,2nd dishes serve another 20mins later, 3rd & 4th another 20mins later, last dishes was cancel by me, very very bad experience, will never come back to here again and inform others not to dine in here.
The signature bee hoon taste good, goes with the special gravy. Nice ambience, lake view
A restaurant with nice and tasty food. Price is reasonable and not crowded. Love the location and free parking!
Great seafood, and local cuisine.  I'm told it's some if the best in Singapore, and hard to get into without a reservation.
Overall nice place. Can choose a seat near screen during weekends for soccer matches.
Wonderful Chinese food here. Love the beef! Very specific menu, and they do every dish to perfection

Food not worth your time and money.
Signature dish - Chilli Crab too salty and crab meat tasteless.
The service is very slow. For the pricing, we can get a better taste at another place.
Nice scenery....good and friendly service....food is very good....
Good and helpful staff make your day with them.
Very good sea food place must try
Food are nice and price are cheap!!!
Nice place to chill but snacks is expensive and average tasting.
go this place enjoy it's vary good restaurant and bar
Nice ambience n nice food
Nice view n great food...
Good service. Food just OK.
Great food and cool ambience
Nice View
Food are way to ex. It's normal as zi cha
Nice view n service is great!
Nice resturant with nice fresh sea food
Friendly services. Food good.
Nice place good food.
Good food but expensive
Good service & food.
Good place value for money.
$$$ food wise nothing special.
Nice place. Taste goog.
expensive!!! expensive!!! expensive!!! It's not worth the price

The food was nice but little bit salty for the noodles and their staffs are friendly. They are busy as business is good. Need to improve on their alertness, like refilling of tea. Raises my hands a few time, also cannot catches their attention, almost want to give them a call to fill my tea.

V awesome dining experience. Staffs were attentive and food were served fast. We had an enjoyable dinner. I like the soup alot. The restaurant even served free kid meal. cabbage mushroom rice with daopok as sides. Yam with duck was excellent too.

Putien (Northpoint City)
The food are serve very well, not too greasy nor bland. Absolutely the taste of Putien. Environment are suitable for family or friend to gathering. The waiters all serving us very well, they will keep on changing the dish for us to make sure we have a good experience to enjoy the food. It really feel like a VIP when we enter to the restaurant. Definitely will come back again

I ordered the ‘100-Second’ Stewed Yellow Croaker on promotion for $8. The soup although little, is extremely sweet from the fresh fish. The fish is very soft and smooth with great texture but many bones. Not for those who are fearful of fish bones.

As indicated on their website, "This signature PUTIEN dish is carefully boiled to precision at 100 seconds. It allows one to taste the true freshness of the yellow croaker. The original taste of the fish is accentuated, with the dish’s light seasoning of using onions, ginger, Fujian aged wine and Puning bean sauce. The perfect pairing of the tender fish with the sweet broth is best enjoyed piping hot upon serving."

I also ordered another 2 seasonal dishes, Spicy Fried Duotou Clams (UP $26.80), "Tossed over high fire, with just a touch of spice. A must-try!" and Putian Farmhouse Clam Soup (UP $28.80), "A traditional farmhouse recipe. Taste the delicate freshness of the clams in the soothing smooth soup." Both dishes when ordered together is $43.80

Both dishes are nice. The soup is not too salty and I packed half the portion since I can't finish it alone even without rice. The Spicy Fried Duotou Clams is actually a stir fried dish. I decided to remove all shells before eating with the sweet garlic snd spring onions. To me, it isn't spicy at all, tasted just like a little light sprinkling of pepper.

The chrysanthemum tea ($3.80) is non-sweeten and refillable. I like it that they don't add sugar to it.

Overall, I had a quiet lunch as I went in before noon. The staff were polite and able to advise me on my selection how the clam should be cooked as they have 9 ways of preparing it.

The food tasted good without making me very thirsty afterwards. Be prepared to pay a little more for better quality food. I paid $65.45 for my lunch today. The portion is sufficient for 2 pax with rice.

Been here a couple of times, round tables with cushion seat is quite squeezy for 7 adults + 2 kids, do request for non-cushioned seats for large group.

Lor Mee was fantastic as usual, standard is always the same. Must orders are the Braised Pig Intestines, Sweet & Sour Pork with Lychee, Stir Fried Yam.

Kids always have a set meal for them, usually either fried rice or porridge.

Desserts are veryyyy mehhhhh, can skip on this.

Located in the North Wing of North Point Shopping Centre.
The service was good and attentive. The staffs would ensure the water was filled up, the food was served fast, emptied dishes were cleared fast. Didn’t expect that Putien service standard to be so high.
The dishes were good. The lor mee was fantastic, both the traditional (white colour) and the listed type on the menu (red colour) were very good. The clams cooked with salt were nice. Enjoyed the food very much.
Another great experience with Putien.
Excellent place to have a great meal.

One of our favourite family restaurant in SG. Staffs are all very professional, polite & leaves u a good impression. Restaurant is clean & cosy too!

Putien has seasonal menu. Other than the usual White Lor Mee, there's many other new dishes throughout the year. I love how innovative their menu planner is!

As for food wise, we always go for the White Lor Mee, Fried Tenggiri Fish, Shredded Pork with Sesame Bun, Bian Rou Soup etc. It's always sooooo good! My kids love the Fried Tenggiri Fish alot! They are always asking for more! Oh yes, I love how they slice (in cubes) the Tenggiri Fish before they fry it. This makes it easy for kids to consume! Btw they have FREE kids meal. It's a Cabbage rice with Braised beancurd & comes with a refillable barley drink.

Price wise I think it's reasonable given thar it's tasty & the portion is good for 2. I highly recommend u to Putien too!

We were early 1105am so decided to wait for the restaurant as there were seats outside. 1 of the lady service crew came over as she was on her way out to the ladies toilet and ask in Chinese why are you here for? 你们来做什么？Obviously waiting for your restaurant to operate as you open at 1130am to have a meal on 人曰. 2 of my aunties were already saying then we come here for what if it’s not for lunch. 🙄 anyway the staff just casually replies by saying “you all know we operate at 1130am” we nodded. Hmmm…. I think she can put it in a nicer way lor. Anyway we order the set meal and food was acceptable. Btw, my 2 aunties are regulars at this branch as they pointed which staff recommended which dish and they both love it on their previous visit.

My first time at Putien yishun. I have visited other outlets and service is consistent! Good as always. I usually start off with a cup of tei guanyin. My staple dish is lychee sweet and sour pork! We tried a different dish too this time, claypot steam beancurd. It is really delicious! Fried beehoon is also not to be missed! I would buy their beehoon and cook it at home too.
Crispy sesame bun with pork slices and onions is also really tasty! A place to go to when i have a vegetarian day too!

Tried the cny takeaway with pen cai for 6 pax. The food was superb, the portion is more than enough for my family, and the service and care taken by the staff and chef was heart warming. The chef even asked if we were consuming within the next 30mins or later, and package/put in the ingredients in accordance. Thumbs up to the Chef and Pu Tien team at Northpoint.
Were here for Chinese New Year Reunion Dinner, the service is good and prompt. The best dish is the Noodles, it is so good i had 2 servings !

very friendly and kind staff who made us feel welcomed despite running a full house. gave our little one free balloon, a princess toy and even Complimentary desserts. food was awesome as always and service was speedy.
Nice food! The service was good and attentive (静雪was extremely friendly). Highly recommended!

Excellent service in introducing food and meeting specific dietary requirements by Ms Zhang Lan.

Food is nice.
Special mention on lor mee, starters, chilli and tea...

Had a quick lunch at Putien and looks like they had revamped the menu. I’ve asked to veganized these dishes and was pleased to find the dishes were still very flavorful and delicious.
Staff are well informed of the term vegetarian and vegan making the order taking such a breeze.

Food was not bad service of the person who brought us to out table was very good!

However the person who serve the dish just place our dish on the table loudly and have some kind of attitude. 😑 dropped the spoon the the table when putting the dish and did not even help us to pick it up and not apologetic at all.

The fruit platter for birthday was nice however the cherry tomatoes were not good and tip of it turning black. 😔 Disappointed.

This outlet has the best service so far. Putien’s staffs are generally very service oriented, you get good service at any outlet you visit. Am here for my favourite white cabbage soup tonight besides the usual good stuffs.
Good for family and friends meal together. Food delicious. Loved the Braised Yellow 💛 Croacker fish the most.  And the fried Yellow Croacker. Excellent ! Cooked to perfection 😋
Nice food to try out.. it suits older generation as well so recommend to bring parents or grandparents for a nice meal!
Superb food quality and customer service as always. Food is served on time and hot. Never fail to impress me @ NPC.

July 2022: LOVE the durian dessert!! Unfortunately it is not often available - was really happy to be able to order it at this outlet. However, the durian paste was still frozen and too hard to eat. Had to use a lot of strength to break the durian cube apart to eat. I had it in another outlet and the instead was creamy and molten but yet still stiff enough to keep a cube shape.

I've eaten at Putien many times, great meal each time. This is the first time ordering "to-go", and I'm reviewing during covid time when quality and service matters the most. The food were packed in an insulated bag. Container material and design was of quality, the sweet and sour sauce was separated from the meat (not shown in photo). Chopsticks were solid wood. I really appreciate the restaurant's position to maintain the quality in their food and brand. 👍🏼
solid food. best 咕噜肉 anywhere honestly meat is tender batter is thin

Had dinner with family at Northpoint outlet. Very impressed by the service of 静雪 and Xiaoli. They were very cheerful and attentive to our needs. Took initiative to offer fruits and freebies and plated out the birthday cake which we bought. The team even sang song for us and prepared a hat made from balloons. After that, they helped us pack the leftovers nicely. Best service and comparable to 海底捞...
The service today is excellent! Has a team lunch here. From food recommendations and attentiveness of service.

Had a pleasant birthday dinning experience. Food is great (not too salty). Particularly liked the yellow croaker fish, which is very fresh and tender. The service staff went the extra mile to play the birthday song and sang birthday wishes with us. They also gave us a free fruit platter.

Superb food and service! Food is not too salty nor sweet it’s really palatable and feels healthy! Service is also good and staff are all very friendly! Would like to commend a staff Wei Li Hui as she provided exceptional friendliness and does check up on customer food and service satisfaction. Overall I recommend people to dine in at Putien Northpoint!

Good food though a bit on the salty side.. service also can give 4.5 stars out of 5.. but the last month I went, I saw they did not have a separate container or bowl to keep the scoop when serving the fried rice dish. Instead the scoop was placed beside the bottom of the pot. Which I think is not so hygienic, given the fact that the fried rice has been on a burner before. Hope the restaurant can take not please.

The best putien outlet in Singapore. Food is delicious, service is fantastic, servings are generous. Very attentive staff. There are a lot of food options at Northpoint but we have been coming here almost every other week for the past 3 years. My daughter loves the friendly staff and food.

Nice food, experience and services at PUTIEN. The staff were attentive and served tea to us. Sweet and sour pork and the fish was yummy. It was quite warm so the staff gave us a small fan, great service!

This is an example of good food accompanied by excellent service. I have been to several Putien in Singapore but I have to give a shoutout to the outlet in Northpoint City. They deserve the Michelin 1 star. They pay attention to the details (e.g. when I was holding a cake, the staff proactively asked if I needed him to place it in the fridge) and were generally friendly, helpful and attentive to requests.
Really good job to all the staff in this outlet on 1 2 May 2021! 👏🏻👏🏻

Had a family celebration for my dad's birthday at Putien because he craves for Chinese food. We all had a good meal with our favourite dishes ordered. Generally being a Fujian Cuisine, the dishes are fresh, light and taste flavourful 👍🏻.

- Fujian Lor Mee $10.90
- Steamed Prawn with Minced Garlic $24.90
- PUTIEN Sweet & Sour Pork with Lychees $14
- Deep-fried Eggplant Dressed with Pork Floss $11.90

Tried 3 of their Oyster Festival Dish, the bee hoon is shiok when soaked in the lor mee gravy, would be better if the oysters are bigger!

- Pan-Fried Oysters coated with Bee Hoon S$16.90
- PUTIEN Crispy Oysters S$17.90
- Oyster Pancakes $5.90

Great dining experience at Putien Northpoint. The food was delicious and the service team was amazing. It was a fantastic way to celebrate my grandmother's birthday, especially because the staff were really attentive and welcoming to her. Would highly reccommend this place to everyone!

My family always brings guests here because the quality is consistently good. Service also two thumbs up (unless it is crowded, then it takes a while for the food to be prepared and served...so go early!). Comfortable atmosphere too. Even though it is in a heartland mall (Northpoint), the quality is still good.

So far almost all the dishes we've had are delicious. I've probably had 1 or 2 that weren't good but that's normal for every restaurant. The thin bee hoon and lychee pork ribs are staples for us. There is also a green juice that looks like a health drink, but I promise it tastes 10x better.

We brought a couple who just got married there, and the manager carved a pair of swans from a watermelon rind as a surprise. So sweet.

Putien isn't cheap but worth the occassional splurge!

The service is tip top. My table serving waitress 静雪 service was professional n warming! The rest of the teamwas caring and always ready for any request. Great place to spent the evening with family or friends.
Good! Very healthy! Suitable for old people.

Went with 5 people, waiter did not clarify and ordered the 6 pax set meal when we intended to get the 4 pax one. Aircon spoilt and it was hot inside. Was celebrating birthday and waiter offered longevity bun, did not mention it was chargeable and I ordered it thinking it was complimentary. Food was not nice and overpriced for $400

Likely what sets this place apart is the service. First time at putien and noticed the great service. We received a free chilli bottle per person as they’re celebrating their 20th anniversary. Food was slightly pricey but the quality was definitely higher quality yet with better higher quality ingredients. Worth to try the Yam, Sweet and sour pork.

Service is amazing — it is top notch. They even asked for feedback on the food and shared with me bad feedback from other customers when I offered them good feedback about the luffa.

The luffa and the fried tenggiri fish (with its accompanying sauce) blew my mind. The luffa was soft and absorbed the delicious superior stock very well. I never knew vegetables could taste so good.

Their in house chilli had depth in taste and was refreshing to pair with any dish.

I absolutely enjoyed my experience there.

Had a very bad experience today because of the incompetence of the service lady. I wanted to order large Lor Mee to ensure that it is enough for my family of 4 and asked if large is sufficient. The lady then advice me to go for medium if I am afraid we cannot finish. I then point to the menu and ask for the price of medium since I only see regular and large. The lady then assured me there is a medium but could not tell me the price even when I probed.

After a pointless exchange, we decided on large and thought that it means the large on the menu ($20+). When we were served, we were surprise that the standard pot was not big enough and our order came in 2 pots. At this point, I still did not sense anything wrong as I seldom dine in Putien and thought this is normal practice for large size Lor Mee.

It was only when I made payment that I realised the order was extra large and the price is not even stated on menu. I was so angry as I clearly wanted large. However it was too late since we already consumed the food and even take away the leftovers.

At the same time, we attempted to cancel a drink that we ordered but was not yet served. However, we were taken aback by the rude reaction from one of the service lady and her refusal to help us cancel the order. I have to compliment the male manager who intervened and help us cancel the order after he overheard the conversation.

I really did not expect such an experience and find this unacceptable for an established restaurant. Very disappointing.

Visited Putien multiple times .
This is the first time during CNY .
There were a few packages for CNY set meal.
Food was good . Service is excellent 👌🏻
Definitely worth to try at least once for authentic Putien cuisine 👍🏻

The best service and delicious of restaurant I had been. Last week we went to that the restaurant at Mbs, very poor service and the staffs not smiling to welcome…but when we walking-in this Northpoint Putie, they shown the efficiency management under the leader, provided  good services, all staffs are friendly, nicely and closely with each table . We highly recommended and definitely will be come back soon!

Writing this makes me really upset because i was here yesterday to celebrate my mom's birthday. This place is an absolute disappointment and has horrendous customer service. First off, called for a reservation for 20 pax at 830pm because people are coming from work and hence the late timing. However, the staff on the phone kept insisting and being so pushy with me by telling me that I should come earlier because the last order was at 930pm. Not only that, they do not respect my boundaries as they wanted to confirm my table by spam calling me 5 times while i am at work.

Then, managed to get everyone to come earlier and the waitress was so pushy towards the items we want to order by saying we should get abalone dishes. However, not everyone likes to eat such dishes because we have people that are not local and Chinese which doesn't suit their taste. But the staff was super insistent about it which cmon, once again be professional. You guys are a Michelin star restaurant.

The worse of all, dishes came out so fast that every time each waitress comes, 4 dishes comes out at the same time. You got to pace the food timings because if you rushed all the dishes out, the other dishes are going to be cold and it affects the texture, taste and quality of the food. Then, staff still argued that they have no control over this. Cmon, you obviously can just tell the chefs at the back to slow down with the food. I know you want to faster get your job done and close the shop early but we are here celebrating and we arent that unreasonable to stay till late night. Also, We are ordering approximately close to 10 dishes for each table and food got to be served at a moderate pace. Worse of all, staff even went to argue and retaliate against our request. Is this even reasonable?

To end off, my family have been spending at least hundreds of dollars every visit  when we come to putien because we find that food is decent, a nice location to be and also a place my family can bond together. Yet, none of the staff remembered us and this place does not value their regular customers. Very disappointing really...

The first thing that stuck me was their excellent service. The receptionist answered  our queries patiently even before we went in.

We ordered a set lunch for two. The food was good, not too salty. The portion is reasonable, enough to leave with a full stomach. Highly recommend their soups which come with rich broth that makes one want to have more.

The restaurant also provided free food for my toddler. We asked for more rice as she was not full and that came free of charge too.

Food is really good here! Love the Lor Mee and the Lychee Meat 🤩 would like to commend Zhang Lan too! She’s so nice and friendly, dish she recommended us is really v nice! Nice dinner on mid week, made our day! :)

I had my dinner (4 of us) @ Northpoint, had the doutou/clams, 100seconds croaker fish (we got 2 😋), loufa, all dishes were yummy.  Service staff were friendly and cheery.  Happy and delicious dinner !
The dishes are very yummy. My kids like it and have free kids meal. The service is good as well. Jing Xue service very well and provide toys for my toddler and kid. Will come back again.

Went Yishun Putien during Mid Autumn festival. 静雪 (staff of Putien) was a great host and was very patience with us throughout the whole experience.

Nothing expected from them but they went extra miles to ensure we are well attended. Definitely a great place to visit again.
Amber and 胡燕 are very pleasant and attentive. Both will look into what we need and provide and serve well. Frequently top up our drinks. 👍
The Putien staff in northpoint were super friendly and nice - even gave free dessert. The food was generally really good as well. Would recommend!

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Looking for something different for lunch today and found this great place with ample parking. The dishes are excellent and reasonably priced. There is a 10% service charge and justifiably so as service is prompt and good. Will definitely come back.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: So so, some dishes pretty good some not so. The Mango London Duck taste weird wz the artificial mango essence sauce and the Braised Pork Belly got the pork smell. The Icy Sweet n Sour pork was good, but the ice melted when it was serve causing the meat to be sitting on a puddle of water. Black pepper beef was good too.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Waiters and Waitresses were standing nearby and served promptly whatever necessary and polite. The taste of Crab and fish were from gravy. The fish seemed to be not marinated and the crab seemed to be boiled separately and gravy was poured on top just before serving.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Zichar style but Food was really unique and good! Nice vibe to chill with family and friends. Beer tower is not the cheapest. The staff were attentive and friendly too! There are also many small bites options if you just want to chill there with beer after dinner. My favourite are the fried baby squid and fish roe seafood fried rice (served in stone pot).

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Dine in with group of 5 you can order more dishes. Chili crab price consider reasonable at $88. The vermicelli is something different than other zhi char stall and it taste good with all the seafood. They also serve flaming roasted chicken which we skipped this time as we wanted to have prawn. The crispy garlic prawn is so good that you may have the crispy garlic and rice and chili crab sauce on its own. It’s just so staple. Overall their food are ok, restaurant is clean, it’s very suitable for gathering. They are not air conditioned but under shade. They also have outdoor table which I was initially have interest on but pull back as it is only cater for smoking zone. How nice if they have some non-smoking outdoor tables which people can eat/drink and enjoy the surroundings openly.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Great place to gather for dinner and some drinks. The white and brown fried rice was surprisingly good. The black tofu and London duck were average. Try the satay (not on menu); every stick was generous with meat and had a good bite to it.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content:
Overpriced for what we were being served.

The Peking duck was cut in a corner and then served to us, already wrapped. It would be a better experience if patrons can wrap their own Peking duck. Some of us didn’t want the spring onions so we had to pick it out. The skin was soggy and oily by the time it was served too.

My soon hock fish was served undone. We had to send it back to the kitchen to re-steam the fish.

Overall food - so so. Don’t think I’ll go back again.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content:
Hosting a company dinner on a very wet Friday evening. The staff was very helpful. Got some umbrellas out for us and was patience with our demands. Everything we ordered was delicious!
Will definitely be back :)

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: A nice restaurant at the hidden gem of ORTO in the North. The dishes were fabulous and the views were even better. Also tried their popular roast chicken and to my surprise, they actually torched the chicken in front of us before plating it. Definitely worth a visit and try.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Nice food everytime we get there. Standards are maintained❤️😋

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Went to this restaurant a year ago with my family and we came out as satisfied customers. Decided to have our lunch there again today and I am retaining my 5 stars rating for them. Service wise, do not expect the kind of standard that you would find at DTF or HDL but it is generally acceptable to me considering the staff demographics. Food wise, i would say it is still pretty good, well presented, reasonable portions and good taste. The stir fried beef cubes and signature bee hoon were great.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content:
Service: 5/5
Service staff are very attentive and friendly. They are patient when explaining their dishes. Thumbs up to their service manager.

Food: 1/5
1. Mushroom Tofu
Probably the better dish but they are a seafood restaurant?
2. Shark Fin Soup
Generous portion of shark Fin but the soup was a disappointment
3. Dancing Roasted Chicken
It was fine, not great.
4. Salted Egg Crab
Honestly, this was what I was looking forward to - the sauce and crab were not in the same building; disappointing.
5. Opeh Leaves vermicelli
Really big time disappointment. the vermicelli had a strange taste.

Ambience: 3/5
A nice place in the evening. quite cooling.

Price: 2/5
For the price you pay, you should get better food.

Final Verdict: Don't bother.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Decided to try out this Chinese restaurant on a weekend because there was a long queue at the Thai boat noodle store and I had a pleasant dining experience here. ORTO has been one of the few places I was recommended to go to that changed my perception of the North and the place itself has a nice view to boot. I love the fact that you can dine either indoors or alfresco depending on your mood and the food at Tasty Loong didn't disappoint. It was just unfortunate there was only the 2 of us so you guessed it, the more people the merrier as that means you get to savour more dishes. Their pumpkin noodles was their signature dish and it's a popular one but I felt it was nothing much to shout about. However their braised pork belly was good and certainly a dish I would order again! I have yet to try their roast chicken but judging by the no of the same dish sent to various tables, it must be popular too. Can't wait to head back there and try their dim sum menu too!

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content:
I love the place in general, the ambience is nice and cool when I visited that evening. Unfortunately, the music didn't do justice to the place and I had many bites when seated in the open.

The food was average. I liked the Toufu. But not so the fried rice. The squid was OK...

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: View is nice, went on a weekday night with not many ppl. Food was quite ok. Charcoal tofu was quite special. Flaming chicken is quite nice too with a hint of rose flavour. Chicken came with a basket of prawn crackers but not sure if its free-flow as to embarrassing to ask. The menu was abit confusing though.. per serving is for one ppl or shared portion? Price wise is abit on the high side. Staffs r quite friendly.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Food is expensive and not nice at all. Ordered their Prawn Paste Chicken Wing, and Fried Pork Belly, both were subpar and has a bad oil smell/taste to them. But however staffs were attentive and friendly :)

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Quite terrible experience, they’re serving larger groups who came after us but kept smaller groups waiting it seemed, even though our order wasn’t small. Bizarrely, they’re preparing 3-4 same items and serving to multiple tables instead of handling each table in order. After long time we decided to have crab but this restaurant dashed our hopes, after almost 1 hour of waiting patiently, they gladly said they haven’t started preparing our crab, why not just tell at entrance how long one has to wait for an item. The owner didn’t give a damn when we complained about the service, obviously not bothered by losing one customer coz they’re fully packed. We were hoping to bring parents there but we are not going back .

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Food is just about average. Some dishes with interesting presentations but otherwise quite normal tasting, normal portion but double the usual zhi char price. Food serving and timing was bad even though there were only 5 tables other than …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Food is good. Ambience is good. Prices reasonable.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Quite disappointing on the food. Service is not at even a basic expectation especially from the manager. When order food, did not explain the time left for food when ordering. Only have less than 1 hour to finish the food. Ask the manager …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: My expectation of celebrity chef restaurant was kind of disappointing. The food is below average and you probably can get a better food quality at zhi Char place outside. Ordered their signature being first time here: chicken with fire: …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Return visit to the restaurant! Every dish is quite unique and of quality. Would recommend to visit for families and group dining! One of my fav dish is the ice plant salad with crispy fried fish skin!

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Had Mother’s Day dinner at the place, took up the set dinner for ease due to large number. Generally food was decent but nothing to rave about. Costs about $40-$50/pax for the set. …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Ordered crispy squid, cheese sauce prawns, spicy chilli horfun, charcoal grilled korabuta and some special beehoon. Only the crispy squid and korabuta were pretty fine. The cheese sauce prawn was poor. The prawns seemed to have attempted a …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Had Sunday lunch at this Chinese restaurant as all the other restaurants in the Orto Park was closed. We ordered the a noodles dish, Miso fish and Honey baked duck. Quality of food was very average, duck was not very tendered. Noodles dish …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Go on a weekdays to have a three little towers at $43.00++... Weekend will be $48.00 for two little... foods wise are very good Zi cha at a high standard... Restaurants atmosphere is surrounded by the pond... Try get a seat next to the pond, Totally relaxing n cooling... Highly recommended...

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: It was a feast. I think the pictures speak for themselves. The abalone deal was amazing, lots of theatre from the fire duck dish, and the sweet and sour pork in ice was a big hit with everyone. Central location at Tiong Bahru but tucked away in Link Hotel so many people don't know it's there.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Were here for reunion dinner. Environment is good. Pricy, but the food taste is average， Sea cucumber is very hard…  yee mian is salty…

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Like the place next to fish pond, food is tasty and good presentation

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Seafood restaurant with pond side seating area. We were there on a wet and rainy evening, and the place was nice and cool. Friendly serving staffs who take care of us through out our dinner - topping up tea, replacing plates, even check if …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content:
Menu was confusing. It mentioned price per pax serving, but came in big plates.

Fish in the mee goreng was bad, wasn’t fresh and was mushy. …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Food is yummy ! Service is superb !!! Especially promotion for the kronenbourg Blanc $28.80 and Sapporo white ($58) . My family was very happy and enjoys .. must come!  � …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Good value ala carte lunch buffet. The service by the staff was good and fast.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Good place for a vibe. Nice food at reasonable price. Service is good as well. Ice plant and charcoal tofu is a must to order.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Food is expensive and not that TASTY, they still have a loong way tooo goo! Ordered the charswiew not that great so difficult to bite. ordered a tower of beer but the dispenser was so dirty, a lot of black particles can be seen when the drink is dispense! eeew. One star is for the vibe.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Nice place for dinner...open air , cooling..nice food..good ambience..next to small lake � …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: We have been to Tasty Loong multiple times as we liked their food . However, we were utterly disappointed in their food  served today. Their baked pork ribs with marmite sauce tasted like lean meat, and it wasn't tender like usual pork ribs …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Great taste of the food, the view was good as well.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Bad experience. Went there on the 3rd day of CNY. Ordered a soup, vegetable, bean curd, pork belly, lala. The bill came up to 200++. Food quality was bad. Ordered a takeaway fried rice - costs $18. …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: The dishes we ordered were good esp the duck and chili crab. They also had a good selection of wine. The service staff was fantastic. Will definitely make another visit there.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Went on a Saturday night. Sorry but... Worst zichar I've ever tasted :/ Small portions, slow service... Could the crowd be only because the rest of the shops have a really long queue? On top of being not so great the prices were high. It …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Food and service was 👍, black Pepper must and shark fin soup must try � …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Dissappointing food. Bought 2 crabs, 1 chilli and 1 pepper. Both were adequate. Tasted worse than what you find at some other coffee shops. The food here was not worthy of a celebrity chef's reputation. The only reason i gave 2 stars is because of the great service from the waitresses and the view.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Good service , staff friendly  . Black peer beef was super tender and have promo beer Blanc $28.80 .

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Good ambience and pretty good food. North siders should probably come visit this area in ORTO. #yishun

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Crabs overcooked, kailan bitter. Worse is the crazy irritating techno music blasting throughout. It's supposed to be a relaxing experience by the river - but the music is really irritating.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Overall food is below average. I'm not sure is it due to busy Saturday dinner crowds or what, the standard is not what was expected. Yusheng is tasteless. The fire chicken has special presentation but tastewise is just average. Even common dish like cereal prawn is disappointing -- prawns are chewy, texture more like sotong than prawns.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Here for the braised pork rice which did not disappoint.

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: 5 of us came on a weekday in the early afternoon where we were the only ones at the restaurant. We ordered fish and chips that came 40mins later. We were overcharged for the drinks and wasn’t told of the “new” price until we received the …

restaurant name: Tasty Loong at Orto Park 龍鲜閣
content: Food quality is good but dishes come in very long interval.  Have to eat and wait 5, 10mins or longer for next dish.  Rice become cold before we receive last, 3 dish that we ordered.

Very disappointed version of Penang Prawn Noodle. Other than the taste was bad, the served bowl of prawn noodle is so far different compared to the photo being displayed. Chendol was diluted. Too much ice but too less coconut milk. It’s like drinking super diluted coconut milk water. Rojak was just below overage of sg rojak as only can taste rojak sauce but can’t taste any prawn paste in the rojak. Overall this establishment is a disgrace to Malaysia food. Malaysia Chiak indeed poorly representing Malaysian food.

Nestled in a corner of the basement of North Point, this branch of the popular eatery is not very large, but does have a few nice stalls.
I have been here a couple of times, and my personal favourites are the porridge, ban mian and the fried oyster. This time, I tried the nasi lemak, which unfortunately wasn't very good. I also noticed that the claypot rice had a long queue.
If you want to check out the place, I would suggest that you go for lunch rather than dinner, as a couple of stalls will close once they sell out.
Fried radish are in huge chunks, which is Malaysian-style, and they are fried with lots of eggs and taugeh! Super tasty and it’s only $3! Will definitely come again!

They don’t accept 5cent coin 🪙. At first o thought this is invalid to refuse as it is still a money, but after I read the currency act, as long as shop shows the written notice to customers out front, it is legit
Back to their food . Honestly not authentic at all , bean mian was super hard to chew , over stringy??
And char kuetiao is not wok hey .
Only the chendol tasted decent but wish to have more red bean and chendol inside.

Review for the Hainanese Curry Chicken rice:

Overall the food was honestly not that great, the curry was meh and food was cold. Chicken was pink and I raised a concern to the guy at the stall and he said it was okay to eat, but still gave me a new one for my piece of mind so that was nice. Seats are nice and clean though and will probably try out the other stalls, just not this one.

Malaysia Chiak!
Malaysia boleh....boleh...yeah...

Love the Lontong here.
Even though not the authentic Malaysia version but came quite close.
Remember to ask for the chilly samba, it brings out the full favour of the Lontong soup.
Generous serving of cabbage, Kueh Tupat, boiled egg but the long bean is missing, double check the display photo. Can see the long bean missing from my Lontong?

Comes served in the traditional yellow glass plate. Don't see that kind of plates any more but popular in the 70's in the Malay Kampong.🙂

The Chendor beside the Nasi Lamak stall is also my fav stall. Always ask Ice Chendor additional Gula Malacca syrup and NO RED BEAN TOPPING....BUT MUST Have the Green Chendor......mmm...super Manis. This stall Chendor came close to one of the road side mobile mini van Chendor stall in Ipoh in term of taste and texture which I chance upon.

Awesome place to dine 5 paxs for now🤣🤣for vaccinated only
Love the claypot rice, Assam laksa, meesiam, my girl like the minced pork porridge, meehoon kueh, chendol @$2 only.  Good that are using porcelain bowls which I felt is home.
Some masia noleh food is not nice, here is ok and the best one is jurong point.

Carrot cake and stir fried oyster omelette is the worst I have ever had. The carrot cake wasn't even up to standard, the cake was NOT even CUT and was served LARGE CUBED SIZED, about the size of one's thumb or a tablespoon
Worst experience
Tasteless Assam Laksa @ SDG5.50 and it’s not even sour at all. The ingredients are also pretty pathetic… might as well go for D’Laksa which is cheaper and nice. Disappointed!
Yummy Chendol! Thick coconut cream with gula melaka and red beans. Popiah yum also, comes with beancurb and fried egg. Claypot boneless chicken thigh with sambal chilli tasty too

Has a variety of Malaysian food catered to the Singaporean taste. Char Kwey Teow, Pork noodle, Fried carrot cake, Nasi Lemak, Cendol, Clay Pot Rice, Chicken/Pork cutlet rice, etc. Seating is limited & social distancing applies. If you forgot to comply, the cleaners here will nag you about it so pay attention.

If you missed or you wanted to taste the traditional Malaysian Food, can come to this place. Similar to Malaysia Boleh serving various Malaysian & Penang food. Price slightly cheaper than in Malaysia but in SGD. 😋😋😋
Tasted nothing like Malaysia Bak kut Teh and claypot rice. Not worth at all.
getting our Malaysian food fix here at least until we get to visit our neighbors up north again.....and very soon we hope...👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
Delicious local food! But too tough to Chope seats!

Nice! Especially the fried oyster (Or Lua), the flour is mixed so well and thin it feels like it melted in the mouth, one of the main difference from the singaporean version. The "wok hei" of fried oyster and fried kway tiao is great as well!
Claypot chicken tastes great with lots of crispy "锅巴" and comes with very compatible chilli sauce! Only slight dissapointment is the salted fish is too little in the claypot rice. I can hardly taste the salted fish, and the rice is lacking the fragrant smell of the salted fish.

Claypot rice increase in price but meat portion reduced. Taste not as strong n sauce lacking. Oysters r alright but the ckt lacks wok hei. Guess the chef r still young n attitude needs improvement. Will visit kopitiam w better enviromment n selection of food. Price pt higher but better food the least.
Nice malaysia food. Food court style. Self service.

Lots of choices of old time favourites. My pork noodle was tasty wz lots of meat in it. Friend's fried kwayteow was a let down, no wok-hei, cockles or lap-cheong.... Claypot chicken rice was good wz chunks of chicken meat n salted fish.

Came here at 730pm on a Sunday evening.  Ordered the local favorites: rojak, popiah, longtong, oyster omelette.

Rojak was decent, slightly on the sweeter side.  The vegetables fruits like radish, cucumber, guava were fresh and crunchy.  The youtiao had a crunch as well. The pineapples were unripe.

Popiah was similar, since the sweet sauce was the same base, over powered the salty fragrance that the cooked radish would have provided.

Lontong was rich and tasty.  The saving grace for the meal.  The gravy had the right richness and taste that made you want to dig in more.  The Tau kwa was generous.  Portions were right for 1 pax.

Oyster omelette was the first to order and last to receive.  The cook on the starch was poor and "jelak".  The oysters over cooked and the chili was "off" with a rancid water taste.

By the time that we were done by 810, we wanted to order hot drinks, the man at the counter said. No more hot drinks.

Well, it's just sad.  I wouldn't encourage you to return, you are better off eating at the foodcourt.

The food there was totally not up to standard, very disappointed. The penang laksa no taste at all and not fish inside all are vegetables and noodles, the worst is the soup. Not recommended to there to eat. Thier porridge so expensive yet no ingredients, haiz.

1) Assam Laksa - 1/5 Gravy was too thick and quite “dry” , very poor customer services from the young boy.

2) Claypot chicken rice - 4/5 , quite delicious, is just the waiting time you have to bear with it during peak hour.

3) Char Kuey Teow - 2/5 , no wok hey, missing the char kuey teow fragrant. Would not recommend if you are looking for “malaysia taste”.

Patronised the kuantan nasi lemak at the northpoint outlet. Staffs are rude and lack training. In particular, there's this grumpy middle aged man, kept reprimanding his staffs for every single matter. Literally shouting away at customers who ordered lontong that there will be waiting time for ordering that. Though customers said ok, the staffs would still repeatedly shout that it require waiting time to order lontong. I ordered the nasi lemak takeaway, instead of handing over the food to me like any usual F&B staff would, he appear to be throwing the entire packet of food in plastic to me. The nasi lemak tasted average, if you need a benchmark, it's lower standard compared to Crave. I'm taking my money elsewhere for future lunch.

Food stalls with many varieties of dishes such as Chillu Ban Mian (Dry/Soup), Penang Carrot Cake & Kwey Tiew, Nasi Lemak, Rujak & Popiah, Cendol Ice, Claypot Rice, Porridge, Noodles Soup. Just that they do not have Assam Laksa, sadly :(

Head over just for the chilli ban mian! One of my favourite dishes at Malaysia Chiak! Stores are awkwardly placed cause of the limited space but they have all the dishes that the rest of the outlets have! Same old taste:) The picture is a bit misleading cause of the egg, its hard boiled instead of soft boil! I prefer the soft boil egg 👍 Vegetable is also raw in the picture (not as per illustrated) but the dish taste never fails! A must try if you head over to Malaysia Chiak!

Decided to finally give a review of this place. When it first opened few years back, the wait time for almost every food stall was long due to the crowd and the standard of the food was pretty bad.

However, I decided to give it a try again today with my friends, surprisingly everything we had improved in taste and wait time. Especially the Mee Hoon Kuey, the soup was tasty and not diluted like I had the previous time!

Overall, its not bad for a food court in a shopping mall. Will be back to try out other food stalls there too!

Good place to eat. Reasonable prices with good mix of varieties of foods. There are ample
Tables and chair to dine in but expect pretty crowded during lunch and dinner time. Air conditioner very cold, Food portion are quite small but tasty enough. Overall good place to eat.
Not as good as expected, the food really so so.

Authentic Malaysian hawker food, but small portion and a bit pricey compared with Malaysia boleh. I had the Assam laksa, the soup was quite watery with less than minimum fish meat. I also ordered one lok bak to try, it's so tiny with $2 each. I prefer Malaysia boleh.

*This review is specifically for this dish only.

Taste:
This is one of the best chilli ban mian I have eaten.
The noodles texture is chewy and bouncy, the mushroom and the egg yolk taste combined is just perfect.

Price:
Pretty decent, I can’t remember the price, but this is definitely below $5.

Service:
Dined at a pretty odd hour after the common dinner timings so there are still seats available. For this specific stall, the food was served pretty quickly.

Hi management would like to highlight an issue isit a rule that char kway teow must always fried with chilli? Your people got a lot of own rules that I think the management are not aware. The other time the jurong point char kway teow refused to sell me 2 plate as I only have a $50 note which later the jurong point management apologies that there is no such rule.  Please look into it
food are less than pictures show, soups are diluted.
On 10 Aug 2022 12.20pm buy mian Huey kuih stall the lady attitude rude

Many choices here, reasonable price. Mee Siam $3.50
Mee Rebus $3.50, Longtong $4, Nasi Leak $3.80. Coffee & Tea weekdays 3-5 pm 80¢
Time the management upgrade staff performance too!

Another favorite place of mine to taste Malaysia foods. When I come to Northpoint, 90% of the time I will have my meal here as the foods here are very affordable compared to other food outlets.

Not all their foods are great, so you need to choose wisely. My favorite foods here are chilli ban mee (noodles) and char kuey teow. The popiah, nasi lemak, penang hokkien mee (prawn mee) are so so only.

If you come during meal time, it will be very crowded and you need to share places with others. My advice is come early or choose odd times to come here, so you won't be frustrated with all the fully occupied places.

Malaysia Chiak! gives a very warmth environment to me with it's warm lightings and spacious seats.

The prawn mee I had is so tasty with very good soup base and fresh ingredients. The presentation is also attractive. The service is just nice for me. It also reminds me of the taste of prawn mee in Malaysia.

Their chendol ice is so so good! Red beans were big and juicy. The ice makes it chilled and crunchy. The chendol is also soft and smooth. The coconut milk also adds fragrance. Overall it's delicious!

I would highly recommend you to try their prawn mee if you are missing the taste of the prawn mee and chendol from Malaysia!

#ILoveMalaysiaChiak!
Not bad, the taste of the food is much better then when the newly opened
Great place to taste authentic Malaysian food in Singapore. Conveniently located in Northpoint shopping mall next to Yishun train MRT station.
Claypot chicken rice had a decent char and overall, quite fragrant with bits of salted fish mixed in. Wait time was a bit long tho. Quite affordable.

Latest Malaysia hawker food themed restaurant in Singapore. Lots to choose from and stalls display famous roads to state  exactly where the dishes come from. I wonder if this is really the case. Prices are not cheap. It’s like paying premium for the name and air con. Char kway teow could pass off as Penang char kway teow but lacked hum and lup cheong. Penang laksa was chock full of vegetables. Quite close to the real thing although I probably didn’t try this style before. Chendol had the right taste but ice shavings were not fine enough.

What the hell is this? Ordered Klang Bak Kut Teh and Sesame chicken at Northpoint, took more than 25 mins to be served and at the end no taste of the Bak Kut Teh, meat hard, so much different from the picture and the sesame chicken was too salty, taste of no sesame oil. Lastly, do look at the photos and comment. Seriously, it's worst than other branches that I have.

Their staff really fussy, force you to pay for the 30cents container and claim due to food hygiene & can not mix with other food together. What a not environment move friendly! You are creating more rubbish in our tiny island!

Furthermore, the food is not up to standard taste. Their popiah not nice at all. You can tell from the picture. The skin has melted.

Rojak so so only.

Will not come back again in future.

Chili ban mee was delicious as usual.

Asked for extra chili but auntie said “not too much, we also need to do business one, rental also need money.” 😐

Exciting eating place with varieties of Malaysia delights comparable with hawker standard of Pinang and Ipoh. Conveniently located in the neighbourhood heartland next to Yishun MRT station and bus interchange  at modern shopping mall Northpoint City. Love the prawn noodles and Ipoh noodles. Freshly prepared healthy ingridients with tender loving caring skillful cooking and professional warm services. Clean tidy orderly neighbourhood with aircond and spacious relaxing seats. Friendly cosy comfy welcoming ambience for romantic intimates groups students tourists expats locals visitors and families.
Not really fantastic. Just a place to eat only. But popiah $$ not bad. Quite nice. Chendol also ok.

At the Nasi Lemak stall, I requested for no cucumbers. They gave it to me. I saw it and told them I didn’t want it, they didn’t take it out. I told them specifically no cucumbers 3 times. They asked me if I wanted chilli, I said yes. They didn’t give it to me. Not just 1 mistake, the attendant made 2 mistakes. Not worthy of a good review at all

Food sucks and totally disappointing.
Popiah fillings is cold .... Even turnip is cold.
Claypot bak kut teh served lukewarm only and at $6 no rice only have 2 slices of super thin frozen pork belly and 2 pieces of hard like rock frozen pork ribs with 2 tiny strip of fried beancurd nothing else!!!!!!! So different from the photo at stall.  Won't come again.

I'm surprised that both the pork noodles n kampung chicken are quite good, especially the pork noodles which is full of ingredients. Not bad for a $5 bowl of noodles and $4 for the plate of chicken.

Will come back next time for the fried kuayteow, claypot rice, hokkien prawn noodle soup which all have a long queue.

A pity that this is located at B1 and all the way at the far end of Northpoint City. Hopefully more ppl will patronise and support the biz.

Claypot Bah Kut Teh: The soup was bland and tasteless. One could be deceived by the colour of the soup which gave the impression that it was briming with taste. There was a grand total of 2 to 3 small chucks of pork and a maximum of 3 thinly sliced pork belly. Portion was small. $6 for that tiny serving and $1 more if you want a bowl of rice. Tasteless, tiny serving and a long wait for your food.

Serves a great variety of Asia food & snacks such Penang char kway teow, claypot chicken rice, Mee Rebus, Mee Siam, Nasi Lemak, popiah (turnips wrapped in a roll). Highly recommend claypot chicken rice for first timer.
Affordable nasi padang and other dishes, fast service

(Translated by Google) Nice, sweet chili. Singapore Nasi Padang.

(Original)
Nice, sweet chilli. Singapore Nasi Padang.
Is this Bestari? The drink stall lady was very rude when she served me. When I complained of the coconut in the super cooler drink has already turned bad, she refused to replace it.
Few years back it is nice and affordable but now …. the most expensive nasi padang for coffeeshop.
During this Phase 2 (HA) wef 22/7/2021, this stall still operating from 6am. Nasi padang plenty choice of dishes. Best breakfast & lunch takeaway.
Their serving time was super super super slow. The food taste average only and they are charging their food so expensive. NOT WORST VISITING. FOOD NOT NICE!!

(Translated by Google) Many dishes. Noodle Soup Noodle Boil Noodle Rice Mixed Cake.

(Original)
Many dishes. Mee Siam Mee Rebus Lontong Nasi Campur Kuih Muih.

Their rice was fluffy and there was a strong coconut+pandan aroma, which I liked it very much. The chilli sauce is sweet and not spicy. I’ve also added on fishcake and begedil but the portion was so small. Chicken wing was tasty and flavourful but the winner here for me was still the rice. 😬

Went there around 9am on a Sunday morning and there was a long queue. Most of the people buy in bulk of 5 to 10 packets! The worker is very fast but because of the high volume, you still need to be prepared to wait for 20 minutes or so.

We ordered the nasi lemak and also the curry puff (3 pieces for 2 dollars). Not bad - crispy skin and tasty generous fillings. Took a photo with a standard rubik cube for size comparison.

The nasi lemak rice is fluffy and fragrant. The fried ikan bilis and peanut is very fresh and crunchy. I like the chicken wing too - crispy on the outside and the batter is very thin so you are still eating the chicken wing and not the batter :p.

The sambal is the sweet type but lacking in omph. That is the reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 stars.

The best food court nasi lemak in town, no other place can beat Nasi Lemak Pak Mandor. Pandan rice and sambal are the best ~ I can't describe it well by words, kepak chicken wing had a perfect nice crisp, similarly with the ikan ekor kuning which is very tasty, perkedel or begedil is always tasty as ever.

I would strongly recommend to dine in or if take out, to eat it right away while its warm.

Been their loyal customers since ages and their nasi lemak never disappoint me, always able to maintain the taste.

Grew up eating this and the standard is still the same as ever. The rice is always soft and fluffy. Chilli is on the sweeter side and must must must ask for more chilli to fully enjoy the whole meal.

Fish is easy to eat and not dry! Chicken is okay, great when its piping hot but when cold it becomes tough so do eat it immediately.

Always add Begedil! Love this, veryyyy yummy.

Have it there or dabao come also equally good.

Its ok only. No cucumber. Rice a bit soft maybe cause I take away. Sambal is sweet not spicy. I dont understand people raving about it. Maybe they never taste a good nasi lemak before. I give it a five out of 10.

Famous #NasiLemak in Yishun. Chilli is sweet, and their #Begedil is made manually. Decent, but not the best. Pricing is affordable. Paid $6 for 2 chicken wings, 2 eggs, 1 hotdog, 1 fishcake, ikan bilis and peanuts.

The fried chicken is nice and juicy though on the smaller size. It’s very economical that for $3.50 you get a meat, an egg, peanuts and anchovies.

However I didn’t fancy the rice with mushy texture and coconut flavour quite like. Also the chilli is not spicy. As other said, abit like Chinese Nasi lemak

So if you Wan to try non spicy Nasi lemak. This is it. And yes there’s a queue even on weekdays

the rice is in green colour and the taste is good. I didnt try the chicken wing but it shall be ok to try. we went on tuesday lunch time and there's less people. the sauce is not in red but abit orange colour, so it's less spicy but abit sweet for me. they also sell curry puff.

The freshness you can taste (and have to wait for). Everything is simply cooked but because it’s fresh, the taste is different from (and better than) other famous Nasi Lemak places, the chili from Changi Village and Adam food center are still better though.
Try come early before lunch, the first time we came here to try at late lunch hours the stall was closed, and I can only imagine the queue is even longer at noon.

I practically grew up eating this Nasi Lemak. Really glad that makcik is still serving good Nasi Lemak. Definitely love the panda flavoured rice and the chili that goes with it. I will recommend the bagedel from Pak Mandor as well. I thought the chicken wings shrank in size over the years but no complains here =)

There ia a constant queue so be prepared to wait. 3 dollars get you riac with chicken wing, piece of egg, roasted peanuts and anchovies and a choice of hot dog or potato patty.

This chilli sause is not red a most tend to be. More on the sweet side and not spicy. Chicken wing crisy sia. Very worth.
Long waiting time. Nasi lemak is very normal, nothing special. Price is reasonable, $4 for 2 chicken wings.

Small stall in the coffee shop. Tasty Nasi Lemak
Rice texture real good with the generous chilli sauce. Chilli sauce not too spicy can taste the Bawang Yums
Crispy chicken wing n Ikan Bilis. Must add Begedil delicious tasty soft potato with not too overwhelming celery leaf taste.
3person portion plus 3 curry puff $11

Insta: ju.rine

Super friendly, patient. Though queue was long, approx 10 pax when I was there at 11.10, they served fast and efficient.

Sorry the photo not good enough to show the stall. But the q was long. Only nasi lemak. No other dishes.

The ingredients are freshly prepared, all are warm when served. Love the fish, is fresh, not overly fried, outside is crispy n inside is soft n warm. The sambal chilli is not hot, taste is different from the usual sambal

Personally this is the worse nasi lemak I've ever eaten in my life

1. The pandan green colour rice looks good but didn't even have a hint of pandan fragrance in the rice. I wonder if they're using pandan colouring instead of natural pandan leaves?

2. The rice they used seems like low quality as it is firm and dry.

3. Chilli is too watery and doesn't blend well with the rice.

4. Chicken wing is too tiny like a quail

5. Tempe and fish is so-so

Best plate of Malay Style Nasi Lemak i had tried in years. It’s so good that i went back to Q for it for 2 straight days. The rice is amazing, cook till perfect. The chili is flavourful not too spicy. The chicken wings is not perfect. The fish is crispy on outside and not too dry inside. The whole combinations is well orchestrated.
Felt that it was just ok. The green rice is from green coloring and did not have much lemak flavour. Queued for around 20min on a weekday lunch

Best valued Nasi Lemak in Sg !
Only $4.50 for a generously portioned set that comes with 2 freshly fried chk wings ! A favourite haunt for my weekly visits to the area.

It was made in favour of chinese tastebuds, chilli wasn't sambal tumes (malay pronunciation) sambal was light brown, when u grind more onions but use little chilli,  only about 4 dishes to choose from, fish cake, hotdog, chicken wing and ikan bilis with peanuts. Small cup of green nasi lemak rice. Price though was the deciding factor for the 26 odd people in queue on a wednesday afternoon at 12pm. 40 minutes in queue. Will i crave for it again? No. Was there anything else in the coffeeshop for alternative eating? No.

Waited 30 mins in line and they had only move 7 people. Slow service because they committed to a massive pre order they couldn’t keep up with. After each customer they would have to pack 5 packs for the pre order. Worst experience.

A favorite since I was a child. Delicious and value for money. My usual order with double chicken wing costs less than $5. The sweet sambal (Indonesia style?) is relatively unusual compared to the norm.

Only downside is that the coffeeshop is quite small, so you will probably need to takeaway most of the time.
Must try Nasi whenever I drop-by that area.
Food is great but the quantity has shrunk

To my honest opinion, the nasi lemak was just meh for me. I visited the stall because everyone was raving about it however I was somewhat disappointed that the sambal was not as nice as I was expected it to be. I mean I’ve tasted better sambal elsewhere.

My cucumber was also missing from my plate. Not sure if it was intentional or not. The green lemak rice was a nice touch but it was nothing great. Price is reasonable at $3.50.

This is to my opinion.
Great nasi lemak @ affordable price. Come before 1230pm to avoid disappointment

Ordered this Nasi Lemak for $4 and comes with chicken wing, egg, fish cake, Ilan bilis and peanuts.

The rice was really fluffy and had adequate coconut. Really goes well with the chilli with was slightly spicy and sweet. The other ingredients were okay.
Nothing special about their Nasi Lemak...Will not crave for it
My favourite nasi lemak in Yishun. Cheap, good and delicious! Beats the one in Chong pang hands down. Took one star away because consistency can vary.
Delicious cheap green nasi lemak.varieties of add on such as bagedil,chicken wing,fish etc.Do come early to avoid dissapointment.
All the ingredients are fresh...Nice Nasi Lemak and just for the price of $3
Overall it's nice and yummy Nasi Lemak! Shiok Chili and delicious bergedil! But sometimes the rice still little bit, tiny winny hard..
Good Nasi Lemak at affordable neighbour coffee shop.

Only Nasi Lemak is offered. The sambal is special and good tasting.
No fish if you are late after 10am.
Fried chicken wings rather small.
No cucumber.
Not worth the long queue

I find that the nasi lemak standard to differ batch to batch. Sometimes the rice can be abit too wet for my liking. Amazing price for the standard as it is consider affordable. If only the standard can be more consistent will be great.

Super nice green Nasi Lemak and very affordable! Even after adding additional ingredients beyond the "Standard Pack", it is still consider cheap vs other Nasi Lemak stall (Muslim and non Muslim). Great chicken wings. Be prepared for long Q if you come after 11.30pm.

D best green nasi lemak at yishun area and the price is affordables ($3 ) from schoolchildren to old folks.
The ingredients consist of 3 items to choose off such as chicken wing/fish/egg/fishcake/sausage or tempeh(fried soya)....but the chilli a bit sweet.
The peanut is anchovies is crispy.
Its still ok as it serves different level of individual taste.
The epok potato & sardine is ohhsome.
Overalls its is recommended.

Nice and gd.

But the nasi wet wet one. So when you buy, eat fast later spoilt liao

Update 18 October 2021:

Long queue when I come 830. Anxious scared chicken finish. $3 where to get Nasi lomak with chicken, egg, ikan bilis and fish.

Many smelly cheapo singapore talk so much. Say Food not nice la, chicken black la. Come on its $3, budget lomak with all inside. Where to get?!!

Not happy to eat, go eat yr atas Nasi lomak. Later complaint atas lomak expensive la.

Relax la why so angry. Spore already so stress. Food also want to be angry when u pay $3 only.

No wonder every morning super long queue.
The Green nasi lemak (coconut rice) very tasty and the portion is very generous for $3 (one fried fish, one fried chicken wing, omelette and fried anchovies with peanuts. So TASTY la 😋
MUST TRY!!!!!
The two types of epok2 (curry puff), sardine and potatoes also VERY TASTY 😋

Why people say it’s very nice and just $3 for the nasi lemak? Mine is $3.50 with omelette, chicken wing, hotdog, fish cake and ikan bilis. No fried fish. The rice is very wet with not much pandan taste. Is it because it’s cheap means the food is nice? I think Power Nasi Lemak is better.

I have eaten at this place since I was young, the green nasi lemak rice is fantastic, its so savoury that you can eat it on its' own, the prices are insanely cheap, at 50 for each item apart from chicken wings which is at 1 dollar. But there's a minimum expenditure of $3 per plate. Also note to be there early and expect a queue which however clear fast as they are really quick at service, they are usually sold out by 2pm everyday. Their curry puffs are a nice 50cent treat that will leave you wishing you have bought more for tea time in the office.

I live nearby this store and patronising frequently. The rice, chilli, ikan bilis, peanut, chicken wing etc are very nice.  Curry puff very nice as well.  Queue could be quit long and to ensure you get all the topping you like, you have to come in the morning.
