This is a good find for me. Chicken and fried fish had nice tasty seasoning. Rice is fragrant, but a bit too soft to my ideal. The only thing that I'm not fond of is the chilli, different type than usual nasi lemak chilli
Affordable price. Green Rice taste good, Ikan Bilis good. Chix wings not bad, bagedel good and the sambal is nice but could a be abit more spicy. Overall I like it.
Nice nasi lemak, rice is good, wings not bad, side dishes are also decent but chili not spicy enough else can be a 5 star. Overall nice makan!
Super friendly Lady seller whom I knew for at least 20 years. 1 of the best I have eaten and their fragrance Pandan rice stood out for me. Price is super economical.Must try if you haven't.
New Andy's Grill opened here and is worth trying.****

Nasi lemak, I ate before they gave me fish head. When they have not enough fish so they cut the fish into half to served other customers. Don't buy their sardines curry Puff inside all onions and bit of mince sardines. Service not so good one of them so rude and stuck up.

Value for money for what you get and taste. Today I queued for about 15 mins to buy the food and when it was about my turn, Makcik come and tell me and the rest of people behind me all sold out. Sigh!!!! Waste time queuing for nothing.

Everything here is simple & basics. The stall is simple, the food looks simple, but the taste is of quality. The basis of the rice, every grain is moist & soft but it doesn’t lumped together (it takes skill to achieve that!). Overall, Great!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content:
I've only eaten at this joint and my review is for this outlet only.
I had their set K. They really nail it for their chicken. Grilled chicken that's moist and juicy,  but beware of the chili on it. The spiciness kicks in later... But it's so good you can't help but surrender yourself to it even when knowing it'll bite u later!

And the staff, they are just.... HAPPY. The positive vibe from the crew just makes eating there a joy!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Ordered Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang for lunch. Also added a fish fillet because I am greedy! Haha! 😂 The chicken meat was so tender and it fall off the bone easily! But for someone like me with low tolerance to spice, the chilli was very spicy and I broke out in sweat after a few spoonfuls of it! 🔥🥵 Overall it’s really a good and tasty Nasi Lemak in Yishun so please consider to give it a try if you are here! 😋

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Ordered Nasi Lemak Cabe Ijo. Cost $6.20. Potion is good, very filling. Chicken is good and tender, not dry but juicy.. The green chili sauce is good also comparable to 小辣 mala spicy level. Sambal chili is nice and sweet. Nasi Lemak taste fine good enough for me, egg was also nicely cooked. Only negative was the ikan billis that was overcooked. Other than that I will return to eat.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content:
First time patronizing this stall.

Went on a weekday at 2.30pm timing. Was quite surprised to be told to wait 10 mins even though there is no queue. Food came faster then 10 minutes though. So I will expect pretty long waiting time during peak hours and on weekends.

Food wise,  taste is pretty good. Chili was not too spicy for me which is good and quantity given is good too. RIce is fragrant, Chicken is not overcooked and tastes good also.

At $6.20 is not that expensive compared to other stalls selling similar style of food.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content:
Excellent nasi lemak eatery. The quality is one of the best around compared to other popular ones like Crave or Qiji.

The rice is especially fragrant and moist. The chicken leg is very tender and tasty. The fish is also very large size and overall for the price, it’s value for money.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Tried the green chili chicken nasi lemak. Chili is good for both the sambal & green chili ones. Rice is fragrant too. Chicken is nicely grilled but the flesh when eaten is bit mushy? Not thawed correctly? Will still return for other flavors though.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: One of the better Nasi Lemak is Yishun. The chicken wing is big, crispy on the outside and the inside meat is juicy but I feel that it is not marinate long enough. The mackerel otah taste good. The egg is a bit overcooked as I prefer egg with a bit of runny yolk. The portion of the sambal chill is generous. The only thing which I don't prefer is the rice, something seems just not right whenever I eat the rice as I feel it don't have have the very distinct coconut milk flavour and aroma of pandan leaves which a good nasi lemak should have.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Delicious Nasi Lemak! Sambal isn’t the spiciest but they portioned a generous amount of it. Chicken is crispy and other ingredients were nice too!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Is nice but not excellent at $6.20 per plate.  They could have given more sambal chilli to serve with the rice.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: The rice was well cooked and fragrant, the star of the show is of course the chicken. Nicely charred and tender, coupled with their house made chilli (pleasurable burn). Ikan bilis was just a tad too salty for my liking. I would come back just for their chicken 👍🏼

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Very shiok spicy, chicken was tender and rice was very very fragrant! The ikan billis was too hard for me though. Highly recommended!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Food is good, but the uncle always take wrong order, this is the 2nd times! Waste my time go back and change and not even an apologize from them. I hope no more 3rd times please.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: I liked the egg. It’s runny on the inside and coats the rice nicely when you break it. Begedil had a crispy touch to it. Other than that, the ingredients and taste is not as good as the more famous ones like Crave.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content:
Saw a crowd and decided to queue for the Ayam Taliwang. There were 4 people in front but I had to wait 20 mins for them to take my order. The cashier processed my order and asked me to come back after 15 mins.

15 mins later, when I collected my food, he told me they have ran out of the Ayam Taliwang, and convinced me to switch to another sauce. Quite disappointed cause I waited so long and paid already. The food is ok only, definitely not worth $6.50. Rice also not that fragrant.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Happy fun loving two ladies in the morning not to mention plus points great food. I eat there literally everyday and the fun and smiles and happy morning two staffs makes it a pleasant start of the day. Good staffs who are sweating at 645am but always giving good vibes. Thank you

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Stall looks clean. Nasi lemak Chilli is nice. And also ayam taliwang chilli, consider spicy. There's another ayam balado chilli, is more spicy, try if u like spicy

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Very friendly cashier who will go her extra mile by remembering our orders and polite. She recognised faces and always accomadate to our request. Did not see her fir a while but glad that she is back. Kudos for having such a good staff. Don't know her name but she works every morning and tall.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Would rate 9/10 for the nasi lemak sold! Would have rated 10/10 if not for the pricing! It's a little too expensive but overall, the nasi lemak is delicious. Definitely it's a must to try! They have few other shops too!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Takeaway also excellent. The sauce and anchovies are super yummy

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Chicken was SUPER tender, had a wonderful bbq flavour! Rice was fragrant and rich with coconut. It was such a joyful experience and truly worth $5.90. Portion size is just right; and definitely coming back for more!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Well i saw quite a number of people Q'ing up ...And i decided to try it. I order their Nasi Lemak Set. Their Rice was fragrant. Sambal Chili is tasty and NOT too spicy. The chicken wing however the taste was so so...Average. Their Deep Fried Potato was good though. Overall i gave 4 stars ...Very good....

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: I have eaten many nasi lemaks in Singapore, but none of the nasi lemak can compare it to Malaysia.  This is the only nasi lemak I really feel it's so delicious!  The sambal is really spicy tho! It's better than Chong Pang Nasi Lemak. Will definitely return to order again!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content:
Service is nice. Chilli is nice esp for chilli lovers (still spicy though).

Ordered the Ayam taliwang. Chicken is tender but at same time some parts are abit dry n over cook. Nonetheless will still come back to eat if I’m in area.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content:
This food stall located at the Yishun Park hawker Centre is a pioneer in this dish - the Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang. They combined the traditional Nasi Lemak with one of Indonesia's unique chicken dishes, the Ayam Taliwang.

The chicken for this dish is grilled but the sauce or sambal which makes it truly unique on its own, the Taliwang Sambal. Their rice is absolutely fragrant with coconut milk and the chicken is tender and juicy!

They also have other varieties of Nasi Lemak and also side dishes which you can add-on. All in all, they are an affordable place to get great quality Nasi Lemak!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Tender chicken spicy sauce. Food is fresh and tasty. Portion is reasonable. However during peak hours expect a Q just to order, then another 10mins for the food to be ready.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Tasty food. Great for breakfast or brunch. Good spiciness. Friendly service even though they can be busy at times. Patronised this stall many times over the last couple of years. Thanks!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content:
Excellent grilled chicken rendition of nasi lemak. Smoky and tender. The service was good on a Sunday lunch time. Sambal was more sweet than spicy but the one on the chicken made up for the spiciness. Only wished the egg yolk would be runny.

My wife tabaoed this another day but after 45 mins, the chicken wasn’t as nice. Nonetheless, 5 stars if u r having it there.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Mine is at Canberra quite nice full of ingredients ...price also reasonable .however the chilli a bit bitter and not spicy must improve la .the rest still ok but rice not coconut a bit normal. as it's raining Day I taopao

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: The star dish, Ayam Taliwang is blessed with a chili that is a veritable storm of spiciness stir fried in with the fragrant dried shrimp. More power than Boon Lay's nasi lemak if you're looking for a kick!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content:
20/09/2020  - Ordered via Grabfood on 19/09/2020, 1pm++ (Tampines).  These are what I received (1st 3 images), all overnight food.

21/09/2020 - Owner left mobile number for me to contact him and send me a replacement with extra chicken wings on the same day I contact him (last image). There is great different in the items. And those in the last image should be their normal standard (but not Tampines Branch).

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: This stall sells on hybrid between Nasi Lemak with Taliwang grilled chicken (one of Indonesian speciality dish).. the coconut infused rice is very tasty and the grilled chicken is tender.. the staff also very friendly..

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Tried this for the first time last month as it was the top rated food around the area. Glad to say that it lived up to its review. Staff were friendly for a hawker outlet and food was tasty but just take note the sambal chilli is very hot for those who are unable to take spicy food recommend smaller portions of chilli, it’s really spicy even for my standard and I really enjoy spicy food. Overall I would say I was blown away by how much I actually enjoyed it idk whether I was lucky I got a fresh batch but it was nice and I really enjoyed it. Thanks

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Chicken was tender and flavourful. Chilli very spicy but shiok la. Recommended!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Quite a nice Nasi Lemak. Rice not as fragrance though. Overall quite good and expect some queue.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: One of the better stall in Yishun Park Hawker Centre. Love the fragrance coconut milk rice and fried chicken wing

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Been craving for a good nasi lemak for a while now. Had the set K and was blown away, the chili was spicy but I thoroughly enjoyed it. Such a generous portion of chicken and sambal.Even the bergedil was spot on.  Finally coming across nasi lemak sambal that is not sweet. Wayyy better than crave !!!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: One of my favourite eats at this hawker centre (Kalsom Kuih Muih is my other must-visit for their curry puffs). My favourite selections are the ayam taliwang belado and the nasi lemak with everything. The belado comes with a well seasoned, spoon-tender grilled chicken leg. Nice smoky flavours go well with the two chilli sauces, one sweeter one for the coconut rice (not overly lemak) and a spicier, pedas coarsely textured chilli for the chicken. They will pack the chilli separately in individual containers if you need to manage the spicy level.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Very good nasi lemak and fast take out delivery service too. 👍👍👍

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content:
Great nasi lemak! The rice is fragrant and the chicken is tender and well grilled with a good smokiness to it. And WOAHHH the chilli has a great deal of kick and tastes really good!
Order: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Really tasty and the waiting time was 7 mins for a succulent chicken thigh. Worth the wait. Thanks for the great lunch!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content:
Truly enjoyed the meal..ordered the ayam taliwang set. The main sambal is not overly sweet which i like..but the taliwang sambal was the best ..spicy and punch a kick. Asked for extra main sambal added with no extra cost..wanted to add the taliwang sambal too but felt so 'paiseh' to ask..lol. the grilled chicken was pretty decent , a good heathier alternatve to fried ones.
4 stars is because felt the rice could have been more grainier it was a little mush..but still nicely flavoured with a hint of lemongrass and coconut

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: We have tried ayam talibang, chicken wing nasi lemak, twice at Yishun Park, once at tampines... All Met our expectation  well.  The rice exceeds many stalls we have been over the years. Please keep up and maintain the standards.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: This store is usually good but today was disappointing. Hope this is not the usual standard. The nuts/ikan bills tasted a little stale. Chicken wing batter is not like before (not sure if recipe changed). Sambal is still good Thank goodness. If only the egg doesn't have a "MacDonald shape" and fried more naturally .. Anyway always has been a good store to me so hope today is not the new standard going forward.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: A couple that certainly takes pride in what they serve. Not just the food but respect for the customers. Greeting seniors respectfully ... keep it up.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: This Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang is delicious with it spicy gravy and they have a lots of variety to choose.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content:
It's rare to find good food with good service here in Singapore.This stall is one of the rare gems.

On service,the staff was very patient in explaining to me the differences between the 3 types of grilled chicken,and took the trouble to double confirm my orders.

Speaking of food quality,this is so far the best grilled chicken I had in Singapore.The outside is a bit charred and crispy,while the inside is tender and juicy.When you try to extract the flesh,it comes off easily.Only priced at $4.50 (for chicken only),which is very reasonable,considering the effort put in and the quality.

The Nasi Lemak was full of coconut flavor.Not the typical type you find here,which only has a hint of coconut flavor.It is comparable to Boon Lay Power Nasi Lemak,which in my opinion is one of the best in Singapore.

It was well worth my effort travelling up all the way just to try it.But what really attracted me to give the stall a try was the owner's sincere gesture in handling the complaint made by a customer.

We usually see owners or customer service officers responding with an apology,which is all.But this stall owner was willing to offer the customer a free meal,I think action speaks louder than words and I applaud such an act.

One final point: I don't take egg.I told the staff that I wanted my set without egg,and she immediately told me that I could change the egg to something else.I was impressed.

Most of the time,if I said I didn't want something,that was it,no replacement,and the amount of food given is the same,price is also the same.I would say this stall is very ethical in its business operation.Thumbs up and may your business prosper.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Not too spicy. Chicken wing is nice. Rice serving a little small though.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Rice was fragrant. But the grilled chicken was disappointing, its was tasteless and mushy (totally different from tender). Its like lifeless meat. Chilli wasnt what i expected too, there is a weird taste lingering in the mouth.

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: Ordered 22 boxes of nasi lemak Ayam taliwang (their signature rice) for a small party on quite a last minute notice. But Noorman was really prompt in attending to some of our special requests and offered some discounts here and there. The food came promptly at the time we wanted and the food is still piping hot, same standard as when we ate it at the stall itself. All our guests were impressed with the food quality. Will definitely consider ordering again if we have any gatherings. Thanks once again!

restaurant name: Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang - Yishun Park Hawker Centre
content: A very solid 3. Had their signature set K. But I think my chicken was alittle over-charred and there was a burnt taste to it. Even if I take that out of account, I felt the Nasi (rice) could be better and more fragrant. It's alittle starchy. The peanut to ikan ratio was also disappointing. But the chili is great. Overall if u happen to be here and have that Nasi Lemak or Indonesian BBQ craving, this would certainly satisfy u. But I think they can still improve. I will give it another try some time again. 👍

For mee reebus taste is decent but its 4 dollars for noodles and eggs. So overpriced.... within my vicinity i can get a full nasi lemak set at 3.50 with eggs chickenwings....really lost for words...

No price list also wonder how they put....
Amazing malay dishes! Plenty of traditional kuih available and friendly staff. Recommended!
Very disappointed that the roti prata and curry is served hard and cold. Hope they can improve this.
This keuh was nice and chewy. The rest like goreng pisang and ondeh ondeh, were so so.
My go to place for nasi sambal goreng. And my alltime classic kuihs..
The kuih is tip top. Especially go to the stall, for the variety of kuih. Other than that, the lauk is amazing too.
Delicious local cuisines at affordable prices. Amazing service too!
Friendly stall owner..

(Translated by Google) Best sambal goreng rice in yishun

(Original)
Best nasi sambal goreng in yishun

(Translated by Google) Serve the best fried chili rice.

(Original)
Serve the best nasi sambal goreng.

Update: wrote a 5 star review but husband and I subsequently got terrible abdominal pain and diarrhea in the middle of the night after eating dinner here!! Signals that their hygiene level is not up to standard! Will not patronise again, unfortunately.

===========

Very unassuming place, in an industrial building.

Pleasantly surprised by the food. The curry is really thick and flavourful. The curry chee cheong fun was amazing. The plain CCF with spring onion was decent too.

Curry mee was nice with a lot of ingredients. Ipoh curry hor fun was nice too, quite different in flavour.

Overall great, just wish it wasn't so oily. The food is pretty "sinful", won't eat so often but will be back.

We have been frequent this small eatery since yrs ago. One can never misse the Curry Chee Cheong Fun, either topped with shredded chicken or pig skin. The pig skin curry  is unique as we do not really get it easily here. It was deep fried then stewed with curry sauce which turned it soft yet retained the chewy texture. Curry sauce is really thick and aromatic. The CCF was tender, when soaked in curry sauce, one just cannot stop eating it until finished. The thin Hor Fun Noodle Soup has clear soup, mild chicken soup taste,  suitable for young kids who cannot take spicy food. Nasi Lemak is ok only, not really fantastic, the sambal is more on sweet side. Asam laksa is not really sour after sweetened. Broth is not very thick,  taste average. Curry Mee has the most generous portion with pig skin,  boneless chicken thigh pieces, tau pok and sliced fish cake. I changed yellow noodle to vermicelli which absorb the curry sauce more. This bowl of noodle is very satisfying and value for money. Coffee is not really nice if compared to the one we had in Ipoh.

Hidden within the industrial estate, an Ipoh eatery that serves very nice Malaysian food. Various style of Chee Chiong Fun not the type you find in hawker. Like the CCF mushroom & meat, nasi lemak, Rojak (with added crackers), and curry noodles.

The food is fresh and taste good. Environment is clean and tidy. The table setting makes me feel a little congested where I could easily hit the people sitting behind me. The price is a little high given the type of food they provide. Overall a good experience.

My dear Malaysian friend recommended this place for authentic Ipoh food. Price is very reasonable. Similar to foodcourt or kopitiam price. Their signature cheecheongfun is a must try. Very 👍 Curry noodle is 😋 too. The spring onion cheecheongfun taste ordinary, can skip that

Is been a year didn’t came back here breakfast.
I rmr my previous experience was the place are super crowded, waiting time too long.

Today went for early breakfast.
Surprisingly the the food taste better then last time 🤣 good !

Overall their foods is good, price wise slightly higher (if compare normal hawker), but they are aircon & nice deco environment so consider reasonable.

Recommend the Ipoh kopi , not so sweet n the taste jz nice.

Found this place by chance and the reviews on their Curry Chu Cheong Fan with pork skin. IN LOVEEEEEE. Asam laksa was alright and chicken chop was the saving grace of the nasi lemak. Had ice coffee but was quite tastless.. Nevertheless, will deft be back for the curry ccf!
Average food. Better to travel to Teluk Intan for the original. There is nothing special about the mee. The Assam laksa is good.

Very decent Malaysian food can be found here. Yam cake & chee Cheong fun were really good. Nasi lemak was big in portion and allso came with vegetables 👍 clean interior and plenty seats. Probably the only downside is that it is less accessible for those not driving.

I am not sure if this is authentic or not cause I never tried the original one before. However I do like the foods here and enjoyable. The Nasi lemak chicken cutlet and the curry taste are really nice. The Anson special zhu Chiong fan also nice and something special compare to other Chiong fan out there. The seats are limited. Come early if you don’t wish to wait too long. Enjoy~
Chong fan yummy. Curry mee was great except the chicken meat (got a "frozen" smell which was not so nice when consumed)

Introduced by a Malaysian bestie and claimed as the authentic Malaysian taste 😂😂
The Curry Pig Skin Chee Cheong Fun is recommended.

Should try the Dry Mee with Char Siew too, the sauce used is different from most of culinaries here.

Be prepared that it is crowded on weekend morning, decided to go for takeaway on 2nd visit.

Fantastic curry! I had the dried curry and soup, its about 80% close to what I can get in Ipoh! Had the nasi lemak and the anson special chee cheong fun, it was okay, nothing crazy good about it. The white coffee is good though, its creamy yet not too sweet. Love it! Overall, I quite like it!

Curry noodles was nice. Chock full of ingredients. Special CCF is interesting though chye poh was all I could taste. Their CCF texture is probably the softest around even compared to HK style. But this is Ipoh style. So they don’t do char siew or prawn. And that is a real pity.

Nice Asam Laksa and Curry Mee 😋.
To his store manage to satisfy our craving for Malaysia food

Yummy! We tried few dishes of G Cheong Fun, pig skin curry G Cheong Fun, Signature G Cheong Fun & Dry Chicken Curry Hor Fun..the G Cheong Fun is OK, the Dry Curry was great, love it 🥰🥰 as for pig skin curry, the pig skin was great as for the curry, i think the coconut milk was a bit too thick. 🤤🤤 the Signature dish was yummy 😘😘😘 the rojak with crackers are superb 😘😘🥰🥰 heong piah was great (served warm)..coffee so-so..overall experienced is Great 🥰🥰🥰
Tried the pumpkin n yam kueh n nasi lemak, quite good. But best of all,  do the chee cheong fun,  best!  Will b back....

It's cheap, have nice decor n aircon. Yam cake is good enough. Laksa n special chee cheong fun is not so good, try ordering other stuff. Can improve by tidying n decor the place better. Service can be faster. Prices should be clearly stated. Go during off peak to find a seat. I will still give 5 star because it's cheap n unique place.

Food is nice with reasonable price, GST inclusive. Authentic Malaysian Food. Like their curry Chu Cheong Fun and Char Siew in the dry noodles. The Char Siew just tasted like those I had in Malaysia. Yam cake is good too.

Today went over this place for lunch but we do not have a menu to look at and make our order. The staff told us only one menu is available and it was place at the ordering counter. When we are looking at the menu, the queue started and the staff told us to put the menu back for those who are in queue to place order. Later the staff told us to scan the QR code to place our order. I just wondering if old people doesn't know how to use phone to scan QR code to place order then no need to order. Besides how can such a eatery just print one miserable menu. Perhaps they just want to cater to young patrons. Furthermore the auntie taking the order also very bad attitude as though we own her money. Their food taste wasn't to my liking. For sure this will be the first n last time patron this eatery.
My favourite restaurant for Assam laksa and Anson Chee CheongFun

Recommend by friend. 1st tried. As Malaysian I think these was far from Authentic. But if crave it, don’t aspect too high. I think “Malaysia Boleh” laksa better then this and Ipoh curry mee yishun Industrial Street was nice than here. But the environment here was pretty good and the Ipoh white coffee is nice.
Found Malaysia delicacies I would recommend. I like the curry with pork skin! Serve with the ice coffee it’s the best match. Yummy!

Delicious Ipoh food. The curry mee was super delicious. Thick and flavorful. The assam laksa was authentic too! The ice white coffee was thick and good. Anson special chee cheong fun was special. It was full house at 6.30 pm on a Sunday. Ample parking space outside the cafe. Bought some Ipoh snacks to try.

Went over for a weekday lunch. Not crowded. Price is reasonable for an aircon place although it's in an industrial area. I found the chee cheong fun over-rated and mine was served cold. It has a nice fragrance from the taste of shallots and that's it. We saw they were busy so didn't feedback. Not sure if it is better on other times as feedback from others here were good.
We enjoyed the curry chicken and assam noodles although it's a little watery. Nice coffee and tea. Will return to try the yam cake, porridge and nasi lemak.

Authentic Anson fare. Love their Curry Pig Skin and Anson Special. More mint leaves might help enhance the flavours for their Penang Laksa. Overall a wonderful dining experience with very authentic Malaysian fare.  😊👍🏻

Tried the curry pig skin ccf. As a Ipoh Kia myself, the ccf is indeed very smooth and soft in texture , one the few best. But the curry is not thick enough and lack of flavour , also can't taste curry flavour from the pig skin (by right the pig skin itself should be flavourful enough). The long bean also a bit hard and raw. Can try if you are nearby but don't set your expectation too high

I sum up this place as a watering hole for ppl who miss KL food. Definitely can't beat the famous, authentic but hard to find KL Pasar Pudu wet market curry chee cheong fun. Ingredient-wise, Anson Town is a little more like Ipoh style with pig skin, long beans and thicker curry sauce (KL one has fu-zok, fragrant haebee & lots of sesame seed). I quite like their baked kaya kok (triangulated puff pastry with kaya filling) - not cheap but this is S'pore what. A must try for first-timers

Highly recommended!
Went on 24/09/2022, the Chicken curry Chee Cheong Fun is very nice, tasty curry gravy, the rojak is very delicious, also recommend curry me, tasty curry gravy and it's very big portion & many ingredients. Also recommend Ipoh Coffee.

Delicious food at reasonable price and  in cosy cafe.  Loved the curry noodles here, tasted like the ones i had in JB. The chee cheong fun is worth mentioning as well, silking warm rice rolls with i think is fried onions which is very flavorful. The nasi lemak is not as good but worth a try. Ample parking lots situated right infront of the cafe. Will be back to try more of other chee cheong fun flavors and definitely the curry noodles again.

This "ulu" bistro was packed on a weekday lunch. Lovers of Malaysian-style chee cheong fun and curry noodles would like the menu here. Unfortunately, I find the food a bit disappointing. I ordered 3 types of ccf, 1 nasi lemak and 1 curry noodles. The tastes were generally bland. Maybe I am used to the more flavourful "San Cheng" Malaysian noodles which can be found in many shopping centres. The kaya puffs looked promising but the kaya and the pastry were not fragrant. They had draft beer and fried bar snacks here.
The taste of the Chee Cheong Fun is delicious, soft, and smooth. It surprised me when I took the first bite. But the taste of the pigskin is so so...

Authentic Ipoh style cuisine. Easy on the pocket.

Review revised on 11 Nov 20.

Now the business here has improved dramatically but service quality went the opposite direction.

The first batch of the staff were from Malaysia. They were humble and very attentive. All left now, possibly due to covid.

The current workers are from China and Vietnam. They have one thing in common: very rude. Especially the China national, just need to sit in here for 5 minutes, you can hear her yelling at customers telling them to collect the food, order verification etc. She even told customers that :"last time no customers, now I am very busy."

The only good service you will receive is from the bosses who appear usually on Sunday.

I hope that they can hire locals or possibly pay more to the staff so that there might be a small chance they would behave better.
Cheong fan texture is nice but too dry, curry is thick but the spice taste is too strong like hindu curry. 純屬個人口味

Great tasting Teluk Intan food. Have not been there so can't compare but food is value for money at the quality served. Great chillax ambience too, complimented by soothing Chinese MTV. Liked the pan fried chee cheong fan, dry curry noodle, chicken chop nasi lemak, great coffee and the oh so good bean curd.

Dine in today and the food taste much better than takeaway. Their Chee Cheong Fun is the signature dish, you can have it many ways, dry, soy sauce, curry, plain and many more. The rice roll is soft and taste better either way. I think that makes their speciality as their Hor Fun also have the same texture. Their noodles also not bad. Although prices are slightly higher than food court, but I think their speciality makes them worth a try if you craving for Malaysian tasted food and dining ambience Is very comfortable with aircon. Last but not least, their Ipoh coffee is thick and creamy too.

Happened to be in Sembawang running errands. Did an online search where to have lunch and Anson Town Bistro popped up. The place was packed on a weekend afternoon when we swung by. Ordered: Pig skin curry chee cheong fun, curry noodles, chicken chop nasi lemak. Must say they serve decent Malaysian-style food. Do try when you're in the area.
If you are the someone who misses Malaysian delicasies, Anson Town can satisfy your gourmet cravings especially the cheong fun serve in curry gravy

Went there last Sunday but it was super crowded and it didn't look like there was a system to manage the crowd. There were people standing around the tables to wait/chope the tables. There were people queuing to order the food. You wouldn't know what to do, whether to find a table first or to queue and place order at the cashier. Just very messy. We immediately left the place and the group behind us pretty well did the same.

Went there again ytd, a Friday afternoon. Around 2pm plus which was already after lunchtime. Only a few tables were occupied but there were at least 3 to 4 tables with crockery uncleared. There was only one uncle trying to clear all the dirty tables and the used crockery after being cleared was placed beside the self service station for the clean crockery. The hygiene level, IMHO, was totally not there. The menu at the cashier was also stained w gravy and they didn't even bother to wipe it.

We ordered curry chicken noodles, assam laksa, two fried chicken. Assam laksa was quite good, the flavour was there and as close as those I had in JB. Curry noodles on the other hand was lacklustre, and the chicken pieces were probably 4 thin slices. The fried chicken was my least favourite, one dimension flavour tho it was served hot.
The location is quite secluded. However, the price would make up for it. Comfort food for those who miss the hometown.
Cosy environment. They do sell beers at night. If you prefer quiet place with some decent foods, this could be your choice. They are located at industrial area.

Nice place. Tried Fried chicken chop Nasi Lemak $5. Taste so so. Rice not so fragrance. Tried Dry Mee $4. Taste also so so. Curry chicken cheong fun $4.50 is good, curry is great! This I will recommend to try. Coffee also not bad.
Nice food 👍🏻 The service is good. Small cozy traditional cafe located within an industrial building.

cheong fun is too dry. Asam laksa & nasi lemak are okay. Rojak is nice.
But this outlet is quite far from bus stops which is 10mins walking distance.

Tried penang laksa, ipoh hor fun and anson special chee cheong fun. Laksa taste ok lack of prawn paste. Chee cheong fun is not up to my expectation as uts kind of bland and dry. The hor fun taste normal. Like the home made soya bean milk, quite tasty and not too sweet.
Food is okay but not great, not worth to travel the extra mile for. Curry mee is overrated.

I have never tried the food in Anson before. But the food in this restaurant had unique food that aren't commonly found in Singapore.

They also bake their pastries fresh everyday. My family loves the traditional pastries.

Rojak with crispy cracker taste good, but because they use a bowl, all the rojak sauce sank to the bottom and it turned out super salty.

The rest of the food were great, I love the Anson Special chee cheong fun, very silky and smooth. Will definitely try other flavour next time.

Overall, nice ambience and great food!
The soup ipoh hor fun was quite good, but everything else was just average. They close quite early at 8pm as well.

It is too crowded during weekend lunch and long queue. Food is just average. Only nasi lemak and chicken wing/cutlet is recommended. The rest are really average i.e. curry noodles, rojak.  Not really worth the queue. The Anson Chu Chang Fen is disappointing... the heung piah and daosa piah worth try as it is fresh.
Staff are very friendly. I like the asam laksa noodle soup, the soup are very thick and the curry noodle are tasty. Highly recommend to those missing malaysian food people 🤤😁.

Mee soto and mee rebus - some of the best I've had in SG. They're not heavy on the palette after eating and ingredients are fresh. Don't forget the bergadil, epok epok (kentang❤️) and fried tempeh which are all tasty as well.

Stallholders are lovely too. You can tell they take pride in the food they sell.

(Sorry I didn't take any photo the last few times I had the food from here cos couldn't wait lol)

Stall owner is friendly & accommodating to order request
Loves the Longtong as it's fresh cabbage and ingredients well cooked with lemak definitely a go for dish
Briyani with long grain rice with spicy Chicken curry just appetizing with extra curry and papadan, a filling meal indeed. But must note that this is different from Indian Briyani

Will go back for more and update with Photos of dishes 😉
Tried their Mee rebus and lontong. Both really good. To be honest I felt it was better than all the other stalls opened in the morning in this coffeeshop.
They offer delicious Malay food, the sambal chili is homemade by the boss.
Nice

(Translated by Google) Hidden gem for malaysian food. Delicious dough!

(Original)
Hidden gem for malaysian food. Sedap doh!
Only came here for prata and teh halia…shiok. Service does get very slow when they are busy so come during off peak. Egg prata price is now $2.00 🙀 halal neighborhood restaurant

Today I have mutton rice asked worker to put little extra piece. They charged $ 11.50 price. Which is ridiculous for the meal. They gave only curry apart one vegetable which is smelly and useless appalam. I mean not puffy. When I asked why are you charging this much simple answer for the extra piece. Day light robbery. When I asked for the break up they literally showing finger. Just pay or keep the food you ate.

Workers atitude is so horrible! I wanted to order Prata Tissue and they rejected my request as they told me they were busy with so many customers orders. And can't even make 1 piece of prata tissue 🙄 then after 15 mins sitting at the table while my family's food finished, I tried my luck again to order Prata Tissue as most of the customers has  leave the makan place, they accepted my order. How pathetic that is. And im complaining about prata tissue overall. Hahahaha

I'm not sure is the workers' attitude or lack of ingredients .. We were there to get our supper last night. Ordered mee goreng.. Maggi goreng.. Fried rice.. Sup kambing and nasi briyani. Mee goreng had nothing in it.. Just plain noodles with dark soya sauce.. Not even a stripe of beansprouts or vege..not even with sambal.. N yet tasteless at all.. We all were very very surprised n dissatisfaction with the food. Eat halfway n end up in dustbin chute. Haven't mentioned that each of the food was priced at 5-6 each. Sorry to say even hawkers economic noodles looks n taste better. Sup kambing was just spiced with water, only 4pieces of small cut of meat in the Sup..n not to mention was full of grease. Chicken Briyani rice just don't feel like it..to cut the bad time short.. Too harsh to say.. We hope you may cheat us that night... But hope that others will take note. That's our first and last. Next time we definitely go for McD. Thanks
Another delicious Indian Muslim foods restaurant. Just only seating capacity limited to 30 to 40 pax only. Parking space No problem

Ordered masala thosai and one of its gravy was totally bland zero taste. After making payment told the guy at counter about it and his answer was that’s how it is supposed to taste like. Wow. Ego too big i guess. Anyway other food I order wasn’t nice too actually. Nasi goreng kerabu taste more like rice with white pepper. Good luck to those trying 😎

I had ordered a Mee Goreng last, last night. We waited and waited. We saw them serving other customers first. (we were regular customers in the day, so they probably did not recognize us) After 45 min, a customer said that is too long and left. So, we decided to go also. But before we told them we are gonna leave, we asked them if they are going to give us the food. All of the workers in the restaurant were very responsible except one person. He is the person at ordering station. After we had asked him, he said that if you can't wait, then leave. We had waited for almost 1 hour.
The cook came and said that he already cooked a lot. That is when the reason for the problem came. The person who shouted at me actually served his regular customers. The cook knew us. He tried to calm me down and gave the food to us. We said thank you to the chef and left. So, only the person who was at the the ordering station was irresponsible. Now, you might know the reason why they serve your food very late. Thank you for taking your time to read this!
Delicious and fast service even sometimes very crowded
Awesome prata as always. *Don't change it! Yes, I like fried chicken briyani too 👍
Reasonably good local food but slightly expensive in my view. Try it as it's 24hrs open.

A little dirty but the food is hella good. The service is good too. Just the floor and tables looked oily. But I guess it's kinda normal? But anyway it's super good. Really recommend for eating at night. The atmosphere feels really warm.
They will test your patience. Even though it was not that busy on this Saturday night 10 pm they kept me waiting 15 minutes for my banana prata untill I finish my teh tareh..
Not much choice of food after 2am.....but still service is good
Nasi Lemak surprisingly good. Egg yolk perfect, wings crispy, and with teh halia cost less than $5
Good place to hang out with friends, especially at night as it is open 24 hours. The good is good and the price is also reasonable. Very good prata can be found here.

Used to always patronized this place during yesteryears. Came back and it still e same. thou I miss the 'used to have' nasi lemak there but still the current food is still good, service and atmosphere still e same. I enjoyed!
Food is good and affordable... Open till late
Good service , fried rice and stir fried food is to go far
I like the dosay some western, seafood and teh alia ok not bad
Quality of food letter bit down need to maintain.

Staying in yishun for 40 year and my family and relatives all stay here for over 50 year.. been buying food from syed since it open its door. But  now they abit arongant and only really serve outsider we regular they never really serve and waiting time is longer for us and also they abit stingy with the condiment and garnishes... eg cucumber sauces

Visit this shop early in the morning to meet up with friends. The place is not crowded. Alot of seats are available during my visit. The service is as expected in an Indian Muslim restaurant. They will accede to your request without hassle. The food we order in the morning are the obvious, which is Prata. The crowds start to build up after 8am. If meeting friends or just to fill up for breakfast, nothing fancy, this place will do.

Use the kiap to take the rojak, there is the typical fried potato, fried square beancurb, hotdog which are fried, fried fillet fish, flour items which are fried, contains some fried egg or vegetable. There is fried prawn on a fried flour or just mass fried small prawn on flour. There is also fried sotong available. Once you have chosen the items, they will refry it to perfection. Comes with cucumber

the service was bad ! asked for fish curry but gave dalca and took them a good 10 minutes (YED I TIMED IT) to change the gravy when the prata is already served . i overheard 1 of the waiter said to a lady customer "next time say extra sweet la" in a unhappy tone . patronise at your own will .
The food is worth the price. the service is always quick. You get Indian food too - dosa, chapathi, idly.
So lousy service as well the food. Better go food court.. much more cheaper and nice.for take away charge extra with poor packaging.. paper box. (Sambal and rice spill all over the box)

Expensive price for poor quality of food. Nasi goreng thai only 1pcs small prawn, nasi not cook consistently white rice can still be seen. Drinks haphazard, skimped on ingredients, drinking diluted teh chino....

My family and I was craving for prata. We ate few times but today’s experience was horrible. Upon reaching a table, there’s an ipad left on the table beside the table we are located. I partially open the cover of ipad and check if someone has left it, but I decided to move it away from our table and leave it. About 15mins later a Lady confronted us and say next time dont touch, ask around and thats how she reserved the table. She talked to us in a bad tone. We apologised and keep quiet. The mentioned lady was apparently working in the shop. After few minutes, a guy, who is working also in the shop, talked to us and said “what she said was right? Do you have something to say?” Then we defend ourselves. They embarrassed us in front of many people which is not a customer service. To the owner of this shop, may review the cctv and investigate on the incident. A belonging that is valuable shouldnt be left unattended. Such behaviour is unacceptable for customer service. A proper and mannerly approach should be considered. Hope you can take action on this.

Large amount of Indian and Malai food varieties available here,.. I personally like their service, maintanance and their coffee. For food taste i would like to give 5 stars ratings, but in hygienic matter can give 3 stars only. Overall it's recommendable place to have good food in Yishun.
Eaten egg and plain prata here. Teh tarik with ginger is nice. Ordered mine with reduced sugar 😊
This stall has slacken in their food
Normal rojak but i like the tek terak
Best prata ! Super like the fish curry sauce
Varieties of food available, well served by their staff, operating 24hrs and convenient cark parking nearby.

I will not beat around the bush, the Indian food is really good! This is a little hidden gem in the rough. Not many know about it, but those who do, swear by it. Hands down the best Mee Goreng Mamak and Teh Tarik in the north! I have tried most of their dishes, and none disappoint. Do give it a try if you're around the area!
Food is gud but the service is late....need wait take time
Good service, helpful staff. I must say that they have since upgraded their rojak sauce, it is now comparable to Ministry of Rojak.

One of the best midnight food haunts within Yishun.

Offers plenty of our local Indian food options, prata, murtabaks, mee gorengs and what nots.

Price wise, definitely more worth than its competitors within the area.

Parking space are never a hassle. Plenty of available lots.
Great briyani sold here. Chicken rice and other  malay stall also not bad. The only issue here is, need to wait very long for drinks that have been ordered.

They said here got thai style cook n I double confirm and waiter said true..  I go n order bihun tomyam, but taste not like thai style at all... hmm I'm so disappointed 😭 but I'm still finish my meal 😆 I'm just don't like to do a  wasted ..

Not the best prata in the north but still is a good prata. The rest of the food is quite average depending on the cook for the day. So the food isnt that standardise. Fast service and good value for money. The place is accessible by bus with about 4-5 minutes of walking. You could generally find a parking space here. The place is clean and the people serving are friendly.
Friendly staff, Great food Great drinks!. However i think location wise can be improved as its very hot n humid there

normal indian muslim food...prices used to be ok ...but it has gone up.
ice water is now 50 cents a cup up from 30 cents before.

no more smoking area too.
so smokers take note.
The food was good. Most the food in the menu was not available. Had to order 3 times before I go to eat.

No quality and expensive.. $7 for a plate of so called “seafood” hor fun with only 1 not fresh small prawn and few pieces of sotong at a void deck Coffeeshop..  when we double check with the menu it was only written as $6 and they even argue because I ask for seafood? Hmmm... better watch it when you do decide to come here to eat..

Excellent teh halia (tea with a "kick" - ginger water). The roti john (no human flesh here, just a nice toasted baguette with scrambled egg, roasted chicken chunks, tomato-barbeque sauce and mayonnaise!) was fantastic, the nasi goreng ikan bilis (fried rice with crunchy fried little fish) was fresh and hot! Will try other dishes next time...
it's my one of the favourite restaurant food and drinks taste yummy amazing 👏 😋
Nice food everytime. Over the years their service improved, even though they are busy they still managed to serve us on time.

A good Indian restaurant in neighbour around Yishun church. They sell South Indian Halal food. The restaurant is stretched over 4 shops in a raw selling a large verity of Indian food. Their Prata Bom (prata with cheese and condensed milk in it) tastes great. Will go again for sure.
Awesome Indian food. Great prata and curry (fish). Generally almost everything you order here is great-tasting especially from their Thai menu.

Abit on the pricey side for a prata but the quality is undoubtedly one of the best that I've tasted. The curries are excellent and I would highly recommend the mutton curry, tender and yum 😋 tasty. I would go again when I want to pay that kind of price again for a great prata. 👍

For 2 cup of tea and 4 prata (2 eggs and 2 plain prata)- $15 was on the high side.
Even if food inflation and the high rental had been incorporated inside, $15 was really expensive.
The saving grace, was the food was good. Nice prata. Including my ginger tea was nice.
Surprisingly, though I felt the prices were high, it was very crowded. Seemed the rest of the crowd were comfortable with the pricing.

Reached the store at 9.30am and it was already crowded, about 60% of the seats were taken up. I ordered one egg and one plain prata, food was served in about 20 minutes, waiting times was abit long. Other than that, food was delicious and stall cleanliness was good.

Had brunch at Prata Wala last Sunday.

Some food needs to be consumed almost immediately. Take for instance, roti prata.. Crispy prata and warm curry! 🤤 It's never disappointing for me even if I order grabfood.

So I had to jio my mom and sister to try out at least once. Indeed, we enjoyed our food that day.

Keep on doing your best and bring out the best food quality to us consumers. Thanks for the effort, appreciate much!

I visited in lunch time. They don't serve ta doori meals then. I ordered Curry chicken briyani set, Butter chicken prata set and cheese prata. Butter chicken curry had aroma of charcoal roasted. Other curry sauces were all different taste. All of them  were yummy.
I would try tandoori meals at dinner time.

Amazing food! The whole experience from start to finish is great waiter is always so friendly and kind. Very tasty and well prepared and can choose among many menu options. Absolutely amazing place to eat, 10 of 10 for every single aspect of this meal, and this is coming from people who know and love great food! The staff ( Danes )  and greeter were very nice. Our waiter was awesome, the staff also worked as a team in bringing and cleaning up our food. Highly Recommend!!!
Super yummy Indian food ! Best Prata other than Prata house . Super affordable 👍🏼 Two pax - roughly $30 - their BEST butter chicken prata set, masala thosai, two teh iced
The onion pratas were good and had lots of fresh onions inside. The only downside is the prata here are quite costly. Pratas were served fast - hot and crispy.
Always doesn’t disappoint! In terms of service, and food! Definitely will come back again. Thanks!

The food  is exceptional! Very tasty and well prepared and you can chose among many menu options. I love the service at the place the staff Danes is so friendly with the guests and always takes care to offer the best quality! I highly recommend this place.

Service has improved tremendously! Manager and staff were very polite and helpful. This is a huge improvement from the previous team of staff. I’d rate the service 5 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

I can’t say the same for the food quality. The pratas were average, just soft and there’s zero crisps (not even on the outside). Plaster prata came with a fully cooked egg. Garlic nann was extremely tough as well. Teh was poorly made.
Prata wala says #skipthestraw but they put the curry in a disposable paper container 🤦

Very rude staff service. The staff accidentally opened the door and knocked on my mum. Instead of making appologize, the staff told my mum should not use that path. If this was not a walkway, shouldn't you put a signboard there. Shouldn't you appologize as a basic manner?  I spoke the manager but the manager just pretended busy and did not take any remedial action for the rude behavoiur of his staff. Bad service n will not cime back again.

One of the best prata (and curry) I've ever had, as well as very good service from ordering to tray collection. This is my go-to place for prata and I hope no one realises how good Prata Wala is so I won't need to queue.
The curry chicken is good, poured gravy over the rice, making it very flavourful. Have not tried the part yet. Good service as the staff kept walking around asking if the food is ok.

If u crave for soft-type prata, this is the place for you! The prata has its own unique sweet taste. But to me personally, I would come back for the teh tarik! It's balance between sweetness, milk, and tea was just right. The prata that I would recommend you to try would defo be the plain prata as you can really taste its raw unique sweetness. Give it a go!
Pretty gd prata, curry watery but OK. First time coming here, a little ex.
Food was amazing! Awesome briyani! Naveed delivered customer service very well. Will definitely come again!
One of my go-to places for Indian food. A hot cup of nice teh tarik and crispy prata made to order in this rainy day just…  🤤💯
Yummy Roti Prata and Fish Curry goes together so well. Set Briyani Rice not bad too. And milk tea so delicious.

It’s a great experience. The ambiance is very welcoming and charming. Amazing food and service. A staff by the name of danish i met there was extremely friendly,knowledgeable and make great hospitality during my dining. Highly recommended.
Bought their set lunch for 19.90. ordered the chicken curry prata and butter chicken biryani, comes with 2 drinks too! Nice!

I ordered 5 food via grab food. They delivered only 4 and the items also different. When I make a call to the manager, she said to collect from their restaurant. She refused to arrange the delivery. So rude

This is the second time in a row prata wala has got my order wrong. I ordered takeaway so I didn’t realize until I got home. Terrible, especially since I paid more than the food I got. One of the times they even gave me briyani when I ordered prata. The receipt is on the bag. But they just anyhow pack the food inside. Such a disappointment after waiting so long for the food.

It has been one of my worst experiences here in Singapore for my quest for good Indian food and Biryani. If you get a chance, do yourself a favour and get out. There are better options at B2 food court. Forget about the value for price but the quality of food is not supposed to be served at all. Chicken is very old that it is literally rubber now. Biryani is far below par taste and forget about the overpriced prata and teh!

Hi, I had a wonderful meal at North Point recently the food is really awesome will be bc again for the food n service, n the staff wearing a cap wit black long sleeve with his spec really oberservent ,he chk on our food drinks n gt our feed bc that's which is  really good practice even though it's prata wala. The whole team was really service oriented, cheers guys will c u soon tc..

Was brought to this restaurant by one friend who said that his family will always eat here when visiting at Singapore.

Their roti prata are made fresh to order and thus, what can go wrong with freshly made prata. The curry complemented the prata well. Not expensive at all considering the air con environment.
Had a wonderful dinner tonight. Although it's a bz day but the guy named Danes served me well n patiently took my order. Kudos to the team.❤️
Good food, fast service and convenient location.
Curry fish head was yummy and fresh but takes awhile to serve. Maybe can improve by cooking the vegetables longer too. 😋

Food is decent but the service is ridiculously slow.

The customer is often left wondering at the cashier and waiting for the staff to eventually attend to you. Some give up and leave the queue in frustration.

The food preparation time is dismally slow despite the “fast food service” claim by the business. The result is the seating area where few seated diners are actually eating whilst the others are just waiting for their orders to arrive.

My drink order was served at 1042h (took 30 mins!?) and food finally arrived at 1050h (took 40 mins?!)

C’mon guys... get your act together.

Had a wonderful dinner . Gud recommendation by the cashier girl and great service by the guy named Danes who served us. Food was soo good and delicious . The restaurant was soo clean and comfort to eat . Will b back again
Decent to good standard Indian food. Slightly on the pricier side.

The food is good. But the service is not good. If there any delay in serving food then they should inform earlier while placing the order rather than keep us waiting for 45mins. All are busy in packing the food for online orders only.

i feel so shock when i reach home and open up the box, portion is so little and also i ask the guy packing the last piece of chicken is the chicken hot and he mention  "yes hot hot" and he pack inside the plastic bag and turns out chicken is so cold just like it have been left in the food tray for few hour.
We had a very bad experience today with prata wala. Worst service. Too much waiting time. Food quality was average only. Please make sure the availability of food  before taking order.
The egg prata is crispy and soft. Fish curry also delicious and pair with teh tarik, awesome. Staff friendly.
Plain prata is nicely crisp. Kopi is special. Waiting time is abit long. Just go in and sit, no need to queue (the queue is for takeaway).
Friendly staff and amazing food! The place was also clean and hygienic! Will definitely be back again! (:

Today I ordered Tandoori Chicken from this restaurant. I got it packed and when I opened the box there were just 2 small pieces of tandoori chicken. Sad part is this is not at all worth for its price ( 7.60SGD).   This is very expensive and tasteless. If you wana try tandoori chicken please skip this place.
Reliable consistent local curry and biryani fare served in generous portions - will never be disappointed
Enjoyed the plain dosai. Crispy yet soft. Also bought butter chicken. Quite generous serving.

$1.50 per kosong prata. Elsewhere could be cheaper. But the clean environment and one of the nicest prata we have eaten so far deserve the high price.
The curry serving is enough for 2 pratas. We feel more is needed if order more than 2.

Excellent restraunt.😊We can get North Indian food here. Such as chicken tikka, biriyani rice , prata and others .Their chikken tikka taste really awesome. I personally recommend it. If you loves North Indian food can go for this without any doubt .Excellent and authentic north Indian food.Lunch time will be crowded. Most reasonably priced. Staff and Manager Naveed are more than willing to go the extra mile for customer satisfaction.Great teamwork also .

Shocking customer experience and mediocre food.
Should have check out the reviews first instead of just walking in. Will give 0 star if I could.
Went there with my son because he thought the prata looks good but boy, were we in for a nasty surprise!
Staff came over and shouted at him saying he was eating too slow and other people are waiting for the table.
There was only two people queuing, that might be eating in or taking away. But there was a few other tables that are empty.
Regardless, we did not just order one drink and sit there chatting. He just a young child and to be shouted at with these remarks is really appalling.
The reviews on customer service and quality shows a very clear indication that something needs to be done with training and managing of the quality otherwise prata wala will soon be PRATA WAN DAN soon!

This outlet is at the old North wing, near Cold storage. We had the tandoori set for two and used an eatigo discount for 20% at 6.30pm (only at Northpoint outlet) $25.60 for two of us plus two teh tarik. Impatient diners must note it does take some time for tandoori. It was a very good deal because the set was huge and most importantly, the quality was good. Chicken was well flavoured and tender. You queue, pay and collect your drinks. The buzzer system is a little odd. They ring you once but it is actually for the drinks which you have already collected. The second buzzer is the one which would indicate your food is ready. Good service at this outlet. Having said that, I am quite a patient and forgiving person.
Ordered curry chicken bryani for takeaway.  The curry chicken was tough and bland. Not sure if they had used frozen chicken meat. Will think twice before buying again.

One of the renowned and authentic prata houses. Prices of food served are slightly on the high side but  make up with the quality of food. The restaurant, though, needs to improve in terms of its furniture and overall cleanliness.

Small, cold and non crispy Fried chicken.

The star here is their curry sauce and Rice.
The food was awesome.My fav was there chicken curry with parata *must try* . The staff over there really very kind and fast service.Wl recomend to other friend and visot soon.

Good food. Nice service. Poori was a little thick. Otherwise food was good. Service by the male staff was very good. The lady also was all smiles and good. They can make it better by simply cleaning tables and chairs well and sweeping the floor now and then. The washbasin can be kept cleaner too by running water now and then. Hope they don't loose their Indian cook and service staff. Both are awesome or have to get local Singaporean Indian shop soggy Thosai and bad service.

I always enjoyed Indian food.  The chapatti is nice and the gravy is generous.  The chapatti is rather small but they have 4 pcs. Still,  I had bigger chapatti at about the same price they charge.
Will return to try other goodies though.
Komala’s is one of the most excellent Indian food restaurants in Singapore. To try vegetarian Indian food, you must visit Komala’s! Highly recommended!

I’ve visited quite often here because of few reasons those closed to me, always satisfied with food quality n taste, and quickly serve the order.

Parotta and kurma best options, however, not a big fan of samosa as I don't like curry.

A nice Indian vegetarian cuisine. A good place in Yishun to have scrumptious meal and snacks. The quality is pretty good and value for meal. Good hygiene but tad small. I had Vegetarian meals, vadai and bhatura chana in various instances. The taste was consistent and flavourful.
I ordered 4 meals through grabfood for breakfast. 1 meal wasn't delivered. maybe the shop missed an order due to high order volume.

Loved this place which is located right beside GV Yishun and Murugan grocery store. They have a huge variety of options available and the taste and quality of food is also very good.
And it’s a vegetarian only restaurant. Here’s what we ordered and how we felt:

Masala Dosa meal - comes with Masala dosa, 1 idli, 1 vada and a choice of drink - 4/5
Pav Bhaji - 4/5
Chole Batura - 4/5
Samosa chat - 4/5
Bru coffee - 5/5
Badam milk - 3/5
Lime juice - 3/5
Plain dosa - 5/5
Food is tasty but the side dish for dosa idly pongal not enough.they are giving very less.eventhough they will provide again.but we need to see the server face to ask our needs.cofee was not tasty.

Was disappointed at first with the small space when we walked into the restaurant. We ordered Masala Dosai meal and South Indian Meal. Both sets came with tea. We had teh tarik and masala tea. The food is very good and so is the tea. We enjoyed our meal very much. The attending staffs were very courteous and helpful. The overall experience was very pleasant.

ordered food thru foodpanda.. sgd 15+ for thosa meal including delivery charge.. received food : only thosa + 1 idly!!!.. 1x vadai + 1x drink missing !!! and no notfication from komala's team.. contacted foodpanda team. very helpful. they manage the situation well.
Good south Indian food

Food has dropped the standard, service very bad. At times they even bother if u call them, plastic spoon given to wat puri. Not sure ,how their thought process on intake of food, one of the aunty sound quite rude, when I asked for spoon, then my drink was not served yet till I finished 1 puri. Disappointed!!! No more going there 😀
Best vegetarian restaurant in this area
Lady staff is very rude. Lady staff is behaving very rude when we ask a baby chair for my 6 month baby. Male staffs are nice and food also good.
Great food & good service. Not too oily and love their not too sweet tea too.
Great authentic food and reasonable prices. Would be nice if they used less plastic...
Quality food at reasonable prices. Service was fast and excellent, highly recommended to eat here. Value for money.
Good restaurant had south indian Tali meals good taste
The food is delicious and prices are affordable. I am very glad that there is this restaurant near my place.

Best thosai I've had in a long while. Fast, fresh, and the sauces are really tasty too. However it can be a tad less salty.

Cleanliness can also be improved, there were leftover stains on the table where we sat. and air con was too cold
Food is awesome. Friendly staff. Downside is just small and limited  seating area. Cleanliness is good.
Delicious food...nice friendly staff...just tat the outlet is abit too small... overall very good
This restaurant has a amazing Indian (North/South) cuisines and drinks to taste it. I like it. 😀

This is the second time they forgot items for my takeway food...first was the extra saambar and today was the bru coffee...
Hello management..make sure your staff packs all the items not miss out...we cant be going to the restaurant to collect ...
Nice place to eat south and north indian foods in reasonable price and in enjoyable envirement
Best masala tea in Singapore Johor n Riau
The vegetarian food served here is great. Besides food, I like their Masala tea and coffee. In addition to food and drinks, the customer service is good as well.
Reasonable prices for food taste. I love it.

This place is small and cramped. Expect some waiting time if you're planning to dine in here. This more like take-away food cart.

The first step into the restaurant nobody was assisting us to be seated. One of the male staff can be seen just standing and looking around, barely moving. Next we placed our order and it was fast serving for the main items, but the drinks and some small side orders not to be seen. We had to ask twice for it to be served.

The food was OK OK only, not so amazing, but the pricing was more towards the expensive side compared to any other Indian restaurants.
Toooooo pricey for the menu. Not worth it
Good vegetarian food. Good service.

Very rude matured lady staff who told my pregnant wife who was carrying my 1 year old son to leave the restaurant and wait outside in the hot weather to collect the food. The thing is the restaurant only had 1 table filled and no else was standing in queue or waiting for food. Heartless lady. Food has also dropped standards as compared to little india or tanjong pagar outlet. They missed 2 items in my 6 items order and i dont live nearby to come back. No proper area to check the order also.

Good food but much smaller portions compared to the restaurants in Little India. Had the masala thosai but tiny bit of potato only. The chutneys were great and the sambar was very tasty. Stuffy service from the manager but the waiters are friendly and polite.

What needs to change is the appalling use of plastic and disposables that so many local restaurants and cafes use; this cafe is no different.
Food taste but need to wait for dinning
Next to the north point shopping mall. Breakfast and Lunch are good.

i used to be regular few years back. But now a days tried to avoid. Few simple reasons, lunch is ridiculously priced 9.7$ and other items also price they have increased. They are using very small containers,  which is not enough for any one .. less sambar, curries, and dahi etc. Comparatively simillar resturants  give better quantity and quality food.
. but the price is high. Also most of the time i buy i find something is missing they forgot to keep. simply they say sorry if you call up. and ridiculously  late no proper order have noticed  many times ppl order same food ex. lunch after me have got it and took .. and yet  we need to wait...it is poor service.. i dun recommend this place. Sorry guys i was a fan b4 and now it is pain and frustrated....
Authentic veg restaurant. Good family restaurant. I suggest this restaurant for indian breakfast recipes
Great food at good deals! Worth having the Samosa with the Mint Chutney! Pair it with Badam Milk, Rose Milk or a hot cuppa tea for the perfect tea time snack!
Although expensive but the food is tasty. I like their idly & chutney.

Yummy... I love the set food... so good. Then finish off with hot coffee...
I had a good time with my family.
The place was clean..
Love the authentic flavours of Indian vegetarian delights. The set meal makes for a pretty hearty meal leaving me satisfied and wanting to come back to sample the other palatable-looking selections.

Once you know ppl are going to come to you no matter what, you become god.

Went in ordered Masala Puri, it was rotten and smelly and my wife across the table could make out that it was spoiled.

Informed the staff its rotten.
They took the plates no apologies .

Asked what do you want in return said poori plate. Oh that's 7$ do you want pay extra.

Dude you give me a rotten food in the first place and expect me to pay as well.
Said i dont want poori meal but just poori, i guess it was less than masala poori but didnt ask for refund.
Just had and left.

I want something veg would rather go to Green Dot or prepare myself Maggi rather than visiting here.
Very good vegetarian restaurant.The food is taste good and have variety of choices.
Expensive but good food.
One of my favorite restaurants in Singapore!!  Good quality food with the same Indian taste!
Very poor delivery service. Lunch order opening time late. Only at 11.30am.
Small outlet extended from nearby kopitiam food court, easily accessible and serves decent Indian vegetarian dishes from both north and south Indian varieties

Simply best.
Must try the channa bhatura😋
Good choice for Vegetarians
Good place to take away indian food. Food is reasonable in quality and price
I felt the good hospitality of Mr Mahendran and Mdm Meena. And excellent customer service staff's. They served their customer with courtesy.

The lunch specials are quite a fair deal. The chicken in the biryani was good, although the rice wasn’t as fragrant or flavourful as it could be. The Prata Them All set was a hefty portion, as was the mini Ultimate Murtabak (can’t imagine what the regular size would be!). All considerably tasty and good value.

However, what I recommend is the plain prata—crispy and delicious without being overly oily. Sometimes simplest is best. I accompanied it with curry mutton and seasonal vegetables from the à la carte menu, though I would try something else, as the mutton was chewy and the vegetables (eggplant) absorbed too much oil. Regardless, flavours were palatable.

I had my first ever teh tarik, which was aromatic and sweetened just the right amount. Overall, a satisfactory meal. I’m glad to have found some good prata nearby. Next time, we will have to order conservatively because the food was heavy.

Really like their prata!

We used safra voucher deal as now having promotion-

1 set prata plus teh tarik only 50 cents! (Valid for the month of June 2022) .

On top of that we also ordered a chicken murtabak. Their murtabak is thin , didn't really have real chicken ingredients (too hungry so didn't manage to snap a photo). Hence I still prefer their prata 😆

I saw my next table having Maggie goreng and cheese prata (like very nice) shall order these items in my next visit.

Staffs have great services and are patience too. Thank you!

Will definitely be back

Pratas were served crispy but for some pratas there was something off about the texture - like it had been reheated / refried. Curry was nice but abit diluted compared to another branch that I visit, so it isn’t as shiok.
Teh tarik is really nice here.
Service is slow during weekends, waiting + queuing time >25mins as they have to cater for delivery orders and walk in orders.
Prices also recently increased for some items on the menu by 50cents to a dollar based on a flyer I saw.
Not the original place but taste the same. Price of various pratas are ok, but specialty ones are quite ex. Their rice are quite tasty too. No windows in the place though, so it's quite stuffy.

Yishun safra feels pretty new and clean. Food was served hot and really good. Pricey for prata, but the creative menu is definitely worth trying out. Looking forward to try their next limited time special menu item.

I went to springleaf at yishun safra on 10th september 2022,. Order took more than half an hour with staff made no effort to inform how long I have to wait. Eating area is dirty and utensils not clean properly. Not sure if any inspection done for this outlet. The lady staff seems hostile and made no effort to apologise for being late in delivery service. Poor attitude. I ended up asking for a refund for some of my order.

Went for dinner at 8pm, a quick 5 mins queue was needed to get in.

Ordered (between my friend and I): kambing soup, paper thosai, egg prata, mutton keema curry, chicken masala, seasonal vegetable, Bandung, limau ice

Kambing soup was extremely rich and flavourful! Prata and thosai were both really crispy. Mutton keema curry came in a very generous portion and was ridiculously tasty. Chicken masala was choke full of spices and you can really taste them. Cabbage was stewed to softness. Sweet drinks were decent, slightly expensive for the cup size.

Always a favourite for Indian food at yishun

Bought 2 Prata here,  Milky Prata (condensed milk) which costed ~$4 and Unami-50 (chicken floss + luncheon meat + cheese) which costed ~ $10 to take away. It has a rather small eating area.

The Prata was considered nice but too pricey and not really worth it. Although most prata shop in the area will have lesser creative varieties compared to them. Tried the mee goreng the second time as well and found it pricey too.

The price on grab is higher than in store so it is better to take away if it is walkable distance.
Place is small. The place is a bit stuffy.
Nice cosy outlet of popular local F&B  franchise and offers the full menu of items, served hot & fresh.

No queue and few empty tables on Sunday noon. Food served hot and made on the spot which I really like. Teh halia was good too.

Ordered tissue, plain and egg prata. Teh halia hot large. Adds up to 7.70
Very kampong style, a bit pricey, food is not too bad, if only their prata can be a little bit more crispy.
Amazing springleaf pizza , great drinks and nice atmosphere.
Food is very nice. And fast!! Dont have to wait so long for the food!!

Happy with food and drink ordered. But wasn't impressed with the cashier staff who cleared tables, and swept crumbs and bits onto the floor instead of clearing it up properly. He even flicked the table cloth so that allthe stuff collected on it goes onto the floor!

Eye sore when you are eating and you see the dirtied floor and smashed food cos people stepped on it.

Love the Ultimate series of dishes! I tried the Das Pratwurst which had yummy sausages inside, paired with curry and sauerkraut. The maggi goreng is excellent as usual too. Quick service and no-fuss meal. Thumbs up!

As usual slow, and the server staff is impolite, including the chef. Ask for top up gravy for masala chicken, was informed no? First time I hear of this. Wanted pack thosai and was informed kitchen cannot cope?? Not making.. coffee, tea came quite cold, apparently left out in open before serve. Service need to improve and steamline items. Going downhill, as I don’t find it as good as before at springleaf branch. That outlet also have service issue. That is another story.
Small eating place but cam accommodate about 50 pax at one time. Good quality prata and very crispy. Curry is available for unlimiyed top up. Must try when you are nearby.

Took away the coin prata and it was still crispy! It's a thin dough but it is crispy on the outside. Like their coin prata more than their normal prata.
