Update: went back to dine in and tried their egg mozzarella prata (super cheesy, love it), hi-fiber prata (taste like normal prata but healthier) and iced teh tarik (very sweet, not so good). There's fish and chicken curry available but you have to scoop yourself. No paywave here. Cash, shopeepay and favepay only.

Having patronized their Springleaf branch for more than a decade and half, it saddens me to admit that their quality has slipped. It's not unexpected, given their expansion in recent years.

Today was an example of their lost standards. I ordered their regular teh tarik, as a takeaway. It was filled up just over a quarter of the packet and the quality was just not there.

It's a shame seeing the sham that has become of this brand. I had good years with friends and family at their Springleaf branch, but I can't say the same now.

Disappointing.

Ordered a drink for takeaway, was asked to wait outside, but took about 25mins to deliver that 1 cup of teh tarik.

Went back in to check, then was told that the drink is left on the table, in a plastic bag carrier.

After clarifying that their cashier already charged me for the plastic cup, I still had to top-up cash for the plastic cup.. staff did not apologize after all that.
Good mutton briyani & pratas no doubt. Only thing is their tables are always oily and dirty. Wipe with a tissue and behold the color change yourself. Nevertheless I'll still come back for the food.
Came here was expecting good Prata but alittle disappointed. Curry also tasted quite weird and you have to scoop it yourself which doesn't make sense also in terms.of hygiene.

The wait is worth it. The restaurant is small, yet they did everything they could to ensure the patrons are kept comfortable. I can see if this place is maxed out on capacity the air conditioner will not be sufficient. Take note it's a self-service restaurant so you need to take your cutleries and the curry sauce (choose between chicken and fish). Do note that you will need to request for particular order for vegetarians. The  Mini ultimate murtabak is to die for, it's crispy and with cheese and dice chicken... Hmmm. And Teh Halia is also very well created - I had 2 cups in one seating.

This place has the one of the crispiest (but not as crispy as that in the Thomson branch) but their butter chicken is a no-go!! My friends and I ordered that to share last Saturday, and was shocked to get one piece of chicken thigh (pardon the half-eaten chicken but I only thought to snap a photo after digging in). It was barely enough for 2/3 people and i think it is $6.90 (correct me if i'm wrong). You get the idea! too expensive for just a chicken thigh covered in butter chicken sauce.

I ate their butter chicken at their other branch along Thomson area a few weeks ago and that was so much better, with decent portion of butter chicken.

Would recommend to go to their original branch as they have more decent portions and crispier prata.

Relatively long wait for the food on a Sunday morning. The place is in high demand from walk-ins and delivery takeouts. Had the murtaburger, which was very tasty and filling. Prices are higher than your average prata place.
Indoor, comfortable, with a very wide range of speciality dishes for both SAFRA members and non-members.
Quiet place to have a meal during weekdays. Food quality is good and price is reasonable.

Do careful when you order your mutaba. Please be present when they cook, don't make reservation and collect when is ready.

As the prata after cook tends to be oily, I once saw the one who packet, due to oily, he gotten a cloth from the kitchen guy to tap away oil at the mutaba.

After tap dry the food, the cloth was passed back to the kitchen and the cloth was used to clean the hot plate area.

So beware.

Best thing about springleaf is their consistency across outlets.

Good variety of pratas. Best if they can open till late like 2-3am and earlier like 6-7am.

Good drinks as well.
45 minutes still waiting for takeaway of 8 packets of briyani, not even crowded when we ordered.
Place is clean and nice. Not so many people. Prata are crispy and not oily.

Nice prata. Specially the plain ones.

Order their Masala chicken. Came later so did not take pic. But it was really good to go with the prata.
Nice and cool place for great food and drinks. Located inside Safra Yishun.

My only option for good Prata in Yishun, the quality mostly matches that of the outlet in Springleaf Road. The waiting is longer though, probably due to the smaller kitchen and staff size. Safra members get a small discount as well.
Food a bit below expectations. Their main branch taste better especially the curry.
Nice food. Nice place but alittle oily while dine in.
After a breezy stroll at the Gardens by the bay... Yummy! Had a really tasty Roti John smashed with generous amount of chilli and mayo. 😋😋😋
Pretty good food. Don't reach a minute after 9:30pm if you want to dine in.

This is one of the many outlets of Springleaf Prata. They always serve soft crispy prata and delicious curry. This outlet is relatively small but yet cosy. Parking is expensive unless you park at the opposite block and cross over to the restaurant. Happy dining everyone. Cheers.
Visit again after relaxation of COVID, the taste maintain as per their standard. Will come again if crazing for prata.
Coin Prata is a “hot seller”, though it is just kosong but smaller, yet more ex. Cool name but not worth it.
Nice and relax place. Food are delicious 😋. Important Aircon is Power ..

Had 2 Plain prata, 1 Masala chicken and Lime juice. Plain prata was crispy and not too oily. It paired well with the Masala chicken. Place wasn't too crowded and did not have to wait long for my food. Will visit again.

An experience taste since day one, never fail to fulfill our needs. Teh tarik the best drink in the house. The crispy prata never ever dissappoint us, the quality of the food variety are wonderful. Fully recommended to all prata lover!

Happy tummy comes happy family.

The place is clean and food preparation is quite fast.
Prata is crispy type but a bit small compared to normal stalls. Would need 3 pieces of 'kosong' to fill a meal... 😂
Tried with fish curry, no 'fishy' smell, spice not that overpowering... quite like it 😀
Food ordering feels a bit awkward blocking the narrow walkway at the entrance.

Ordered takeaway at Yishun Safra Springleaf. There was no visible queue when I ordered. 5 mins later, queue started to build up and I waited for another 15 mins only to find out that my order was given to another person. Without a single apology and with a nonchalant attitude, I was told by one of the staff to wait. When asked for refunds, the staff refused and started yelling with the rest in Tamil. I stood there; got my refund eventually from a Chinese looking staff who was yelled at by a staff as well.

Not sure what is happening at Springleaf. While I enjoyed the food, no one deserved such treatment. Do consider looking into this matter please? You have just lost 4 patrons permanently. *Note: I did not raised my voice or make a scene. Just want to have a decent dinner that i am willing to pay for. - not anymore.

I felt I had gotten poor service.

Asked for chilli for my prata when their menu states chilli $0.6 (I didn't mind sambal or any chilli), they keep saying only got chilli sauce which I say okay.

Then they didn't wanna give, unlikely to return unless their food is so so amazing that I'm ok to tolerate the service standard.
Had prata, Briyani & Thosai. All were very good. Even the lime juice was well made (not too sour nor sweet). Ambience is good with distancing measures in place. Will definitely be back here again 👍🏻
The plain and egg prata were good. The exterior was crispy yet the in inside was soft and chewy. However, the fish curry was on the salty side otherwise it is good.
Only came here for prata and teh halia…shiok. Service does get very slow when they are busy so come during off peak. Egg prata price is now $2.00 🙀 halal neighborhood restaurant

Today I have mutton rice asked worker to put little extra piece. They charged $ 11.50 price. Which is ridiculous for the meal. They gave only curry apart one vegetable which is smelly and useless appalam. I mean not puffy. When I asked why are you charging this much simple answer for the extra piece. Day light robbery. When I asked for the break up they literally showing finger. Just pay or keep the food you ate.

Workers atitude is so horrible! I wanted to order Prata Tissue and they rejected my request as they told me they were busy with so many customers orders. And can't even make 1 piece of prata tissue 🙄 then after 15 mins sitting at the table while my family's food finished, I tried my luck again to order Prata Tissue as most of the customers has  leave the makan place, they accepted my order. How pathetic that is. And im complaining about prata tissue overall. Hahahaha

I'm not sure is the workers' attitude or lack of ingredients .. We were there to get our supper last night. Ordered mee goreng.. Maggi goreng.. Fried rice.. Sup kambing and nasi briyani. Mee goreng had nothing in it.. Just plain noodles with dark soya sauce.. Not even a stripe of beansprouts or vege..not even with sambal.. N yet tasteless at all.. We all were very very surprised n dissatisfaction with the food. Eat halfway n end up in dustbin chute. Haven't mentioned that each of the food was priced at 5-6 each. Sorry to say even hawkers economic noodles looks n taste better. Sup kambing was just spiced with water, only 4pieces of small cut of meat in the Sup..n not to mention was full of grease. Chicken Briyani rice just don't feel like it..to cut the bad time short.. Too harsh to say.. We hope you may cheat us that night... But hope that others will take note. That's our first and last. Next time we definitely go for McD. Thanks
Another delicious Indian Muslim foods restaurant. Just only seating capacity limited to 30 to 40 pax only. Parking space No problem

Ordered masala thosai and one of its gravy was totally bland zero taste. After making payment told the guy at counter about it and his answer was that’s how it is supposed to taste like. Wow. Ego too big i guess. Anyway other food I order wasn’t nice too actually. Nasi goreng kerabu taste more like rice with white pepper. Good luck to those trying 😎

I had ordered a Mee Goreng last, last night. We waited and waited. We saw them serving other customers first. (we were regular customers in the day, so they probably did not recognize us) After 45 min, a customer said that is too long and left. So, we decided to go also. But before we told them we are gonna leave, we asked them if they are going to give us the food. All of the workers in the restaurant were very responsible except one person. He is the person at ordering station. After we had asked him, he said that if you can't wait, then leave. We had waited for almost 1 hour.
The cook came and said that he already cooked a lot. That is when the reason for the problem came. The person who shouted at me actually served his regular customers. The cook knew us. He tried to calm me down and gave the food to us. We said thank you to the chef and left. So, only the person who was at the the ordering station was irresponsible. Now, you might know the reason why they serve your food very late. Thank you for taking your time to read this!
Delicious and fast service even sometimes very crowded
Awesome prata as always. *Don't change it! Yes, I like fried chicken briyani too 👍
Reasonably good local food but slightly expensive in my view. Try it as it's 24hrs open.

A little dirty but the food is hella good. The service is good too. Just the floor and tables looked oily. But I guess it's kinda normal? But anyway it's super good. Really recommend for eating at night. The atmosphere feels really warm.
They will test your patience. Even though it was not that busy on this Saturday night 10 pm they kept me waiting 15 minutes for my banana prata untill I finish my teh tareh..
Not much choice of food after 2am.....but still service is good
Nasi Lemak surprisingly good. Egg yolk perfect, wings crispy, and with teh halia cost less than $5
Good place to hang out with friends, especially at night as it is open 24 hours. The good is good and the price is also reasonable. Very good prata can be found here.

Used to always patronized this place during yesteryears. Came back and it still e same. thou I miss the 'used to have' nasi lemak there but still the current food is still good, service and atmosphere still e same. I enjoyed!
Food is good and affordable... Open till late
Good service , fried rice and stir fried food is to go far
I like the dosay some western, seafood and teh alia ok not bad
Quality of food letter bit down need to maintain.

Staying in yishun for 40 year and my family and relatives all stay here for over 50 year.. been buying food from syed since it open its door. But  now they abit arongant and only really serve outsider we regular they never really serve and waiting time is longer for us and also they abit stingy with the condiment and garnishes... eg cucumber sauces

Visit this shop early in the morning to meet up with friends. The place is not crowded. Alot of seats are available during my visit. The service is as expected in an Indian Muslim restaurant. They will accede to your request without hassle. The food we order in the morning are the obvious, which is Prata. The crowds start to build up after 8am. If meeting friends or just to fill up for breakfast, nothing fancy, this place will do.

Use the kiap to take the rojak, there is the typical fried potato, fried square beancurb, hotdog which are fried, fried fillet fish, flour items which are fried, contains some fried egg or vegetable. There is fried prawn on a fried flour or just mass fried small prawn on flour. There is also fried sotong available. Once you have chosen the items, they will refry it to perfection. Comes with cucumber

the service was bad ! asked for fish curry but gave dalca and took them a good 10 minutes (YED I TIMED IT) to change the gravy when the prata is already served . i overheard 1 of the waiter said to a lady customer "next time say extra sweet la" in a unhappy tone . patronise at your own will .
The food is worth the price. the service is always quick. You get Indian food too - dosa, chapathi, idly.
So lousy service as well the food. Better go food court.. much more cheaper and nice.for take away charge extra with poor packaging.. paper box. (Sambal and rice spill all over the box)

Expensive price for poor quality of food. Nasi goreng thai only 1pcs small prawn, nasi not cook consistently white rice can still be seen. Drinks haphazard, skimped on ingredients, drinking diluted teh chino....

My family and I was craving for prata. We ate few times but today’s experience was horrible. Upon reaching a table, there’s an ipad left on the table beside the table we are located. I partially open the cover of ipad and check if someone has left it, but I decided to move it away from our table and leave it. About 15mins later a Lady confronted us and say next time dont touch, ask around and thats how she reserved the table. She talked to us in a bad tone. We apologised and keep quiet. The mentioned lady was apparently working in the shop. After few minutes, a guy, who is working also in the shop, talked to us and said “what she said was right? Do you have something to say?” Then we defend ourselves. They embarrassed us in front of many people which is not a customer service. To the owner of this shop, may review the cctv and investigate on the incident. A belonging that is valuable shouldnt be left unattended. Such behaviour is unacceptable for customer service. A proper and mannerly approach should be considered. Hope you can take action on this.

Large amount of Indian and Malai food varieties available here,.. I personally like their service, maintanance and their coffee. For food taste i would like to give 5 stars ratings, but in hygienic matter can give 3 stars only. Overall it's recommendable place to have good food in Yishun.
Eaten egg and plain prata here. Teh tarik with ginger is nice. Ordered mine with reduced sugar 😊
This stall has slacken in their food
Normal rojak but i like the tek terak
Best prata ! Super like the fish curry sauce
Varieties of food available, well served by their staff, operating 24hrs and convenient cark parking nearby.

I will not beat around the bush, the Indian food is really good! This is a little hidden gem in the rough. Not many know about it, but those who do, swear by it. Hands down the best Mee Goreng Mamak and Teh Tarik in the north! I have tried most of their dishes, and none disappoint. Do give it a try if you're around the area!
Food is gud but the service is late....need wait take time
Good service, helpful staff. I must say that they have since upgraded their rojak sauce, it is now comparable to Ministry of Rojak.

One of the best midnight food haunts within Yishun.

Offers plenty of our local Indian food options, prata, murtabaks, mee gorengs and what nots.

Price wise, definitely more worth than its competitors within the area.

Parking space are never a hassle. Plenty of available lots.
Great briyani sold here. Chicken rice and other  malay stall also not bad. The only issue here is, need to wait very long for drinks that have been ordered.

They said here got thai style cook n I double confirm and waiter said true..  I go n order bihun tomyam, but taste not like thai style at all... hmm I'm so disappointed 😭 but I'm still finish my meal 😆 I'm just don't like to do a  wasted ..

Not the best prata in the north but still is a good prata. The rest of the food is quite average depending on the cook for the day. So the food isnt that standardise. Fast service and good value for money. The place is accessible by bus with about 4-5 minutes of walking. You could generally find a parking space here. The place is clean and the people serving are friendly.
Friendly staff, Great food Great drinks!. However i think location wise can be improved as its very hot n humid there

normal indian muslim food...prices used to be ok ...but it has gone up.
ice water is now 50 cents a cup up from 30 cents before.

no more smoking area too.
so smokers take note.
The food was good. Most the food in the menu was not available. Had to order 3 times before I go to eat.

No quality and expensive.. $7 for a plate of so called “seafood” hor fun with only 1 not fresh small prawn and few pieces of sotong at a void deck Coffeeshop..  when we double check with the menu it was only written as $6 and they even argue because I ask for seafood? Hmmm... better watch it when you do decide to come here to eat..

Excellent teh halia (tea with a "kick" - ginger water). The roti john (no human flesh here, just a nice toasted baguette with scrambled egg, roasted chicken chunks, tomato-barbeque sauce and mayonnaise!) was fantastic, the nasi goreng ikan bilis (fried rice with crunchy fried little fish) was fresh and hot! Will try other dishes next time...
it's my one of the favourite restaurant food and drinks taste yummy amazing 👏 😋
Nice food everytime. Over the years their service improved, even though they are busy they still managed to serve us on time.

A good Indian restaurant in neighbour around Yishun church. They sell South Indian Halal food. The restaurant is stretched over 4 shops in a raw selling a large verity of Indian food. Their Prata Bom (prata with cheese and condensed milk in it) tastes great. Will go again for sure.
Awesome Indian food. Great prata and curry (fish). Generally almost everything you order here is great-tasting especially from their Thai menu.

Unassuming place that serves decent roti prata. What's interesting is that the prata is served with 2 different curries as well as sambal ikan bilis.
One curry is the regular type served with  prata; it's not bad, but watered down. The second curry is loaded with spices, not the chilli or pepper kind of spice, more like cardamom and turmeric, etc. It's interesting cos at the other places I've tried that serves 2 curries, one would usually be curry and the other would be dahl.
This is my first visit to Meera's; and judging from the rather extensive menu, I suspect that their prata, while decent enough, is not their specialty. I'm sure some of their dishes must be great, or they wouldn't have more than one branch. If I'm in the area again, I may return and try out some other dishes.

Price 3/5
Food 3/5
Ambience 3/5
Overall 3/5

Price is pretty much reflective of the food. The prata taste like an average prata, but I love the big bag of papadom they have. The papadom sells at $1.20.

Curry is the watery type, mildly spicy.

Had the teh halia. Ginger taste is mild, tea isn't very sweet unlike usual Muslim restaurant where the tea is diabetic.

Will return here if I'm craving for some prata while around this area. Otherwise wouldn't make a special trip down to this place.

After receiving my drink, most of the ice already 3/4 melted. So I went to ask for more ice added. The boss himself added the ice for me. Upon payment I was told my drink (Ice lemon tea) cost $4. I was shocked & asked why so expensive? The staff said my drink was $2.50 & the added ice was $1.50! I ask why so expensive for ice & he said extra ice is $1. So now from $1.50 become $1. I said it's too expensive to the staff & it was reduce again this time to 50cents. I'm never coming back to this place again & I'd advise anyone the same as well.

Had Prata and Tea here!!! Highly recommended. The oil used in the preparation is fresh. Order taking is promptly attended to and payment is straightforward. Most important.... Reasonably priced. Awesome breakfast place on a Saturday morning. Located at Springleaf MRT station.

Indian Muslim style eatery offering a wide variety of common dishes like dosai, prata, muthabak, etc. attentive service if a bit understaffed, but they hold a candle next to Springleaf just a few units away. A good place to drop by for Parthia if you don’t want to wait too long, Portions are larger than most places.

Be wary of the pricing though, as it’s not transparent - our single-person murtabak was ‘upsized’ without telling us.

Try the rava masala dosai.

Nice and made to order fresh prata. Curry sauce is nice and thick. The ice teh Tarik is sweet & thick. The Horlick Godzilla is unique. The murtabak is delicious and savoury. How I prefer it cut in squares instead of triangles. Overall recommended.

The teh was nice. The normal basic prata or masala prata was good serve with 2 dip curry and ikan bilis  sambal. The murtabak came well presented but sad to say one of the worst I have tasted. One side was badly burnt and hard unable to cut through. The top was lightly fried and soft . Boiled mince mutton without much marination was added in it . Second slice I really feel yucky even though I have submerge each bite piece into the curry. The chicken curry was a little diluted , taste of curry leaf and powder not much spices and punch in their curry.

3.9 🌟 for first visit experience. Their prata is dry chewy type. I like the kosong but not the egg one. The unique thing is besides the two usual curry you get (dal n fish etc), they have this nice sambal ikan bilis! It's spicy sweet. Gives the bite a different taste and texture. The dal curry also very different from those usual ones I had (some unique taste like minty which I could not figure out). I had my prata with teh tarik.. I requested for kurang kurang manis (less less sweet 😅). Turn out it was just nice. Staff were friendly. Generally clean. They even sell some puffs and such snacks.
Friendly and affordable pricing,  I like the prata that come with ikan bilis sambal chilli,  not as usual in Singapore prata eateries
Fluffiest prata that i have ever tasted.Liked the sambal though its abit cold. Overall a good experience very chilled n old school atmosphere.

Food is tasty and the price is very reasonable. Got enough variety for most guys to come here around 3 times a week. They got Briyani, prata fried Malay food and their outlets are all halal. The restaurant is clean and their service is decent. Would've given it 4 stars if the toilet was cleaner/in better quality and had toilet rolls.

Hahaha... their Poori was awesome very big  hahahahaha....me n my loving sister was really enjoyed the meal....❤️❤️❤️🌹🌹🌹😚😚😚😚😚😚...the veggi curry, chutney, and potatoes all..
Was tasty too, the restaurant was looking a bit older, but food was good.... highly recommend...🌹❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good food, good prices and friendly service. I have eaten here several times and it's always good.

They open early around 7 AM. Busy from the many contract workers coming to buy their co-workers their meals for the day in the morning. So their stuff is always moving and fresh. Prata, dosai and bryani are the usual here and you cannot go wrong with them. Affordable and now even more accessible from Woodlands via the TEL. Highly recommended.

Crab curry is very salty n fresh coconut served w hard flesh.
We order fish head n rice...reasonable price n yummy   w generous lady finger n brinjal.
Accessible by TEL just next door 👍

I am Japanese and had lunch here.
They are friendly and served a nice chicken Briyani!

First off, we were given the wrong order even after repeated confirmations. We were given one egg prata less but as it was a take away, we could not rectify the error.

The prata was one of the least nice prata our family has eaten. It was very oily and "doughy".
The dhal curry was a huge disappointment.

Will not recommend this place unless you have a prata craving that desperately needs to be satisfied.
Come and try.. 👍
Absolutely best nasi goreng kampung in Singapore
Came all the way from the east to try this out. Really good mutton murtabak. Curries accompanying the dish was really good too. Would definitely recommend!
Excellent fluffy prata served with choice of mutton/fish curry, dalcha and my fav sambal ikan bilis (anchovies)
Service not too good.

Food portion is big and generous but doesn't taste very good. Dishes are sub par or salty. Briyani no standard. Nasi goreng is bland and soggy although generous ingredients. Basically their cooks are not skilled.

Complete rip off. My first and most definitely my last time eating there ever.
Had a few of their individual dishes and all of it tasted terrible. Oh and the prawn sambal, No idea why it was so sweet. I almost thought I was eating some sort of dessert.
Prata is freshly made n relatively bigger. 👍 Yummy
Prata served hot, goes well with the sambal. Teh tarek power. Fish head curry so-so.

Did lunch today, was dissapointed to learn no actual BL available, however that was made up with the flavor of homestyle cooking. Had a generous bowl of yogurt and the Ice morru was 2 persons share. IF owner reading always room for improvement.

Good curry. And good variety of South Indian / Malay food. Normal service as seen in other Singapore curry houses which means nothing to compliment about but is ok if you are there only for your curry fix!
Great prata..great curry..great sambal..you add together it becomes super dah👍
At Meeras i always feel welcom with a warm smile.As drop by there for meals regularly they know me well.Food is willing cooked according to your taste bud ,if you asked for it.Good friendly staff.🙏👍
Great food. But service is slow.

Good food at affordable prices.
Traditional old school style. Love it!
Good South Indian food. Been here many times. Friendly staffs.  Parking space hard to find because of MRT construction.
Their food is now more delicious than the other prata shop down the road. I was also taken by surprise.
I've been visiting this place for 4 years now. The food is consistently good. Atmosphere is always pleasant. Great fit for workday lunches.
The prata was average. Tea no good. Can go if no other option around.
Price is reasonable. Food is tasty & many varieties available.
Nice fish curry.
Good food
Nice pratas and hot coffee. Gets the job done and is open early in the mornings. Was there at 720am on a Sunday and its already opened.
Traditional Indian food.  Even with no air con the place is cozy. Taste is decent and so is the price.
My favorite morning Ravva Dosa and vadey.
Good service, nice food, very reasonable price. Ambience would be better once mrt line completed.
Thairu sooru is nice and maggie goreng is gd..
Very worst service in this shop... Even you buy 2 coffee minimum 15mints wait not crowd also 🤦‍♂️🤦‍♂️🤦‍♂️
Good food, worth the journey there 😋
Today's egg prata was a bit hard. Plain crispy prata was delicious.
Along the road, good food but limited variety, service a bit poor
Cheap but scrumptious food highly recommended for south indian food lovers
In here we get to eat for quite. Amel bros
Nice assortments of Rojak. Had nasi goreng merah (not bad). The mee kuah also good. Tried the chicken chop with fries too, a must try.

Taste wise is fine for me. Choose fried beancurd,prawn fitters and 2 others. Minimum 4 pieces, cost $7.59. Can use PayNow or cash payment, do not accept Paywave or credit card. Located at B2 near Kopitiam foodcourt

So Far e Best Rojak Even Comparing w e Stretch I've Tried Along Ayer Rajah Food Centre, Worth Hunting For... 🤩🤩🤩😋😋😋
I'm Quite Impressed w Their Food Crispness & Freshness... Their Sauces Are Served Hot~ Too!!!

Measly portion for something worth $28. Overhyped and over rated. And give 2 small containers for sauce. The standard cucumber and onion also nowhere to be found.. like only a handful of those.. literally handful. Buyer beware, if you want to waste money, there are other places with more portion that can give cheaper and same quality

Ordered the vegetarian mee goreng found the taste wasn't as I expected from an Indian Muslim stall. The mee is too dry, I prefer slightly oily mee goreng.
The mee goreng found at Yishun hawker centre is much better.

Good quality was ok-good. Hot drink portion was small given the price point. Definitely smaller than usual Coffeeshop glass mug quantity.

Service was-meh. The young gentleman mending the cashier counter was rude. I paid with a $50 note and he immediately told me “give me smaller note”. I had to explain that I just went to the ATM before he reluctantly accepted my payment.

The same staff also mixed up the order of another customer, giving her putih fried rice instead of merah. Customer was upset and mentioned that they should have asked instead of assuming that “Chinese only eat putih, not merah goreng”. No attempt to apologize or to exchange the food, just insisted that it is as it is.

Ordered Indian rojak and Nasi goreng ikan bilis.

Rojak tasted almost similar to the original one at Ayer rajah food centre.

The Nasi goreng lacks the “kick” but still good.

I must say, the service can be improved. Most of the times, they’re talking to one another.
Unhealthy but delicious. Die Die Must try!  We are here again on September 25.  Delicious!
This rojak shop serves the best rojak sauce - sweet, spicy, savoury all at the same time. Very comparable with the big boys at Ayer Rajah Food Centre!

Review as a delivery rider.

Popular but Frustratingly slow.

Simply because they only start to queue the ordered item for frying WHEN the rider arrives.
Yes, queue behind all the other in-stall orders at the store. EVEN though your order came in 20-30mins ago..

So be prepared to wait more than an hour easy during peak hours..

2nd visit - Self service for this stall. The rojak taste nice and fresh but the pricing a bit on the high end. Teh tarik was good. As there are limited seating area thus it quite hard to find a table during peak hour but you are allowed to seat at the foodcourt seating area.

Weekday order 1pm, 2 teh aliah and 1 mee goreng. Ordered spicy mee goreng so i can only assume he adhered to my request by sprinkling some chili padi. Taste of mee goreng is mediocre, tea was a little sweet. Waiting time is long by normal standards. Total damage $8.60! I presume tea costs $1.80 each.  Meegoreng 5$. Same price as Adam Road or Newton. At least the one in newton come with a sunny side up.. not coming back again unless price is on the signboard.

This place is always packed with hungry diners. However, the quality and taste can be rather inconsistent. Ordered their beehoon goreng twice. The first time was simply delicious. Fried to perfection. Sadly, the second time i ordered it was terrible. It was so salty that I left without touching much of it. A total waste of money. To be fair, the Indian rojak was good. The rojak sauce either make or breaks the overall satisfaction. The sauce was spicy and the consistency was just right. Would recommend the Indian rojak. Please give a 'LIKE' for this review ya. Thanks
Over-rated and expensive. There are much better and cheaper Indian Rojak outlets in Yishun; Yishun Park Hawker Centre (NK), Chong Pang (Elahe)...

1st time here.
1) Rojak & bee hoon going nearly 40sgd. We didn't even ordered much. Same rojak items taken from hawker would only cost max 15sgd.
2) Ordered white bee hoon but came red been hoon. When i told counter wrong order, he blamed me which I told him i ordered right and he acknowledged. Portion so little...
3) Long waiting time. I finished my rojak then came the been hoon. Wrong bee hoon, changed...took even longer...
Just a hyped up & overrated rojak place, taste about the same as any hawker centre's. Not worth the price, but rojak is acceptable anyways. Oh well...but then.. go hawker centre more worth it la...trust me!
The Best Mee Goreng I have ever tasted. You gotta try it you won't regret it 👍👍👍🌶🌶🌶😊

Was waiting for my order when I saw a family doing hand signs to figure out what to order. The cashier came out immediately to take their orders along the walkway while trying his best to do sign language. The food is great and the service has…compassion.
The rojaks speechless,superb.And the gravy...need no introduction.
My favorite Indian Rojak stall at Yishun.

Very frustrated today. Bought this Indian Rojak at Ministry of Rojak at Northpoint which total came up to $44.40. When asked for more gravy (gravy was given so little not even half of the tie plastic).
Got scolded(loudly) by the staff who doing the cutting n packing.
When made pymt i ve told the cashier who's also taking order that pls give me more gravy n she said ok. But this male staff was so rude didn't want to give yet grumbling. Felt so angry.
What a terrible service!!!!.
Extremely long waiting time (45mins) for ONE nasi goreng. All others ordering rojak got served 1st. Not recommended if you are in a rush.

I wonder have this store changed new boss??
Their services are not as good as the previous I'd visited, just one customer next to me asking for some more 🌶 chilli, and he only just given a piece, and the customer immediately get shocked "what is this!". Later my turn, I softy asked for more cutter onions, he just pointed on my plate and said that's the onions ( a fewest pieces). Not Good😤😥

Interesting little Rojak outlet. Price I feel is reasonable and the food is fresh and hot when served. The source is less nutty then usual but still well made.  While the place is a bit dirty I must say but you should try the food still. The cashier is quite is a funny guy 😁

The food always cooked fresh. The rojak & sauce are yummy. Try the ginger tea(ask for less sugar) is refreshing. Dining area is cramp so be sure to pack home.
No pictures for these cos all in the tummy.....  Next time perhaps if I remember 😅
Food is great but the place is kind of cramped
The Indian rojak is a must try! Eat it with the sauce.
The rojak and the gravy is really delicious. They give you a good amount of gravy. Do take note that there is a 10 cents charge for an extra glass if you want to share your coffee.

Variety selection of freshly prepared food items for rojak and gravy is good too..not very sweet and not too spicy! The only Indian shop in Northpoint that sells rojak, mee goreng, nasi goreng, mee kuah & etc and variety also drinks such as teh tarik and teh with ginger and other drinks too with reasonable price in shopping centre.
One of the best Rojak sauce in town. Slightly more spicy than the others.

Awesome food, awesome service! I must say they are very polite and friendly. Seen how some customers talk very rudely to them and they endure it all. Hats off to the team. Will continue to support them and recommend them to my family and friends!
Good South Indian fare at affordable prices. Quality maintained at all times and if you are having the rojak, don't forget to ask for more gravy! Relaxed, no frills dining experience.
Nothing special for the hike up price for the food.

Trying mee goreng at this place.
Food 3/5
Ambiance 3/5
Value for money 3/5

Lots of prawns on prawn fritters. Food arrived hot and crispy. Taste of dipping sauce was spot on. Asked for refill of sauce. Waiter obliged. Not thirsty after meal. Totally satisfied. Will only eat from them from now on.

We were charged $4.50 for a piece of paru (lungs) inside the rojak. Gravy is tasty.

We hope you can be more practical on the pricings. Your pricing board says depends on size without even weighing the items. You do not practise offering customers a receipt for their purchase.

Just to share experience. This evening on 25 Dec 2019. We ordered take away rojak for $26/-. We asked for onion, green chilli and cucumber. When reaching home we opened up the packet and found out the man gave one slice of onion and cucumber each and one green chilli besides the rojak we ordered. It was good lesson for me. Next time pls check first before leaving.

Food good only do not understand why the gravy are being charged $1.00 with portion given are sometimes too much ending up throwing away. Rather they do not charge for the gravy and give appropriate portion rather than going to waste on efforts cooked.
Limited seats space,  overall their foods are fairly nice, their rojak gravy is the best taste except they shld reduce the colouring

Bad experienced today, staff very rude. Nagging, bad temper, bear brunt and attack customer from counter then Start charging outside the counter and to the dining table. Worst still bad mouthing customer with other patrons such an attitude and unprofessional... only stop when I started to record a video and intended to call police. So childish and easily get offended by small miscommunication over Teh O Kosong and when I took the shop pictures... keep nagging and grumpy like old man.

A man attacking women over small matter? Thats so uncalled for. Consider to report to police, I have the videos. Oh another man also came to our dining table and after I recorded him ... he walked away immediately. You guys gangsters?
Ordered takeaway on 7 Nov and got home to realise the wrong order given to me. I paid more and got less. Disappointing.
The food is nice, especially the sauce. Seating places are limited, especially during this Covid period. Expect the price to be higher, given that it is located inside Northpoint mall.

Suberp rojak gravy  can ask for another cup if nt enough cause i like to dunk e goodies in e gravy with spoon...other dishes also available like ur regular mee goreng beef steak mee kuah n lots more ...plz come to discover😋😋😋

Enjoyed Good food
Although seats are limited we had to wait for our seats
Nice Rojak!!! The gravy is superb and food is fresh. Something to try when you r not in the mood to choose something. Simple food but delicious.
Mee goreng pretty decent. Kitchen and ordering counter is on one side while seating area is across the path that pedestrians walk by, making it a little tricky.
Rojak was good but waiting time is damn slow. If you in rush don't bother to order . Atleast waiting time is 30mins
prices for rojak is INSANE !! squid and lungs priced at the size of the item ! 1 small squid + 1 small lungs + 3 empty dough + 1 fish fillet & a can of coke cost SGD 19 !!
Should reduce the gravy colouring ,must be hot 🔥 and spicy. Try to imitate the gravy of 1960's at Bras Basah Rd.
My favourite Indian rojak place.. till now I haven't find anything better than this. Those who visited Northpoint, must give it a try! You will not regret it!
Food is alright. Service is slow. I mean if I am supposed to take my own utensils stop putting them inside the counter.

Food wise it is good but drink wise I find the teh halia not enough ormph. The chicken curry is good but the fish curry is a bit let down as I find it missing the depth of flavor that I always look for in a nice curry.

We ordered the Tasha Special Murtabak ($15). It is FULL of ingredients. It has cheese, mutton, ham, egg, mushroom, capsicum and tons of other stuff. Surprisingly it goes nicely together. 5 stars here.

The mee goreng is the wet style. It spicyness level is there and it has nice chunky potatoes and tau kwa. It has a thick sauce coating every strand of the noodles. Nice!

Wonderful chill out and burst of flavourfl experience. They accommodate to your taste buds in cooking. Must tries are their murtabak, sardine satti soru. Drinks are reasonable and affordable. If you drink Guinness theirs is very refreshing.  If you drink whiskey their per bottle price is also reasonable. A fulfilled weekend hangout for me.

Had a nice evening out with frens at this new kid on the block- Semma bar. Nice ambience, cosy, great for dinner or just hanging out with frens. The food was exceptionally good, especially the very tender mysore mutton which came on a hotplate. We also tried the prawns, roti john, mutton satti soru, some sharing platter and a fried ikan bilis with onion dish which went very well with drinks. They also had some interesting drinks like Thalapathy and Nayagan! Was full house by 8pm... in short, a nice hangout with great food!
Revamped from Tasha Restaurant to Semma Bistro. Good upgrade. The atmosphere is cool and food has a good variety. Recommended goto place. Sati soru (claypot rice)  mutton is a must try.

Really friendly staff that were willing to go through the menu. Main point though, the food is absolutely mind-blowing! Had their Roti Canai, Satti Sorru & the Commandoes, all just other worldly. The Commandoes though, a unqiue fry of sambal, ikan bilis, tauhu, fries and hotdogs might sound weird, but its worth more than a shot, and their curry was awesome!

We were invited by a friend to have dinner at her neighborhood's Indian restaurant, Tasha's. The restaurant itself is bright and clean, simple layout. Ordered to share. Their claypot fish head curry was fresh, though we wished the gravy was less diluted. Masala squid was a yummy rice-topper. Prices are easy-on-the-wallet too.

Brand New Concept and Ambience..
Excellent hospitality and energy from the crew!

I had their commando satti soru and mutton murtabak. It was sooo good!

The satti soru was perfectly done with the shiok level of spiciness, crunchy ikan bilis and curry leaves.

Mutton Murtabak was perfect. Generous filling of Moist and tender meat. And the accompanying gravy was also full of flavour and thickness for a dip. Aesthetically pleasing presentation!

Ambience was pure comfort. Loved the fusion of nature with their furnishings.
Warm lighting to complement the wood. It takes you away from the bustling street and activity just right outside.

Definitely going to be a regular! See yall there!

Here for a slightly late lunch at 1.00pm and we were surprised to know that the lunch time crowd just left 😆 delighted cos we were famished!

Masala Mutton Biryani - WOW 😍 the basmati rice was cooked to perfection! It was fluffy, fragrant and flavourful. We appreciate the thoughtfulness in separating of spices from the rice -  One of the "landmines" while eating briyani is to accidently crew into a cardamon🤦🤦‍♀️🤦‍♂️ The mutton curry - tender and welll flavoured - had just enough spiciness to give the right amount of "kick".  Generous amounts of crispy crunchy Papadam enough for two to share 😁✌️

Prata Volcano Chicken Steak Combo is a visual treat indeed 🤩 A mind-blowing and creative twist to the standard teloh prata, along with a nicely marinated fusion chicken steak served with fries. 🍗🍟

Although we were famished, the portions were huge enough for 3 to share! 🤯 We will definitely be back to this joint for more! 😊
Nice cosy ambience no crowd on sat morning, thosai served was burnt on the sides.. Service can be improved, prices are very modest... Manager a young man not so friendly and helpful.
The teh tarik here is foamy and smooth. Not bad! But chicken briyani rice was cold, think they didn’t heat up, maybe can improve on this.

We booked for our Primary school gathering ,we have dinner at Semma  Indian restaurant, The restaurant itself is bright and clean, simple layout. Their food was delicious though the spicy level was high .. the staff are very polite except  for one lady she came over and ask us how's the food so we told her food was very nice but the spicy level are high in some food and her reply was   "O uncle every one comes here and say they love the spicy level." but not everyone love spicy right? When we order the food , you were there helping us to do the ordering, you should advise the spicy level so we can tell you to reduce the level for us, Anyways thanks for the help , after that a guy with long hair came and ask us how's the food ,we told him the same issue but he was more polite and friendly to advise us with a better reason.  Prices are easy-on-the-wallet too. thanks to Semma keep it up!

Dining experiences @ Tasha’s have been great so far! One of our frequent go to joints. Service is always good! Friendly and alway ready to take feedback. The aunties always come forward to check if the meals are all good. We had tried the prata, thosai, both chicken and mutton biryani, murtabak, mutton chop and tea. The food is really good and better than what we had at Springleaf. Generally, the food is not too salty or overly sweet. Meats are always soft and well cooked. Curries are rich and flavorful. It does not leave a heavy queasy feeling after the meals. You can ask for a lesser sugar Tehs… and the tea does not have the astringency of the tea (not “siap”).

I placed an order on the day itself for a party of 10 guests and was pleasantly surprised that the restaurant agreed. What I appreciated most was that I was advised to place the order in a way that would save me money. The food arrived on time and the portions were substantial. Our guests enjoyed the food very much. Thank you!
Went on 1 Apr. Impressed with the chicken curry and volcano prata. Yummy food. The dosai is also crispy. Must try.

The Tasha Murtabak is a huge portion with loads of ingredients inside such as chicken, cheese, capsicum, mushrooms and others. We tried the chicken bryani, limau O and tasha's teh. Highly recommended as well. The staff are friendly and warm!! Homey feels.

This is one place where the food is as authentic as it gets! Nice ambience and even nicer staff makes this a go-to place for anyone who wants to taste what spicy indian food really tastes like. It ain't over the top, but don't say I didn't warn ya

I think semma singapore, has a mix of culture, ambience and great food. All the food was extremely amazing and tasty but my fav has to be the sizzling mysore mutton! I have ate mysore mutton in many places, but the sizzling mysore mutton, at semma singapore, has the perfect blend of spices to it, the cashew with dried chilli with the mutton being so tender, was definitely something i enjoyed. I liked the blend of drinks, and the service as well. I love the fact that the owners were so hospitable to their customers and made them feel like home. I would totally recommend Semme Singapore to anybody, who loves  to have a blend of great ambience, service, food, drinks and music! Everyone of you should so try it!

It’s was my birthday treat at this restaurant. The food and the ambiance was fantastic!!! The dishes were different and so sooo delicious. I love the sambal stingray Bakar and mutton Satti sorru .
I must give a shout-out to staff Mathi for his great service and hospitality at seema . Thank you staff (Naren & mathi )of semma for allowing me to celebrate my birthday there at 12 mn giving us abit of time to clear up our food and drinks .
Thank you for your wishes too. The food, service & ambiance made my day.

Was in this area and dropped by here for lunch. Similar concept to a competitor outlet at rail mall, this is a much better offering. Perhaps it’s due to the weekday lunch hour, it wasn’t crowded. And we were well served by the staff. We waited a while for the food to be prepared.

The egg prata is doughy, not the crispy type. I love the curry though. Both served hot and fresh.

Just as fresh and hot is the Briyani. Even the fish is hot. I like the fluffy rice.

The coffee is not to my taste, but it’s decent enough. Nice clean environment. Couldn’t find the toilet tho. There’s a wash basin. Price wise perhaps a tad cheaper than the rail mall competitor.

Fans of Indian fare who want gd decent food in upp Thomson road area can consider checking this place out.
Semma indeed served a hearty and rich flavourful dishes! It's must to try prawn and mutton satti sooru. Definetly a delightful experience in overall. Me and my family truly enjoyed!

Very nice and chill ambience, tasty food (must try the mutton satti soru - claypot rice) and affordable drinks (their Guinness on tap is refreshingly good). Definitely recommend to head down with family and friends!

Semma serves up some of the best Indian food I've had! The satti sorrus are great and the mysore mutton is a must try. Great food. Great priced drinks.
11/10 recommend 🙌🏾

Very nice Ambiance and the food was Excellent , we had the mutton gravy , murtabak , roti-john , pepper prawn, sati soru - and platter - all tasted delicious!!!  The chef was very efficient in getting the order ready:)
Feedback for the service crew: Base on your seating capacity and staff strength I think you can render even better service , food arrives faster than the beverages and there could be more proactiveness from the service staff. Secondly I know the F&B sector is moving towards digitalization in terms of food ordering and QR code scanning but to a certain extend service staff can still hold onto a device to take 2nd and adhoc orders from customers as there should still be some level of tolerance towards manual food ordering.
But it is still a 5 STAR* because "Good food don't go wrong" and I am sure you will rectify your service in future.
Glad to hv found this cool hangout spot. Good food. Friendly staff.

Very clean restaurant with good air conditioning, no food smell stain after visit.
The curry for the masala dosai was delicious.
Teh halia is totally not up to standard.

Ample carpark around, just need to find it.
At the corner of the row of shop houses.

First, the temperature scanning machine was the most advanced I had ever seen. Temperature taking and QR code all in one.

Wide variety of food. The menu showed a lot of food. However, the fish tail curry was sold out.
Service was alright. The food took a bit of time.
The curry fish head was fresh. Not bad. With lady fingers inside. Nice...
Also the plate of rice was very big. Could serve 2 pax.

The toilet was behind the kitchen. Need to walk outside to get to the toilet. Now let’s discussed about the toilet.
There was this saying, to know the cleanliness of the restaurant, you just need to take a look at the toilet. The toilet was amazing clean. Therefore I was quite certain the food would be hygienic.

Air conditioning was just nice taking into consideration of the hot weather.

Will definitely come again.
I love their food and ambience. Reasonable price. Friendly owners. Pls reserve table before going. Bring along friends and family.
Amazing food quality wide choices of the Indian menu in a cozy bar cum restaurant  environment staff very friendly items ordered get delivered fast managed by very experienced operational managers.

mutton briyani - very hearty and tasty, thick gravy, flavorful rice and tender mutton; a cut above the rest that you would get at typical Indian Muslim restaurants. I’m a fan of thosai too and theirs doesn’t disappoint, it tends to sell out by around 11:30am on weekends. Volcano prata is yummy too with runny yolk, crispy prata. Comfortable and clean air conditioned environment

An old plesant man greeted us with a smile.
Next a young chap with beared answered rudely we dont serve Thalcha when i asked. What else curry he again rudely told us to go to our table.
ALL the while both me n my friend were wearing MASK he was not wearing a MASK.
We decided to PAY n Leave without touching the food.
He must be angry with something but should not treat  customers badly.
Noticed a previous review by another Indian customer shared a similar bad treatment,
A pattern?

edit: in response to your reply-
Thank you for acknowledging my review. The first step towards making improvement is acknowledgment. Even if there are other sides to the story as you claim. I don’t think you wish for even 1 customer of your restaurant to leave with such an impression. Hopefully this will be the last time you receive such a review. Also if you were as attentive as you claim you staff would have realised we didn’t even touch our meal and the fact that it wasn’t addressed then itself and payment was accepted may be evidence enough for the lack of interest of your staff. We hope you see to this that such episodes don’t happen again.
The food is good especially the commando.. Advanced reservation is essential as the places gets crowded quick..
Superb! Love the butter masala prawns, fish head curry, mutton, vegs... basically everything! Food is also reasonably priced. Must visit!
Good customer service. Loved the ambience & ofcourse their food as well!
Volcano prata, something special at Tasha's, quality food with in-house dough. Extremely impressed. Will be back often.

Usually order take-away but decided to dine in this time instead. Prata was excellent - freshly made and was perfectly crispy and chewy, one of the best I’ve had! The briyani never disappoints. Rice was flavourful and meat was tender. Keep it up!

Was there for the 1st time Unorganised and poor customer service.
Food was good!
Not sure if I would visit them again.

Service was bad.. Shortage of staff..
here noone wants to serve us.. Totally zero lakc of comm.. Order took too long to come..
Food is good, teh tarik not too sweet, prata is thin,  crispy and not too oily, staff is friendly. Price is v affordable. Will visit again.

Great Food. Friendly Staff
Will return to try more
This restaurant keeps improving. The owner provides very good service. It's one of my family's favorite place for prata now.

Clean and neat Indian restaurant near spring leaf nature park. The coin prata was one of the best we had recently. They also serve different variety of thosai. The oothappam we had was good. Overall good selection if you are a meat and fish lover.

Exceptionally clean and good service

The food had always been the best. It was always been a great pleasure dine in, takeaway or been catered. Rahim have never failed to ensure we leave with a smile. I am 101% glad with the fingerlicking sedap food and ambience created by the staffs there. Kudos to all of you for giving us a different level of flavours without coloring added.
Friendly staff and tasty food. Great place for family or friends

Real awesome Indian comfort food! Definitely one of my new favourite Indian restaurants! Great flavour with just the right kick of spiciness. Must try the mutton briyani...damn happening! Highly recommend!
Very kind uncle serving us ✌🏿the plain Prata alone, with special fluffy texture  is worth our trip to here.

excellent delicious indian food, also very value for money !
i LOVE their coin prata, and their veggie sides are a must try

Seems like a regular weekend place for my family. My kids love this place. Simple place but great food. Their "Thosai" has gone a step higher in taste. Very good service by all of their staffs especially Mr. Rahim (hope I got his name right). My family of 6 are so routined that he knows exactly what we want. All the dishes are great and served hot. Prices are also easy on the wallet. Whenever I ask my kids for a dining place, the first place that come s is Tasha ..."kudos" to your team.

Went with my family just before the lockdown and tried their chicken and mutton briyani, and chicken murtabak. Best I ever tried!

The mutton was so tender that it kinds of "melt in the mouth". The flavour of the rice was made just right (does not have that overwhelming spice taste). When the mutton, rice and gravy were eaten together, it gave a homely and familar feeling which is satisfying.

The chicken briyani was good as well. The chicken meat was tender and not dry.

The chicken murtabak had a special taste. It was slightly cripsy on the outside and had a slight lingering sweet taste. I like it!

It was an air-conditioned and nice place. The kitchen was properly separated from the dining area so my clothes didn't have that food smell or feel after the meal.

The individual serving size was adequate and will satisfy the general population.

Would really like to try how their pratas as well if I had more stomach capacity but will definitely visit them again (when the situation allows it)!

Tasted the cheese prata with teh halia Ice. Superb nicely tasting food. Only reason I'm not giving 5 star cause I thought it's halal but they sell alcohol so by the time I realise too late. So Muslim friends just take note ya. Unless u don't mind the food is great.

Went with my family and friends and we had a great dining experience at Tasha’s! The staff were very patient and helpful. The Mee goreng Ayam, Nasi goreng Ikan Bilis, Nasi Goreng egg, Chicken Murtabak we ordered were exceptionally delicious! Will definitely come back to try more soon! Thanks for the great food!

It's my 1st visit to this restaurant to try there menu .. the food was good and tasty and i liked it but the waiting time omg It's takes time, if you go to this restaurant and you're so hungry you'll not be happy because you need to wait about 15 minutes i guess.
Nice environment to dine in, cheap and good. Compare to other Indian restaurant, this one is cheapest. Friendly staff, can go and try thier set menu, super worth it.

They don't serve thosai at any time of the day, only briyani, naan, rice sets. No prata either.

Vegetarian rice set - the ingredients were little and the vadai was small. I could get something similar for less than half the price outside. Would go to komala villa nearby instead.

Service was fine.
Mutton Biryani is very tasty. I was lucky, didnt experience bad attitude or bad service. Ordered from the nice Indian man who was managing the food.

It’s newly opened. Not all the items in the menu are available e.g thosa. Hope it will catch-up soon.
All the dishes are up to the standard and tasty.
But bit disappointed with the masala tea😏
Other Shakinthala’s branches have set high standard for masala tea😃

Lady with bad attitude is no longer there. A few gentlemen with great attitude made my day.

Food is great

Air-conditioning, the food is good and well deserved, waiting time just also good. U might want to try masalah with briyani. Taste good for me. The price not so cheap but not so expensive either. However, the parking lot a bit far to reach this shop otherwise u come by public transport.

They dont serve Thosai varieties, idli, rava, chapati etc. They have naan (was nice) and paal appam (total disaster - thick and flat - flour did not rise). We ordered our favorite Hot Badam Milk and we were served with a cup of diluted condensed milk with few sprinkle of badam. Very disappointing. Tasted horrible. I clarified with the waiter on this. He said they use condensed milk and not fresh milk. I returned the badam milk, but was still charged for it. Spent $46.20. Receipt No. YSN12364. Charged $3.20 for batham milk. We will never go to that place ever.

We have Ordered naan and roti items with Panner makhani, pepper mutton, kudal masala. Not worth for money.

Pepper mutton more oily and salty
Kudal masala over salty
Panner makhani also average taste.
Overall not good dinner experience and taste.

Ordered  few butter naan, ordered some curry that I wanted on the menu. Whatever I ask all don’t have. Instead suggested those dishes that are at a higher price. Ridiculous and I will never ever come back this Yishun outlet. Just ruining the name of SAKUNTHALA,S.
Had lunch but masala mutton I had was really salty. Price is a bit high compared to other Indian restaurants that do similar menu..service staff was not great as well
Menu items were limited, small portion, food was cold, pricey but the venue was cosy. I prefer the outlet in tekka, at least the customer service is good there.

Avoid at all cost! Whatever you ask for, they wouldn’t have. Whatever they have, you wouldn’t want to have it as it is that bad. None of the meat had any taste to it. I believe they were prepared separately and then just thrown into the gravy and masala. Was deceived by the big brand name Sakunthalas. On the bright side , the vegetarian meal and Briyani rice was edible.

Friendly staffs and comfortable place to dine in.
First time eating ponni rice and the taste is really different from those Thai rice.
The mutton masala set was delicious, love the gravy 😋.
The paneer in tomato👌.
Tandoori chicken briyani was ok....for me the briyani rice was a bit overpowered by spices. Tried the masala tea, it was good but a bit sweet.( forgot to ask for less sugar).
The fish head curry was a disappointment though. I've had better at other eatery

The service was super terrible. Our first and last time here. We won’t go back again!

There was literally only 5 tables occupied. So I don’t know why we had to wait so long to place order.

1) waited 20 mins for ppl to take orders. The lady taking the order is rude and arrogant.

2) the lady at the cashier counter. My goodness.. super blur and slow… she cannot grasp any infor and we hv to repeat many times to her:

3) the india brothers were efficient and better than e two ladies who were front line.. seriously cmi..

4) After eating main course; we ordered payasam and tea. We Waited another 20 mins. We CAncelled the order; paid and left:

With the current issues of food positioning from Sakunthala’s making rounds in Tik Tok.. we still wanted to support and so came to Sakunthala’s.. forget it.. Their service is Soo bad that I won’t come back at all.

Great new place. Food is delicious with reasonable prices. Has a bit of a homestyle feel with relaxed but friendly service.
Currently has a discount of 10% for Northpoint residents.
Have not had a bad dish yet after three trips!

Today we visited Sakunthala restaurant at Yishun branch, I would like to give a 5 star, cos the food really nice and service is very good and fast. 4 of us spend our time there today,  the lady who serving us is very respectful and provide good service too. Keep it up👍👍
Had the Masala Crabs, Fish Head Curry with Naans. Tasted really good.
Me n my wife love this place. Abit ex but restaurant standard that doesn't disappoint.
Have tried a lot of vegetarian dishes of shakuntals and it's really superrb
Always says kitchen is closed. Only can order non-vege rice set. Others than that cannot order.
All is good, ambience and food, the only things that put off is the incense that smell horrible
Worst place...service totally out....we ask one they give one
Great food.
food was horrible!

Happy to see a proper south Indian style restaurant at  Yishun area. Tried  and standard taste as in other outlets. Got good number of options to try. Good price  that matches the quality and quantity. Restaurant is overcrowded during weekends and public holidays. so there will be a waiting time. Plan accordingly. Overall good experience. Good Ambience and service.  Will visit again.

Always a great food experience here. Coin prata nice and crispy. Mutton bryani was tender and flavourful. The sweet lassi was good as well.

This prata shop is definitely much better than the one at Jalan Kayu. Might be abit out of the way but worth it! Prices about $10 per pax with drinks depending on what you eat.

Good prata! Very crispy. Even the egg prata was super crispy. The curry was not as good as the prata. I asked for fish curry, but this is not the spicy type. Maybe I prefer those with spicier taste. Since it’s my first time visiting his branch, I was quite surprise to see people queuing outside the shop before it opens at 8am. A place cyclists will frequent due to the location.

Wasn’t very impressed. Service Staff seemed impatient, and were unknowledgeable about the food they were serving.

Had their Special Lamb Briyani too, but it was very underwhelming. It’s mostly bone. Maggi Goreng was terrible bland, almost like it’s just been cooked in water and drained.

Their Plain Prata was crispy, as promised. Plaster Blaster and Umami 50 were some interestingly delicious items.

The ingredients for Murtabak were not scattered evenly, so it was quite confusing with each bite.

Other than that, just a over hyped, and expensive place.

After all the fuss about how good their prata is, we decided to pay a visit. Crispy yes, but is it that nice? Nope. Paying $2.40 for 1 egg prata is not worth it, plus it was super oily. As for the maggi goreng chicken, paying $6.60 for some simple tossed noodles is ridiculous. I would give $3.50 max. Finding the parking space was another headache. Maybe my fellow Singaporeans want an aircon place to relax and chit chat. Even that should be avoided since it is covid times. Conclusion, just not worth it. Ask me and I can suggest other neighbourhood uncles selling superb tasting pratas and maggi goreng.

A must-go place for delicious prata! Must try for their unique prata and their prata curry. Highly recommend Prata Alfredo if you love cheese and the plaster blaster. The salted egg prata is not to my liking, it doesn’t taste like salted egg.

3/6/22
Crispy! Reasonable Price!

Ordered Egg Prata, Coin Prata, Ghee Thosai , & Butter Chicken.
But wish that the Coin Prata can crispier.
The Thosai sauces so so only, neighborhood taste compared to Little India.

What we ordered:
Onion Cheese Prata
Plaster
Egg prata
Coin prata
Dessert Prata (Red bean)
Bandung

What we will come back for:
Onion Cheese Prata
Egg prata
Try a few more of their unique flavours

Pro tip:
Go on fave and buy their e-voucher. You pay $27 for $30 credits. Save $3! 😁

Their shop is relatively small even with outside seats I would say the place can only take a max of perhaps 40-50 people with safe distancing etc.

Thankfully we arrived before the dinner crowd and managed to snag seats in the air conditioned area. We got the side seats by the wall and the seats are essentially just concrete. Quite uncomfortable honestly.

The drinks came rather quickly and then soon most of the other pratas started being served up. They also provide curry as seen in the picture for free. If you want sugar with your prata you can also ask them to pass a bottle to you. In essence service here is pretty good even though they are extremely busy.

The onion cheese prata and the egg prata was excellent. Super crispy and tasty as well. Would highly recommend!

The plaster was quite meh to me and the dessert prata is similar to the chinese red bean pancake you have in restaurants except its much sweeter and also the red bean is not as fine and fragrant. I would give this a miss the next time.

Bandung is ok. Big cup is sizeable but because we make our own bandung at home we prefer it more gao with more carnation milk and syrup. This was a tad bit diluted for me.

By the time we completed our entire meal plus drinks our coin prata had not been served. Not only ours but the tables close to us as well. We thought good things are worth the wait... right? Wrong! We totally disliked the coin prata and ended up not finishing it. It was so thick and so much flour even though it was crispy it was just too floury for our liking.

Will we come back? Definitely! This place is right beside Springleaf MRT along TEL MRT line. See how I rated them on the individual components.

Location: 5 🌟
Food: 4 🌟
Ambience/comfort: 3 🌟
Cleanliness: 3.5 🌟
Price point for quality: 4 🌟
Service: 4.5 🌟

Average total score: 4 🌟

Price 2/5
Food 2/5
Ambience 2/5
Overall 2/5

Price does not reflect the quality of food.

Had their egg and plain prata. Flour wasn't any more flavourful than usual prata from other places, tasted like an average prata. The egg prata was freshly made and crispy while the plain prata was cold and soggy.

Curry was creamy and mildly spicy.

Had the teh halia, but it tasted more like normal teh. The ginger scent was barely there unless you focus and try your best to taste the ginger.

Place appears run-down and quite dark on the inside. There is also poor phone reception despite them offering favepay as an option. Took me about 2 minutes to complete the payment due to poor reception.

Overall, wouldn't recommend trying at all. Suggest giving this place a pass.

The restaurant opened at 8am sharp while the queue is forming. Pretty fast in serving but missed to deliver fully on my order, which is fine as they quickly rectified it. Prata is supper crispy. Coffee and teh tarik a little diluted to our liking. Besides being more oily the overall taste of the prata is great! Btw one of my friend spotted a cockroach running across the seats.

Always loved springleaf! Patronised the ones in the West. And first time trying this. The food quality is bad. The mee goreng didn’t taste a tiny bit like how it should be. And the egg Prata was mehhh. This was totally not the standard it should be. The noodle was so bad that we poured fish curry over it to give it some flavour as it was very bland. Would not recommend this outlet.

the location here is very convenient.

My brother visiting SG from California found this "wafer thin crispy prata" place in social media. Was there about 11.30 am on a weekday morning to beat the lunch time crowd. Just look at the long stretched prata which has a scrambled egg wrapped in it. The standard plain prata is squarish in shape. Crispy skin with a little soft texture inside. Goes well with the fish curry sauce. Kids would love to bite off the crispy prata skin.

One would think this branch in Upper Thomson is ulu (remote) and not many people would eat there. Not true. The recently opened Springleaf MRT station is smack in front of the row of cafes, restaurants, Ampang KL yong tau foo and where Springleaf Prata is. The eateries there including hardware stores, vehicle repair shops and mini groceries have struck lottery with this saver MRT station.

On another early lunch time, my brother and I had Yong tau foo. We saw one diner at another table enjoying his kuay chap and soy sauce braised boneless duck meat. Looked yummy to pass. We ordered the same to whet our appetite. The boneless duck meat was tender and salt level, not too salty was acceptable.
Pratas were made fresh, and crispy. The fish curry was thick, savoury, tangy and very satisfying. Also, would recommend the soursop drink, very nice. Come here for the good pratas.

We had the Egg Prata, Egg+Cheese Prata, Plain Prata, and Paper Prata with Sugar. We liked all, except the egg+cheese prata which was slightly salty! The pratas in general were crispy which was great. We preferred the fish curry to the chicken curry, although it was slightly spicier, which some might not appreciate. Affordable prices as always!

I visited on Saturday around 6pm and the place was packed. The food came about 15 minutes after ordering. Overall the pratas were good compared to coffeeshop standards, the only complaint I have is that some part of the prata is hard(like a biscuit).

Service of the staff not so good, they just put the dish on the table quickly and dropped the utensils on the plate and left quickly... Ur staff could have just placed it nicely instead of dropping the utensils on the plate.
The prata is crispy and made fresh when you order. Great selection of prata but the tea  halia and mango lassi is disappointing.

Been coming to this place for more than 9 years and clocked more than 700 visits.
The original staff and cashier are no longer here, but the taste of the food is still up to standard, unlike other branches where it can be inconsistent.
Only small issue of teh tarik ICED tastes too diluted. Recommend to drink hot beverages if you can help it.
I will personally recommend the sugar and milk paper prata, egg prata and sambal chicken.
If you like floss, then can go for their umami prata and other specialty pratas like the sg50 prata.
Now very convenient to come here since springleaf mrt station is just 2 mins walk.

The location is now easily accessible by TEL Line. The Prata Blaster tasted great for someone who tries it out for the first time. On subsequent visits, it tasted a bit overwhelming for me. Decent pricing. A general go-to place to have Prata with family and friends.

Visited this original outlet for the first time with my partner. Pleasantly surprised by the selection available, especially the yearly favourites. Service was pretty fast too.

We ordered a beehoon goreng, mozzarella cheese prata, plaster blaster and Däs Prätwürst with 2 teh tarik. OMG everything here was super tasty. Crispy prata with nice ratio of cheese to prata. The plaster had good eggs Benedict too and the sausage prata was a nice twist to currywurst!!

The beehoon was also moist with nice sized chicken bits and egg (meat and egg are add-on charge). Very pleasant meal. The curry for the prata was also rich, right spiciness and flavourful. Made all the prata stood out too!

Will be back for other pratas they have!!

Eatery serving traditional pratas and also pratas with a nice twist. The salted egg & prawn murtabak is a must try! The portion size for their murtabak is huge. We ordered the mini size for 2 murtabak, prata coins (5 mini plain pratas), mutton curry and drinks, and we (3 pax) can barely finish it. Definitely a great place for a hearty breakfast or supper.
Great food let down by below par or disinterested service. Wrong order fulfillment is common.  Ordered egg prata n got cheese prata instead.

My favourite Prata, Murtabak and Mutton Briyani Place 😍

Honestly was super crowded to visit on a PH, but managed to quickly get seats upon arrival as people seem to eat rather quickly here

Totally awesome place to go for Prata. Conveniently located at Springleaf TEL, exit 2.
The plain prata is so good. If you like crispy prata, you have to try their cheese prata.
Also tried their Sugar Paper which was so crispy, thin and good. We couldn't get enough and ordered another one.
HIGHLY Recommended.
So yummy! They're really creative with their menu items. I'm so glad I tried them out. The photo is for Plaster Blaster. Their take on eggs benedict. Really yummy! 😁😁😁

Quite a crowd when family visited on Monday morning. Although we can find seat rather quickly. The prata is ok for some of us and excellent for those who like crispy version. Ordered the plaster blaster. Quite nice if you eat together with the sweet prata

Went there during lunch time and I was a bit disappointed with the food. I ordered the plaster blaster, prata Alfredo and Iced Teh Tarik. The plaster blaster was a disaster, I ate there multiple times and this time was the worst. The prata was cold and the taste just don't mixed well especially with a cold prata. The prata Alfredo however taste much more delicious and filled with cheese and every bite is so good. Just make you want to keep eating. But to end off, the Iced Teh Tarik was so diluted that drinking plain water was much better. Overall the food service kinda of dropped, maybe it is due to the lack of manpower and proper management but the food is suppose to be unique and delicious. Hope it will improve over time again to be back to where it was previously.

Good Taste and Price.
Payment only Cash & NETS. Credit Card payment is Not Accepted.

The ultimate prata series are savoury. This is the to-go place if you are looking for creative creation of prata dishes. Would have given a 5 stars if not for the long wait (mostly due to slow customers turnover for dining in) and the gap in service (table not cleaned thoroughly).

Surprisingly good for all the special version Prata. They gave tons of cheese inside. A little bit regret order three of them for two person. Didn't think they have so much cheese. But the flavour is good. Definitely should give it a try.

The salted egg Prata is something you seldom find else where

Prata is crispy
Do sai is good too

The butter chicken is my favourite

Drinks are ok ok de
The prata is crispy and delicious. Did not quite enjoy the meeting goreng. Usually a queue to get in but moves fast.

This outlet is less busy than the other one i typically visit at bukit timah. They serve the prata and curry rather than having to self service.  No service charge. The portion is good size. My spouse and i redeemed lazada vouchers with ease. Is a good deal with the vouchers. Satisfying singaporean style breakfast. Sinfully Gratifying. The egg prata is huge, delicious and crispy like a biscuit.

My to go to prata place when ever I have cravings for nice yummy crispy prata! Have been patronizing this shop for almost 7 years and they have maintained their food standards! Mr Sarsi has always been very polite and friendly towards us but it seems like he’s not working there anymore 🥲

We actually already had lunch but since we were around the area we had to stop by here anyway. Was last here before Springleaf was awarded Michelin guide! Surprised and glad to see the pratas are still really good quality and the fish curry they serve too. We had the premium egg floss prata which was a little over $5, though it's not the cheapest prata but the portions was huge and servings of the curry was amazing and of course unlimited. Definitely will be back again and again (to other outlets as well of course!)

Came today at around 5pm as this is still my niece favourite Prata hotspot. Same usual issue of tables and chairs uncleaned, oily spots on table and crumbs on chairs. They have changes in ordering as now drinks have size difference which was not highlighted upon ordering. All drinks came in large sizes and as from the images below, my niece can't even finish the super large ice Milo. Personally felt that cashier should highlight to customer when ordering and not by default assuming we want largest size. Food aspect is simple, ordered Kosong/Egg Prata won't go wrong and that's the main reason for bringing my family back. Damage was $30++ for 5 Kosong, 3 Eggs, 1 Mutabak and 3 large drinks.

Pretty long queue but the waiting time wasn't very long. Quickly ordered the food but took quite a long time to serve instead. Food was pretty decent and pratas were crispy. Ordered butter chicken but didn't expect for a full chicken thigh. The highlight and the recommended dish to order has to be the special salted egg prawn prata. So good it felt like was eating a thin crust pizza. The most expensive items ordered but well worth the price. Had a good mix of sweet and savoury pratas.

Hi...are you planning to take the tel line to explore this place or cycling past as I was? I'm flabbergasted by the reviews here.
