The masala thosai I ordered (chef's recommendation) was extremely poor. Sorry for the half eaten picture(as I was starving) but you can see from the pic the potatoes were so poor. The coffee was extremely watery too despite the change. What about the other chef recommendations? I'm just so shocked the standards have dropped.
Pretty decent and crispy prata. Just that the curry was abit too watery. A little pricey but it was still ok.
Prata gravy is special and nice. Fried Maggie not bad too. Beverages like teh tarik & kopi tarik is good too.

Excited with the idea of being able to explore Springleaf with the new MRT Brown line, I headed over to Springleaf Prata Place to try their paper thosai and cheese prata. We ordered our drinks, Kopi ice and Teh ice, and were surprisingly pleased by it. They were perfect, unlike what the other reviews might imply. Here's a tip : If the drink has bubbles on top, it's probably good :)

My partner had her Mozz.Cheese prata and it was jampackedddd with cheese, better than any other places I can think of in Singapore. Curry was thick but not spicy, so I guess there's a negative there.

So far, if my experience had ended here, I'd give this place a 5/5. Then I had a bite of my paper thosai.

Thosai was crispy, but only because the thin parts were burnt and bitter! Thicker areas as so thick because the batter was scrapped off. The mouth feel was practically too chewy like gum or too crumbly like sand!

To make it worse, the dhaal and chutney was especially thin and flavourless. Spent so much time scrapping the bottom to pick up more bits within the watery gravy, I felt like I was fishing 🎣🎣🎣🎣 🐟🐟🐟

In spite of this, I admit lah, maybe their batter wasn't good that day or they had a bad day in the kitchen. Still, to this day, the worst thosai I've had and I've had a lott of thosai. My tastebuds were disappointed and hurt, even their plaster prata cannot cover my disappointment.

TLDR: Come here for their prata and their prata only.

This place serves the most innovative prata creations, as well as fantastic well-rounded normal pratas with delicious drinks.

Their pratas are always sweet, eggy and delicious, their curries a mild spicy, sweet, milky and full of flavour, their murtaburger is the bomb, their tandoori chicken murtabaks are always juicy and never dry, their poached egg hollandaise sauce and ham combo is delicious, their portobello mushroom and mozzarella cheese pratas defy all expectations while their briyani is soft, dripping with a melt in your mouth lamb shank.

If you don't have a quirk for crispy pratas, or a preference for spicy curries and just don't know where to go - this place has the quality and variety down pat. Their kopi cinos and the cinos are super yummy too.

Tried the plain prata and egg with onion prata. Pretty crisp and good. But long queue on a Saturday, came around 0950 and we had to queue for 15-20 mins before getting a table. Once inside, the order came after 10 mins. Overall decent experience.

Very fast and quick service.
The sambal is really good with a good spice in it.

Doesn't matter how nice the food are, am a person that prefers good treatment than your skills. Some of the staff here always react like as if our presence are bothering them. Work on your manners. The way you treat others and your surroundings is way more important than what skills/capabilities you have.
Hot, fresh and crispy prata in a breezy morning. love this branch because the surronding area is so tranquil

I did not know that the sausage egg prata had cheese in it and I am lactose intolerant. I went to the manager and told him my dilemma, he was very nice to make fresh ones for me without cheese. Really grateful for the manager to go out of his way to replace it for me free.

Highly recommend to dine here for prata or supper. :)
So so... Egg prata is big on surface area... But thin. MyBriyani House and even my nearby prata is better.

Reno is a bit old but basic cleanliness is acceptable.
Food is quite nice & prata is more of a crispy texture.
The curries are quite salty to personal liking...

Lack of hygiene in this place. The new plates that were placed on the table were so still so oily. Shows that they were washed properly. Secondly, most plates were dented and not presentable at all. Service was very slow. Prata was really good. 2 tried two types of briyani. Both were equally terrible. Prawn of not fresh a all.
Ventilation of very bad in that shop. The place were they dumped all the leftover food was so unsightly and unhygienic just the sink were we wash hands. Walking pass there made us want to throw up. Please review the hygiene practices in your shop . Thank you

The last time l went to Springleaf Prata was 7 to 8 years ago. The place has been spruced up. It's brighter, airier, cleaner and feel more spacious. The best part is it no longer smell heavily of curry and oil which stick to your clothes and hair.

Unfortunately, the standard of the food has gone southwards. We ordered a number of stuffs, from prata to murtabak to maggi goreng to nasi biryani. Only the prata withstood the taste test. The rest left much to be desired. The maggi goreng lacks 'wok hei' and the chicken meat in wre all dry and rubbery.  The meat in the murtabak is quite bland, so overall the dish lacks oomph and flavour. The mutton nasi biryani was very average. I've tasted better ones even in neighbourhood coffee shops.

While the self service curry gravy seems like a good idea, the gravy offered here are a bit too watery and not flavorful enough.

Absolutely huge range of pratas and specialty creations available. I've visited them many times at their Springleaf and Rail Mall outlets, and have found something new to try every time. The Murtaburger is highly recommended!
Polite cashier who took the order. Nice gravy comes with freshly made dosa. Masala tea is nice unlike some too sweet. Overall v good experience.  Well done, good job!!
Generous portion but waiting time is super long. Mee goreng is salty. Dosa is ok.

Located along the low storey shop houses along Sembawang road, next to Euphony Gardens Condo. Public parking is available just outside the place but can be tough to get a lot on weekend meal times.

One of family’s favourite place for Indian food, having eaten or taken out on multiple occasions. Many great items here with standouts been the masala chicken, crab masala and curry fish head. Dum briyani are available on Saturdays but you have to early as they are mostly sold out by 2pm. Rice here used are the basmati type for both the plain and briyani, liked that their briyani is lightly coloured and contains cashew as well. The variety of Indian bread is pretty good here, great for those likes to mix and match.

Service can be a little stretched at busy hours for dine in, just have to be patient and will not be disappointed with a little waiting.

First time trying, ordered take away - the special of the day, Mutton Dum Briyani, cauliflower and papadom. Paid SGD21.60. Busy during weekend lunch time but was served shortly. They also have the counter which is like the mixed rice concept. Q to be served to chose the dish and food. The food still smell good after 15 mins when i reached home. The overall portion is huge however the mutton portion inside is not alot, the rice is alot. Rice is fragrance and tasty. Mutton is tender. Worth a try.

This restaurant greets customers with a strong aroma and  ambience, it's nice a see a crowd again. Today it was  a sure delight to discover a giant prawn... Larger then my fingers.. So tasty with Britani and veggies.

I tried the mutton rendang. The rice itself wasn’t that fragrant. Ingredient and spices were limited. The curry dip was disappointing. Almost no taste. Vegetables were bland too. Only saving the grace was the mutton. It was tasty with a heavy dose of thick yoghurt. Teh tarik is not bad too.

Lovely fluffy rice, fish curry lacked kick...veg was ok. Masala tea a mite sweet.Restaurant ambience comfortable. 45 mins stated for 'eating time'but be mindful you may not have your meal served for 10 mins. Staff look like they mean business...Not a bad lunch but for SGD 13......Halal of course...

Nice food, reasonable price.

Super love their food, my kids love it too. Kids eat prata, eat in, the prata is super crispy.

wenr arnd lunch time.. wait arnd 5-10 for our orders to be taken as they are busy. Prata is very delicious. Came w curry and daal. theres a small mutton fats w it. curry is spicy 👌. The teh ais is sweet to my liking. Just the food is on the slightly expensive side. Overall a pleasant experience
Always delicious — same excellent taste since 25 years ago when I started patronizing their food court stall at Northpoint. Their Chicken Biryani is my absolute favorite!
Amazing briyani. I am completely taken by surprise. This is the closest India Indian food I can find in Singapore. Friends from southern India will love this place.

Cycled here, the chicken looks very huge which could be quite daunting. But it tastes good!
The lime juice is very refreshing as well.
So. Freaking. Good. Chicken masala, butter chicken, and I forgot what else, all of them tasted great. Love the garlic naan too. Hands down one of the best indian food I've tried in Singapore.

Nice Indian food. Particular love the potato cutlet, mutton and their dhal. However do note that they will close their kitchen from 3.00 to 5.30pm and between that period can only order from the counter. Do note your visit timing to avoid disappointment.

Very nice light Indian meal. This restaurant is  easy on the palette and makes sure their dishes are not overly spiced up. The flavours are there, briyani Rice is consistent, fluffy and flavoured. I would say for my liking it was pretty good yet lacked a slight Umph for  a South Indian Spicy food foodie like my Family. However, I would give it a thumbs up and 4 stars for service, consistency and taste.

As usual basmati rice briyani but I miss Dum briyani every time I visited..
Nice ambiance and good place to visit with family..

Finally I visited recently and tasted the Authentic Dum Briyanai. Really tastes good and Must try it.

Crowded during weekdays lunch time but tables are cleared quickly
I ordered briyani vegetarian set meal
Very freshly cooked and delicious
Good polite services 👍

Visited them almost every week over the last couple of years, but recently moved out of the North West area and so haven't had the time to pop by, but we definitely remembered them when it came to our catering choice for our housewarming. And they sure didn't dissapoint. Some of our guests even asked for their contact details. Definitely top notch food and always consistent too!

Would rate zero stars if I could. Went there with family and there was this one particular staff who was incredibly rude and by yelling "Wait" when we raised our hand for her attention. When we ordered our food, she messed our order up 2 times. We completely understand if an establishment is understaffed. But rudeness cannot be tolerated regardless. We were very specific about our orders and even repeated it twice. Both times. They still gave us the wrong order and even walked away without even apologising. Absolutely, ridiculous and unacceptable! Will not recommend!

Tried with my colleauges. The food was tasty with very reasonable price.
Fish head curry and Tandori chicken tasted great. Overall the portion served was great and value for money.

Customer service was very pleasant.
Food is good and place is clean, staff very good and attentive. Food price on high side but its worth paying. Easy parking just opp thr shop. Keep it up

Great food - tried out most of these dishes for the first time and we loved the taste of spices. The curries were well flavored and spiced. The grilled pineapples were something we haven tried before and it was good although we had to wait 20 mins for it. The boneless mutton curry was well flavour but part of the meat were pretty tough to chew on - it would have been 5 stars if the meat had been more tender. The chicken dum briyana was good and infused with the aroma of spices.  Overall, a positive dining experience.

Just went on a sunday evening with my family of 5. We ordered 2 plain naan and 1 garlic naan, one poori set, one butter chicken, one tofu sambal among a few other things. The naans came first and it was 1 butter naan and 2 garlic naan. As it was quite busy we just let it go but after most of the other food arrived, the butter chicken for the naan still havnt arrived and whatever naans that were left (we started eating cos we were so hungry) was turning cold and hard! It was after 3 to 4 times we asked them to check on our butter chicken that it finally came, a measly 3 piece in a less than 10 cm diameter flat dish! Service was atrocious but we understand it could be due to busy crowd but at least be apologetic and learn to serve the curry and butter chicken first before the naans, otherwise, how do we eat it plain without them?? Plus, the naans have turned cold and hard by then! Not to say the dishes were priced 10$ and above for a pathetic portion and tastes were also all salty! We will never patronise this place again! Only patronise this place if you enjoy lousy service, high pricing for ridiculously small portion and awful tasting food!

Easily the best chicken Briyani I have had in Singapore. The mutton and fish curry is especially tasty. A great find near Sembawang and we will be sure to come back again! Absolutely delicious and great dining experience.
Food was so good & delicious I would say. Price also very reasonable. Good service
The basmati rice is not really up to standard anymore, but overall I feel that it is a good place for the usual fish curry meanl

Fantastic place with good food!
Had the garlic naan and naan with butter chicken. They have a wide variety of food and beverages, Briyani was a very big portion, so if you are really hungry, go for it!
Can’t wait to come back!

Delicious food! I always get the butter chicken and naan here. They used to take your order at the table but now it seems like everyone orders their food at the counter. The food has always been a similar standard since I first started coming here. Spent quite a lot this time.

Decent Indian food but a few peculiarities like minimum order of 2 crabs is a must at $14 each and complementary veggies with the rice is given free only once in small portions. There was potential but totally turned off by the way they do business.
Wonderful non veg food and cheap

Cashier staff today (9th Aug) had a subpar attitude. I paid using paywave and it did not go through the first time (machine fault or sth) bc the second time I used the same card for the transaction it went through. Cashier felt the need to announce loudly that my card was not working after the first failed transaction, whatever. During the second time I paid using the same card and the transaction went through (machine showed approved but cashier wasn’t looking) but right as the transaction went through, there was a power outage throughout the restaurant (second time within 20 mins btw). After the power came back on, cashier told me to tap my card again and I informed her the transaction already went through. I showed her that I already have a payment made to the restaurant (via my GRAB app), she kept saying it didn’t show up on her machine so I need to pay again. The fact that there was no transaction shown on the machine wasn’t her fault but her attitude was really terrible to be in customer service, she didn’t bother explaining or try to be empathetic. As a customer I already paid so obviously I wasn’t keen to pay twice and have to wait for one of the payments to be refunded to me. She took down my name and number and said she will contact her bank to refund the payment to me so I’ll need to keep an eye out for that. Could train your staff to be better at having some empathy or just have better customer service :)
Great place for briyani lovers at the North. The Boss and lady Boss are very friendly and accomodating. A must try!!!

Tried the briyani.
Nothing special, the mutton is really small.
Feel that the spice and fragrance is missing
Tried my first podi thosai here. Super delicious! Also had the curry fish which was scrumptious! Wait staff were friendly too. Will be coming back!
Amazing food as always. The variety and quality of food never fails to amaze our family. Excellent customer service even during peak hours. Keep up the great work!

I love this place! I have been patronising them from 2010 when they were in Northpoint shopping mall Kopitiam. They have been quite consistent with their food quality. Their briyani rice fragrant and the gravies flavour bomb, i Favour the boneless mutton briyani with fish cutlet. Yum. my husband likes their chicken briyani. I would be happy if they can do island wide delivery. It’s troublesome to order now from them.

MY FAVOURITE INDIAN RESTAURANT.
Their soya, Tahu sambal & potato are the best!
Clean and service are tiptop.
Was nice to see the boss's children helping around in the restaurant too...
A well maintained reputation and quality of food and service that has only gotten better over the years...
Was craving for briyani the other day and found this plc after some googling. I personally love the chicken briyani. Mutton's one was good as well. Pricing is alright. Service was good.
I had a great chicken branyi menal here. The current is thick and pretty tasty:) papadam freshly fried and crispy.
They serve southern indian cuisine. There is room for improvement for some sotong dishes they serve. Other then that, it was average it's difficult to sustain consistency in F&B line
Chicken Briyani was super awesome. Friendly staffs and was quickly served. I have been craving for a good Indian food for awhile and this has satisfied my tummy

I have been eating Shami for as long as I’ve been residing in Yishun for 20+ years. All i can say imo is they increase prices along the way and inflation is real (which is fine with me as idm paying for good food) but the quality of their product (ie. rice/spices/size of their expensive meat or fishes) is really getting worse. Really disappointing. Today shall be the last time i’m patronizing them at NPC outlet.

A friend of mine came to Shami Banana for help to use restroom  coz she's not well holding her tummy, looking pale & the lady in the restaurant told her restroom is being clean but my friend saw 2 customers coming out & there's no cleaning done .Such a heartless lady to use such excuse to reject my friend because she's not dinning in .Very disappointing with the staffs too especially those who are serving dishes because I had been there, too
Food is nice. But lack customer service. Service is slow and there is no attention to customer needs. Had to wait for a long time to be served. Asked to eat in and they packed.
After living in India a couple of years it is great to finally find such authentic and wonderful Indian food near Yishun. We'll be back for sure.
Veg & non veg Indian foods with high price. Valuable foods for high price

Came on a weekday evening. Place was almost full but fortunately we could still get a table. Had the chicken biryani and felt the portion is rather small now as compared tp years ago, but I find it is rather suitable now for one person unless you are a heavy eater. There is quite a variety of food here but we didn't try much this time round.

Waited 20 mins to get rice and ready made dishes which are already available at the counter. Ridiculous service. Four five staff standing behind counter laughing and taking to each other. How long does it take to put something on a plate which is already ready made? The staff move so slow.
There was no banana leaf when we came at 1pm on weekend day, which doesn't make sense since the shop's name is banana leaf. The butter chicken dish was so little with just a few chunks. One vege dish was sgd5, sgd5! Ridiculous pricing ! One small strawberry lassi which was diluted was sgd5.
Tried because of the review. But won't be returning again. Your service is bad, your staff is ridiculously slow, your food is overpriced and just average.
Yummy but no napkins and quite pricey. Not a lot of meat in the bryani.
Great food with good ambience. Will definitely visit again. A portion of nasi briyani is good for 2 people.
Have not been there for more than 3 years. Great to go back there with friends. Food was delicious especially the fish head curry 😘😋😋

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
Nice place and nice ambience. We went pretty late at night, was quiet and service was fast. They place is quite honest too as they were clearing the food that was leftover since earlier in the day and did not serve for dining (i.e. the mutton sambal, chicken sambal etc.).

The staff are friendly and even at late night they go beyond the extra mile to ensure you are comfortable.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
Good place to go to for some sinful supper :P

There’s abit of waiting time so good to call them beforehand to order. Prices can be quite steep here. Maggie pattaya was $7 but granted it had chicken and seafood.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: I order tea and coke float the boss charge me $3. But the staff bring  the drink tea and normal coke and I asked where is my coke float. Then the boss came to me you want the coke float need to paid other $3. And he showed me the recipe is $4.50 why I need to paid other $3 suppose I just paid $1.50 more for the coke float. But the boss said no need other $3. I asked him explain why I need to paid other $3 and your shop coke float how much the coke float. He cannot a answer my question.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
Price wise is standard . Call SHOP TO ORDER AND PICK UP LATER! Shop no. (6816 4463)*ya welcome*
Better then waiting there. Waiting time can be a chore as buzzling with Parton all the time.
I can guarantee this is one of the best parata vendor in Singapore. Parata is crispy and curry is superb.  High standard curry.  Fish curry is properly cooked and thiccc..no comment for mutton coz I can't eat mutton.
There's one more Indian Muslim shop at the other end of junction 9. Terrible parata and curry like add hot water only..very watery. No taste.
This Al fattah eatey is highly recommended.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
Happened by chance, but found the best Bee Hoon Goreng Puteh in J9. Finally! Ikan bilis was crispy and flavorful. Enough veggies and red chillies. Ummmmph. Egg fluffy with yolk runny. Service was quick. Will be back

Six months later. Still my favourite.  But think they raised prices a little. $5 for my bee hoon puteh.

Update 6 Nov 2019:  They have changed to the usual Islamic restaurant mode of cash collection: pay at a dedicated cashier counter. A bit chaotic, tried to charge me for things someone else ordered. And my bee hoon goreng puteh's standard dropped.

Update 9 December 2019: the nasi biryani is good. Mutton soft, well marinated, basmati rice fresh, egg ok. Papadum not crispy anymore and acha so so. Overall good meal at $6.50

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
Prata was decent.
Teh Tarik was the BOMB. This is as good as the legit teh tarik!!

Place is open 24/7 so good supper place. A pity that its air con place feels very oily, they need some ventilation. Rather they have more outdoor seats though.

Easy to find parking since theres a HDB carpark. Bro is v friendly too!

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
Not cheap but not expensive. Prata is not bad. Maggie Mee goreng is good but premises could be cleaner

****

Need to invest in a anti flies light (blue light) too many flies!

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
Serves food fast despite having quite a number of customers in the shop. Staff is also very helpful. The plain prata is crispy which is very enjoyable with their fish curry. The egg prata is also crispy which takes away the feeling of the soft center of the egg when biting into the parts.

The teh halia, while having a pleasant strong ginger taste, is a bit too sweet for my taste.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Worst vendor , have to wait more than 40 minutes for Foodpanda delivery for just 2  items, although no customers around 3 pm , still the preparing is very very slow,  seems like the staff  have no urgency. Sighhhhh..what a waste of time and pity the customer ordering the orders have to wait more than 1 hr

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Incident on 05 Feb 2022 @ around 00:20hrs at their Yishun Junction 9 outlet. Extremely bad hygiene.. Waiter cum kitchen helper took the cardboard as mat on the floor and after discarding it outside, not only did he not washed his hands, he immediately served the food to the customer even when the outlet was not crowded and the worst part was that he literally didn't even washed his hands again after cleaning his mucus, he continued to serve his customers with their food. Not even worth to patronize the outlet ever again despite I was their regular customer before.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Had the prata kosong and as others have reported, it was good! Teh tarik was quite sweet and wife's Maggi goreng was decent but took some time to come. Service was functional and efficient as with your usual mamak shop. Overall, not a bad place to satisfy your prata cravings.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Order food delivery for supper. One of the egg prate is half burnt.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Nice place to eat at night... Can get alil crowded sometimes... Good friendly staff now...

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Ordered prata as I thought the preparation won't take long. However, got to know that they were cleaning the kitchen, which I thought was fair enough, at least they're keeping the place clean. But I don't like the idea of the person cleaning the kitchen to handle the food afterwards. Had to cancel the whole order after waiting for 20 minutes due to the "kitchen cleaning". But one of the staff did apologise and refunded the full amount though.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Bought nasi goreng Pattaya for $7 only get 1/3 of rice😑

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Best prata banjir I ever had

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Order Chendol from this shop end up I only get the milk and just few Chendol . Much disappointed

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Food is good, prata is crispy. But they really have to work on the cleanliness. Table, menu, floor  is always oily. There will always be plates left over. Request to clear but was ask to seat in the shop.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Their waiters have attitude problems and can't understand what customers want to order

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Lovely food and very approachable staffs. The owner is also a very friendly and courteous lady including her family members. Nice place to go for dinner with family and friends. Nara, from Yishun.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: 2 simple orders of kway teow goreng. Mee hoon goreng, i waited for 30mins. No crowd whatsoever. Not the first time. Multiple times. Waste my time sia l. Might as well i cook myself. Not recommended.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Alot of variety and nice food. Staff are very nice too.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
Food is good. Especially the prata.
Reasonable cleanliness and staff courteous.
Frequently the food bill amount varies. Regular customers can notice it. Most probably the staff make mistakes while they do mental addition of the amount.
It may be a good idea to put a price listing board on the wall for standard items that customers usually buy. This will reassure the customers.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Worst restaurant to order from waiting time 1hr plus

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Majority of store can’t even understand English. Gets my order wrong 70% of the time. Good food but if they constantly make us pay for the wrong orders then what’s the point.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Their martabak standard has gone down the drain. It used to be good and thick. Now not much difference from prata fold into two with little mince  mutton thrown in.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Teh Tarik is nice. Kampung fried rice is nice. Nasi Goreng Pattaya is ok, but just a note, the fried rice is the lame type that got chopped carrots and peas. Service is decent.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
Convenient place near junction 9 to satisfy my prata cravings. Air conditioned interior augmented with fans made the meal there quite tolerable. Although enclosing the area meant the floor/table tops sometimes were greasy when the cooking got busy.

Had roti prata and teh tarik here. Both were of normal quality. Fish curry that came with it was good!

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
Nice FD. Crispy hot prata. The other one on same level not nice.

Update covid phase 2 tight:

All food available here. Gd job alfatthah.

I go prata shop at Sembawang Rd there, can tell me mee goreng don't have.

Alfatthah my supper place! Yishun people all come support

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
Bought a seafood mee goreng  charge at 6.50
Gosh the portion was so little I am wondering they think they are serving a 2 years old child food portion?

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Ordered 5 egg with fish curry and 5 plain with dhal curry but was rejected.Why?because they just don't wish to give even if i can pay extra.Its not bout how nice the food is if the service is this way!Last time when just open,they are not these arrogant.Remember even if customer not always right but atleast differentiate when and when to appreciate them.DISSAPOINTING!

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Crispy prata. And I really mean crispy prata. Even the egg prata is crispy.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Prata was good with fish curry. Freshly made when u order. They make thier own prata dough unlike most prata shop, factory order in a box. Lots of varieties. Will try their Thai menu and Briyani when come again.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
Nice food and  reasonable prices, what's there not to patronize?

They are also very proactive to take your orders, unlike some places where they seem to intentionally ignore you because they are onto something else.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Simply the best. Better than all the rest. A bit more expensive but that's inflation for you. Good chutney. Great with thosai. Although there is no difference between plain, butter, and ghee dosa.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Ordered by foodpanda. Wanted mushroom cheese thosai but they didn't have it so I opted for mushroom and plain. Also ordered maggi goreng thai but they got my order wrong and swapped it to what seems like nasi goreng seafood. Altho I ordered maggi goreng but still, the nasi goreng was delicious and piping hot. The thosais were nice and the gravies made it much more delicious with the hint of spiciness. Would highly recommend!

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: The food was ok but the waiting time it can be work it out!

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Definitely a must if you're in northern part of Singapore. Not only are the pratas made fresh upon arrival, they also have vegetarian gravy to cater to vegans. Awesome dalcha also

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: I was initially skeptical about the Thai food here. But my clean empty bowl at the end of my meal should paint a vivid picture to the quality of the food. Nothing more than authentic.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: One of the worst of places to eat and grab a bite. Food is over priced and its so dirty

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Enjoy the roti prata here.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: A decent place to have prata. Have to work on cleanliness. Price is reasonable. Food is decent. Limited seats.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Pratas good...iddly too...fish and mutton curry got standard...normally get some vege or marrow or meat in curry...efficient staff.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content:
For Service - * * * * (4 Stars)
For Environment - * * *  (3 Stars)
For Food Taste - * * * (3 Stars)
Out of 5 stars.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Delca power with prata

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Menu has wide variety of choices. Food is delicious. This place is open 24 hours. The mutton murtabak is quite delicious.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Waiting time too long and will always mess up our order. Once the place is crowded, you have keep asking where's ur order cos they will forget about it

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Well if guy's happen to be there, please try their roti prata, it really really very nice, i love it so much, whenever i go there, i always order this, is my favorite

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Good food. I enjoy the service even more. Go on less crowded days  like weekday morning to enjoy a relaxing vibes.

restaurant name: Al Fatthah Food Expo Restaurant Indian Muslim Food Thai Muslim Seafood
content: Roti prata is fluffy and light with slight crisp on the top and bottoms. Ask for sambal to enhance the flavors
Briyani was fragrant with lots of spices and herbs. Mutton curry was also good. Worth trying.

Plenty of ingredients and feels cleaner than other indian rojak stalls (didnt see any flies). Loved the potato and beancurd. Dipping sauce is served hot and on the sweeter side. $6 for the whole plate.

Just brought a mutton briyani, give me 6pcs of mutton bone with minimum meat attached, very bad, I thought I order mutton bone briyani instead of mutton briyani, also charge $7, I cannot say is expensive but not worth it, because you are eating mutton bone with little bit curry with rice, 1 hard boiled egg & little vegetables, better go to the opposite store, more honestly with the food you pay for.
Super shiok supper food. Bee Hoon Goreng, not dry and not too wet, justtttt right. Huge portion too, can share for 2 pax.
One of my go to places for briyani because they are generous with the rice and meat. Rice is not as fragrant as some other outlets but good enough.

If i could give a no star i would...I was standing in front of the man who made the prata and i saw his sweat dropped in the prata he is doing..so gross their cleanliness are the worst I have ever seen.If u guys are there please take a look at their gravy with their kitchen towel was soak with curry and water dripping in the gravy..i couldnt explain more it was soo grossed.There are 5 to 6 people in the shop but their floor was full of rubbish here and there.(please dont give excuses bcos its busy).One guy he open up the rubbish he did not wash his hand he straight away take the prata and serve with his hand not using tongs.Omg seriusly eat at yr own risk..
Indian/Malay food stall. Still one of the better stalls serving reasonable food. Prata is good.
Prata is not oily with nice fish curry. Beehoon soto is good. Tried the mee rebus, as they ran out of soto, taste is average but a bit salty. Wide selection of items though.

Please quit from food panda. Spent 34mins to wait for first order and in the end canceled my order when time's up. Try to order again and spent almost an hour. Again canceled my order. Cannot even done two maggi goreng and one iced nescafe in an hour. Restaurant which received orders but not going to deal with it. Serioulsy suck.
Good food and polite smiley staff. Opens 24hour.

Order for delivery through Grab. Msg the driver to make sure that they have give me the correct item which was mutton poori set. They rider reply inform the staff told him all correct is mutton they give. When I receive my order they give me chicken instead of mutton. Why they want to lie to the rider? Dun tell me they dun know what is mutton what is chicken how they look like?

Ate here today... Bought 2 normal and 2 butter prata. Couldn't believe it was $9. That's still fine, but the cashier was super rude, and I saw the staff dip his whole finger into the curry!

Super nasty, not coming back again.
Karens rude service available here! No price tag!  Get rude service and mystery prices here!

Asked for a fresh prata, I told them I’ll could wait . Then the staff Saw 4 customer Queued in-front of the store .. suddenly my 1 egg 1 plain is ready I ordered before them while they were not busy .. soggy prata just heated awhile .. felt so cheated ruin my Monday morning …
Not great. And it's more pricey then regular shops. $6.20 for coin prata. Normally we pay $4 max. Royal is also expensive. Taste is so so.
Ordered their prata which was pre-cooked and stored in a container, naturally prata was cold and soggy. Price on the more expensive side. Wouldn't go again
Nice Breakfast Indian Hala Food

I ordered Chicken Nasi Briyani at midnight thru grab, upon opening the packet, the stale smell was too overwhelming.....and it was from the cabbage (vege), like how can you serve those kind of food. Already vomited and yucksss.....

Their standards have dropped massively. The chicken briyani was very generic and lacked taste. The mee goreng has no wokhey and tastes of simple tomato sauce and not much else. We have been going to this place for 5 years, but this may be our last time.
Friendly staff and food tastes amazing. Will definitely recommend. However, be aware that their sambar curry can be salty at times
They had alot types of prata like cheese prata and chocolate prata. Very nice 👌

Just your average 24 Hour prata shop in the neighbourhood coffee shop. Nothing outstanding but it isn't terrible either. I don't actually recommend coming here for supper since they usually pre-prepare the pratas and leave them aside, so they aren't as fresh as you'd like. During day time is fine

If can I wanted to give 0 star to this shop. Order briyani chicken sambal, chicken curry and fried chicken for take away, told them to separate the curry from the rice but when wanted to eat it, my rice is as wet as ocean and sambal chicken only taste spicy not even salty or any sweetness.

Worst place ever! Took so long to make my two prata and when I asked for it shown me stupid face and asked me again what’s my orders like a gangster.(the younger staff). I have been here for many years all elderly staff don’t do that. That’s 7am and the Coffeeshop really not so busy yet, if u not happy don’t sell here.Refused to give me curry and I have to ask for it! Prata don’t come with curry??? The Rivervale crescent branch (Seng Kang) Blk 178.
Awesome Prata with or without egg. And a punch with mutton curry. They are good! The curry is rich and tasty. The mutton has no smell of goat.

Plain and egg pratas are usually pre-made and not upon order hence cold and soggy.  New order made was not fulfilled and staff is on mobile phone and rest try to look busy.  Overall experience is bad and left with an empty stomach.

Dropby the Yishun outlet opposite Orchid Park Sec School, standard drop dramatically. Ordered Chicken Biryani but the photo i attached is what i got. Just 2 pieces of chicken, not even a breast or thigh. No papadum as well, where the photo clearly shows there is papadum. When asked, the lady rudely replied: "is just photo, not real" Do take note fellow customers when ordering. This is by far the worst Biryani I had so far.

Srisun Prata is one of the more popular stalls in the coffee shop. They offer variety of prata and tosei. Nasi bryani is available and so are kambing soup and even Ayam Penyet, a version of malay Chicken rice. A good place for your lunch or dinner but be prepared to queue. Weekend queue is always longer.

2nd time visiting this shop after being taken over by Srisun. Previously the service was superb . The people take so Long to initiate order from customers eventhough not many customers around. Left without ordering . This is the worst shop ever!
Waited for 30mins! So disappointed with the service. I order first and yet the customer behind me get their food first. What is this! Srisun please do something about it!

One of the better prata shops i patronise. The main difference is this shop sell chilli sardines to go with the pratas. Shop also provides lFREE ikan bilis sambal chilli too, short of lesser bilis nowadays(recommend that SHOP SELL the ilan bilis sambal to customers)
Very bad, not open, lazy staff don’t want cook prata for me
A really chill place with many other shops nearby, the food was great and service was even btr
Fried rice was decent compare to other hawer centre shops ..
I like their pratas because not so oily, and due to the crowd, pratas are fresh and warm.
The prata is freshly made dishes are delicious
Quality has gone down the hill. They pre fry too many pratas and wait for people to order so it's already cold and tough. Not worth going back
Previously order various prata for $6.40. Had the same order but was charge $8 instead. The person was rude and not keen in explaining the extra charges
The best appam I ever tasted in Singapore even thou is $1 a piece but u really can taste the coconut...
Wide variety of south Indian delicacies available. Prata is crispy and comes with fragrant fish curry. Must try.
Everytime order from foodpanda, restaurant will cancel order. Encountered so many time.
The best prata ever! The fish curry and nasi goreng ayam is superb!
Quite popular in the coffeeshop. My friend likes the sampal chilli the most to go with the prata.
Nice prata. Have been their customer for many years already.

Awesome Prata if you're in the yishun area. This is the original place of the huge branch down in Serangoon Gardens.

Great thosai too. But go for the Prata
nice prata and Indian Muslim style stir fried cooked food. I love the Maggie Mee Goreng too!
Roti prata at its best for service! Curry is thick (if you like thick curry) and mass production of prata!
Nice food
Very horrible food. Sri sun at Blk 291 Yishun is way better.
Not bad. Curry is typical. Rojak is okay.

Expensive sun in sg
Food quality need to improve to reach sun level
Food is good...taste is good...price is reasonable...cooks very fast upon order.
Bad attitude workers. Not worth paying for it. There are a lot better service and tasty indian food nearby.
I ordered 3 types of naan for takeaway. It should taste even better eating there. Will order again.

Chanced upon this gem while working around this area. Had the $7 mutton briyani and $2.5 Katira drink. Finished the briyani in no time as it was delicious. Meat was not too firm and gravy was perfect for the bismati rice. Server even asked me if it was enough, should have asked for more but watching my diet lately. 😝 Saw rows of the green drink and asked what it was. Thought it was avocado with gula Melaka but it’s called Katira. Not bad but not cold enough, think they just made it. The green drink tastes a bit like Bandung and the black stuff is grass jelly and some other stuff. My friend said it’s popular during Ramadan so I guess it’ll be nice and cold in the evening. Place is 24 hours, think will come here with friends for supper here next time.

I don’t know I eat mee kuah or mee kuah bubble like going to rotten. I don’t know how long they keep the gravy. Seriously your food much more better at Sembawang not over here. Can you go find new chef to cook!!! Very bad service ever. Last time I buy nasi goreng ayam, not even 3 hours then cannot eat already.. Please check your staff lah.

Today 11/04/2022

My hubby bought roti john. But this roti john only egg & onion. And not fully ya.. Please if u can’t serve properly to customers, please close down your lousy biz. Food is not cheap nowadays.. And yes we have to eat even though your service really bad.
Weekly breakfast place with the family. Prata is nice and crispy. Have to go early for seats
Very nice food,I’m the daily customer in d’rubinah,very delicious Makan,very friendly staff and drinks very nice,superb😋💕👌👌👌👌❤️

Went there for takeaway and wanted to buy fried rice, they said only got prata so i ordered that and 5 mins after i ordered the guy decided to clean the area before preparing my food which took me 45 mins of waiting time and the worse part is that in the middle of waiting i saw a guy holding the fried rice i initially order for takeaway. Overall v bad experience similar thing happen to me before at the same shop

Found this shop/restaurant by itself below a MSCP at Yishun, in a corner.
The environment is neat and tidy, quiet.
Enjoyed it's quietness, peace, tranquility.

Food is just slightly above average, not tried all menu yet, but had 2 egg prata and a teh tarik.
Prata was springy, not crunchy.
Teh tarik was almost tasteless, water ratio too much, little taste of tea.

First time being charge for extra bowl of curry!!!  This manager in the photos shouted $0.50 for extra curry !!! Environment is really dirty,, birds flying around eating food on the tables !!! Eat at your own risk!!!!!

Please avoid this vendor.

This eatery should be boycotted. Ripping off your money for unhygienic food. My Husband waited 45 mins for his takeaway order of 2 mee goreng and 1 nasi goreng thai. Extremely exhausted and hungry on a Saturday night, plus it was raining. We just wanted to taobao food home in peace.

The cook is from India, no offence meant, I am a local Indian. But majority cooks from India working in eateries here clearly do not know or do not bother to learn the local singaporean/malaysian mamak flavours.

Semi-cooked mee soaking in oil and the mee goreng sambal. No eggs, no veg. And the cook had the audacity to stuff the dirty paper receipt (which fell on the ground) into my mee. Contamination. Similarly, prepared oil and rice mix. Prawns were raw and not cleaned for the nasi goreng thai. I was grossed out.

Worst is the packer spills in lots of tomato ketchup, with no cucumbers into the oily mee. Why? I have no idea. Wonder how many people suffered from stomach upset.

Unbelievable mess. I saw many other customers having to remind them their orders.
We were charged $17 for this nonsense. We couldn't eat. Had to throw all away. Such a rip off.

I called up this shop the same night. The person in charge who claims his name is Raja was passive aggressive on the phone, aggravating me further, did not apologize, did not offer a refund. Typical, unscrupulous attitude. He doesn't even feel accountable for cheating a customer. Lack of conscience and ethics. Indecent.

I'm not sure how this outlet is still operating. Clearly the D'Rubinah management does not care despite the numerous complaints and poor reviews against them. They are simply getting rich by cheating customers. Customers (including me but no more!) are enabling these unscrupulous vendors.

Authorities NEA or SFA should look into this place. There's absolutely no hygiene, no actual cooking except slathering lots of oil into uncooked noodles, stuffing receipts directly into the mee. Lack of ethics too. I'm sad the hard earned money went to waste, we slept hungry that night, and even disappointed that the local mamak food culture is rampantly ruined. Real sorry state.

I'm actually furious that my 17 bucks was wasted at this place. No more patronizing at all the D rubinah outlets. Have shared my experience with friends and they too are boycotting this place.

Staffs were rude!!!!!!! Ordered watermelon juice and took 45 mins to come after we ate all the food
Worst experience when we were damn hungry
Prata was ok but could have been crispier. A lot of other foods to choose from.

I hate coming to this mamak. Very very slow service. Need to remind them once or twice to get your food ready especially their Thai food. Cooking wise, okay la so-so. They have new rojak corner, same thing.... I've order, told the kakak I'm coming back in 10mins, she acknowledged so i went. Came back and she asked if i have ordered....
The naan is good quality, the mamak is friendly!
Friendly and super accommodating. Coffee was too sweet and instantly made a new one to my taste

Have visited this place about 5 times. Food is ok but you have to wait for really long just to get your food.

There are many staff but it seems like only one person cooking all the time. The restaurant may not be busy but food still takes real long to come. And sometimes after waiting for 15 mins for your food, they will still come and inform you that the water is boiling still or the chef had gone off for an emergency. And ask you if you would still like to carry on waiting. I’ve tried giving them  benefit if the doubt but I think I’ve learnt my lesson. Food will always be slow to come.
Waiting time is very long... order 2 egg prata and you have to be prepare to wait for 30 mins or more...

Bought fried rice for $10 and say I chose this.
Food: 5/10
Service: 3/10
Very poor operated shop with unfriendly service. ONLY NEAREST prata shop to eat.given a choice will not patronise them.

Nice.... Alot of food to choose but is got limited time for each food

Like prata start at 7am until 12pm then it's start sale again at 4.00pm

Same a goreng start at afternoon

Chapati and naan start at evening

Very good briyani if you are there during lunchtime.  Freshly made soft, moist basmati rice, chkn/mutton coated w thick tasty masala dry curry.  Served w pappadum  cucumber salad n dalcha curry.👍.  Must share w another if not ask for less rice.  Dun like carbo coma.
Seller was in her own world, we ordered a chicken masalla, she gave the last piece to an indian lady that came 20mins after us. It is a racist spot, be careful
Some of the food is good and some are salty
for 40 years of my lifes…. this is one of the most worst mamak shop ever i’ve encountered. There is nothing! when u order, no more everything all no more

Food wise was so so, but staff was dishonest. Food is paid upon order and when my family and I left the place, they ask my father to pay again. I should have insisted a receipt upon payment. So people please beware.
Good location. Drinks taste, plain water will be charge.
Not bad for the food here for me and my family to order for breakfast and lunch 😋
Satay was delicious ,soft and tasty.
Not a good place to eat, seller is very rude cause order something and it was a last piece she gave it to other person
Ordered food with payment & waited for one hour they said no more food.A lousy restaurant.
I love the mee goreng, It is not oily and yet tasty. A great place to enjoy coffee.
Alhamdulilaah...not bad, good location, food affordable prices. Next door macdonald restaurant, and multi storey car park above.
Very friendly staff. Fast service
The ginger tea was good. Didn't try the food therefore unable to comment.
Must try indian food 😄
Pricey... But nothing to eat at lunch.. weird place...
Tasted satay so ummphlicious 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻and same goes for the kambing  soup!
Not bad. Often buy thosai for breakfast.
Best prata n others food👍
Ok..
Nice food 😋 can come...
mutton satay is the best there!!!

Poor service
Great food though
Good food and service
Good food and fair price
Good but not 24hrs
Good food
Service bad.
Good
Food is good
Thanks today

Don't you just love it when planned things go wrong and the unplanned becomes a gem of a place?
That's what happened to my wife and I earlier this evening. We drove down to Sembawang to eat dinner at the Chong Pang Nasi Lemak place. It was closed.
We walked along the row of shophouses, and chanced upon this Indian restaurant.
We both love Indian food, so we walked in, sat down and I scoured the dishes in their counter and the ones in their menu.

Arabic rice, not bryani, I was told. Long grains of yellow rice with spice and raisins inside, accompanied by piquant, slightly spicy, super melt-in-the-mouth mutton in curry, and a bowl of my favourite Indian Tom Yum, rasem! Aromatic happy meal at its very best.
Wife had the paper thin, crispy garlic naan, with fish curry, and we shared some fish cutlets, cauliflower 65 (yup! Not chicken 65), and tau-kwa in sambal.
We're both so delighted we found this place! The food's great, the people inside warm and Very Friendly, and a dinner bill that didn't raise my eyebrows. Mind you, this doesn't happen too often these days, when everything is so pricey!

Cheap food, good food, and great service! I can't find any fault with this place! Give it a try! You won't regret it 😘

Been there for lunch on Saturday at around 1.30 pm and the place had enough seating available. All of the food that we ordered was good. The satti sorru is actually good enough for 2 people. The mutton pepper was the highlight with an amazing thick gravy and soft meat. The chicken and the prawn in the satti sorru was pretty tasty. The seabass masala was just deep fried seabass with an extra coating of some masala. It might look spicy but it's just right and not too overpowering. All of that with a couple of butter milk and a coconut cost us SGD 82.

The ambience is simple n neat. No special mention to the upkeep or deco of the place.

The food we ordered were mutton biryani and mee goreng.

Food was served within 15 mins. The mutton biryani was not so special. Normal and raita was not so good. Side gravy was sambar! Why sambar for biryani?

The only saving item in e platter is the mutton pcs which were juicy n gravy was spicy n tasty.

Mee goreng was a messy wet mixture of uncooked masala n day old fried chicken pcs wt bones. Unnecessarily spicy and its a raw masala soaked yellow mee.

Overall its only good for one time try.

Simple place with home cooked feel Indian food.
Their claypot rice series real standouts and the briyani meals flavourful. Be prepared to wait for the claypot rice. Pricing wise is pretty reasonable considering the huge portions. Good for sharing with others unless you have a big appetite. Only downside to the location is the limited parking places available along the drive way.
I loved their briyani, Satti Sorru and Naan! They were kind enough to reserve a table for me during the last hour. Totally worth the money and time spent with my family.

Loved the meal here. The store is dated, but the food is excellent. You get a fantastic Indian restaurant meal at such affordable price. The fried mushroom is a must try. Prawn Satti Soru is sufficient for 2-3 persons, and it's the brilliant and extensive count of prawns. The curry fish is fury but great for people like me who are into spicy food.
Quite cosy place to chill out for food. The flavours of food is really delicious. Reaasonable priced with huge portion. Great family hangout place.

One of the best indian food I tried in Singapore. Some dish you can't even find in other restaurant. Recommend to order their claypot rice which is damn delicious, I even dabao another for supper. I forgotten the name on the menu thou.
My favourite ikan bilis satti soru. Slightly expensive but big portion. Reccomended to share by 2 pax. Love the ice cream too.

Was greeted with a nice smell when I entered the restaurant, that reminded me of Banana Leaf Restaurant at Race Course road. Ordered vegetarian satti soru - cooked with tahu sambal and sambar. Portion size was big - can feed two people. Taste wise, I would have liked it spicy though. Tasted somewhat like sambar rice - good for a one-time experience. Will definitely try other vegetarian items the next time. Friendly staff! Highly recommended.

The food is amazing. My favourite items are the mee goreng, chapati, mysore mutton. But there are many other good dishes as well. The unique thing about this place is that the food really tastes like it's home-cooked, with love. Also very generous with the portions. Would highly recommend for events catering!

After a long tiring day I was super hungry wanted something nice to eat. It was already 8:30pm. I ordered Udang Satti Sooru and nandu rasam. The food came and it's safe to say I was a happy child after the 1st bite. I slept like a Snorlax..

I was there for dinner with a few friends and we had a great experience eating there! They were patient with us as we ordered multiple times because we wanted to try more food.

We loved the Chicken 65 and Mutton dishes 🙌

Even though we stayed closed to closing, they were very patient in waiting for us to finish. Appreciate the service and standard of food!!

Friendly boss and servers. The clay pot chicken is a must order dish followed by that demure looking spicy crab soup which blows my nose away. Found another good dinner near my residence. Tables are a bit limited and not much interior deco. The food is the main star. Oh the bru coffee n masala tea is good! Will definitely come to try all the other dishes soon.
Friendly and excellent Food wàs delicious and reasonably priced Second visit was better with more dishes all of which tasted good especially bitter gourd 65 and reasonably priced

Good selection of vegetables, unlike some Indian restaurants. I liked the tofu sambal and the mutton. The mutton especially was flavourful and cooked just nice. Kedongdong juice had an interesting taste and was refreshing. Service was polite and prompt, though they did struggle when there was a crowd. Overall, we had a good, affordable meal. Definitely worth a try.

Third time dining here and excellent as always. They serve wonderfully authentic, home-style Indian classics and they have also started serving a new Penang food range which is amazing as well. We ordered Pratas and Chapatis to mop up the flavourful curries on this visit and they were perfect.Our new favourite Indian food joint. Our family of 10 left with full tummies and big smiles. Superb value for money as well. Happy days!!

Edit: Came by again on 25 Apr 21 and the food was amazing still. Satti Sorru, Sambal Seabass, Prawn Sothi and Chicken 65 we all executed perfectly. Fully recommended.

This humble restaurant tucked at a little corner is really a gem. Recommended by a friend. A small cozy restaurant with limited seats. Service was great and food was excellent, definitely have the home taste.
We ordered vegetarian and chicken masala set with a side dish of prawn masala. Food was served promptly. Nice to go with a cup of ‘tea halia’.
Will definitely return to try the remaining dishes.

The best indian food in town. Home cook style food.  The prawn & Chicken Satti Sorru (Claypot Indian Style)  & prawn sothi  (Prawn lemak)  & crab rasam was awesome! Super service! Better make reservation on weekends!

We were very happy with the service and food.All the items we ordered,arrived piping hot and was very delicious.We ordered 3 rice,cauliflower manchurian,salted fish sambal,prawn masala, mutton masala with tea,milo and watermelon juice.The total bill was $53,and I think it is very reasonable as their portions are very decent.Thumbs Up Grace's Pot👍👍👍

As always, their Prawn and Ikan Belis Satti Soru did not disappoint! Full of flavour and a generous portion too. The Nandu Rasam was also spicy and delicious! No complaints. The service was prompt too! Great treat on May Day 😁

BEST PLACE IN SG FOR SATTI SORRU.
Food tastes like home cooked food.
Price is worth the taste.
The prawn Masala and Naan Combo Is out of the world
Great tasting home cooked style in both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes. Food cooked without the use of MSG to get the great authentic Indian food taste.

Must try the “Indian claypot” dish (topped with fried egg) in this picture. That is their specialty and it seems to me local (Malaysian/ Singaporean India n) specialty. Do come and “Taste and see” these authentic local Indian cuisine!!

Amazing Resto for Indian food . Owner is very interacting and very friendly staff are good usually busy in afternoon and night ... Food is tasty well effort made my management.... had a great experience....

If you are craving for a taste of home cooked Indian curries that reminds you of all that youthful goodness, this is the place for you. Try the onion curry, salted fish curry and briyani. Ooolala. Suresh the owner and chef, also offers off menu items also that simply wows! Top notch and simply delish! Will definitely return. A quick word of caution about the super limited car park lots available in front of the shop.

First visit, Vegetable Thali - It was excellent.
Egg fry was wonderful.

2nd Visit, Vegetable Biryani - Not to my taste and not like a usual Indian vegetable biryani.
Vegetable biryani should have vegetables (Flavoured rice or masala rice can't be named as Vegetable Biryani).

3rd Visit, Vegetable Biryani - Still the same but this time the side dish (Cauliflower 65 was mixed completely in dry so called Biryani Rice). This was not good compared to my 2nd visit.

Advice to customer is that know what you are ordering. No harm to ask people there about what you would get.

+ Authentic indian cuisine - taste like home cooked food
+ very very warm and friendly staff
+ very good portions especially for the rice meals that we ordered.
+ nice cozy ambience
+ good choices
The food here is really delicious, especially the claypot rice and crab rassam. The owner is extremely friendly too, and treated us a complimentary side dish for CNY. Highly recommended!

Saw this a week before when me and my partner was on our way to sembawang hot spring water and my partner did his research and brought me here today to surprise me.. Loved the food which tasted like home cooked food.. My partner wanted bitter gourd 65 but unfortunately the vegetable wasn't available nevertheless he ordered cauliflower 65 and finished the whole serving by himself. The highlight was the "Price" which definitely not expensive as other restaurants. We both was full the whole day until we skipped our dinner.. Thumbs up 👍👍👍👍
The food here is superb! Almost all the dishes we tried had a genuine home-cooked flavour to them which is difficult to find nowadays. Highly recommended!
Excellent variety of home cooked vegetables and friendly staff..Food Taste authentic good and place is a hidden gem.

We went there on Deepavali.

It was our first visit.

And we enjoyed every one of the dishes we ordered.

If you're someone who appreciates homecooked foods, you should visit this restaurant and try out the food for yourself.

But if you're someone who enjoys alittle more of a sophisticated kind of ambience or even food styles (a.k.a atas/fine dining) then you may not enjoy dining at this place.

But for me and my family, we'll certainly come back and dine here again.

Thank you Grace's Pot Indian Restaurant!😊

Terrible place. Order chicken 65, they gave nothing but bone,skin and batter, barely any chicken meat.
Order the mutton claypot rice, come out huge portion of rice but only small chunks of mutton bones and fats, couldnt even taste any mutton meat.

When raise this issue to the staff, this indian lady replied back so rudely saying "you come late, this what we have left"

Wth seriously? If you out of meat, then say dish nt available la! Not give us scraps and leftovers from the kitchen but charge us full price.

FYI, we came to dine in at about 5.30-6ish. I wonder how is that even considered "late" in their minds, when the dinner crowd only started picking up at about 6.30pm after us.

Terribly disappointed with such low quality dish and rude service. My first visit to this restaurant shall be my first and last. Even kopitiam indian shop also serve better quality food. Never coming back to this "Scam-pot" restaurant again.

Nice food
Very good dry fish curry
Affordable price

One of the the best restaurants that serves home like cooked meals. Initially their cuisine was really spicy and I’m a person I can’t take spicy food. After numerous feedbacks, they did actually took it into serious consideration and now I must say they have really improved on their spicy level, and it’s much more enjoyable to eat! Thank you for considering our feedbacks and allowing different tastebuds and thresholds to really enjoy your food wholeheartedly. I will definitely patronise this shop as this is the only Shop from my understanding does NOT USE MSG in their cooking and their food tastes like a good home cooking. Keep up the good work and kindly keep this level of moderate and mild spicy so everyone one of us can enjoy. 👍

It was my first time visiting this place for dinner with a friend on a saturday evening .
The restaurant was small with limited seatings.
Not so organised maybe due to the small area.
But the ambience was cozy.
We ordered 1 satti sooru each and hardly couldnt finish due to the potion.. hahaha.
But well the food and drinks were nice though .😊
Price was ok also.

Was my first time there and I could instantly tell why it is a crowd favourite. The satti soru was HEAVENLY. Reminded me of a nice home cooked meal. We tried both the chicken and the prawn satti soru and both were delicious, but I preferred the prawn more.

The iced teh was sweet, but not to the point where it was overwhelming. I loved it nonetheless.

The staff will also give you a complimentary carrot halwa and even that was out of the world. And this is coming from someone who never really fancied halwa.

If not for the location, I would be their frequent customer, but I am definitely returning for more when I can.

Decided to try this place out, and I must say I've been pleasantly surprised. Ordered the veggie meal and it was fantastic. They go easy on the salt, keeping the taste homely and grounded. Good variety of veggies. Good portions. Liked the rasam and the pickle. Loved the presentation with clay utensils (incl. the water jug). Was about to order ginger tea and they recommended an off-menu item, Masala tea (Must try, just request them to use milk rather than the usual for a rich, milky texture). Place has a wonderful, homely atmosphere. A quiet ambience. Staff was extremely courteous and polite, including a very passionate owner. The menu is authentic South Indian cuisine based, with dishes I hadn't even heard of.
If you wanna have a good, off-the-beat, authentic South Indian experience, give this place a try.

Really good food and friendly boss. Will come back to try the fish head curry and crab soup (they've got a lot more items off menu that you can pre order in advance because they only want to cook fresh food). Had the chicken satti soru (something like claypot rice but nicer and with a kick) and mutton meal (white rice with 2 veg).
Amazing food. Please come and support!!!! 🙆‍♀️ we ordered the fish curry, prawn masala, pears and garlic naan
Restaurant tucked away in Sembawang, small outlet, but the owner really friendly. The Indian Clay pot was spot on, mutton Clay pot I had was spicy, but damnnnn good and the chai was amazing as well.

Extremely generous portions and the staff who attended to me, Vijay, was very helpful. He took my order over the phone and when I arrived to pick up, everything was packed and ready! I ordered the Mutton, Ikan Bilis and Prawn Satti Soru. The leftovers tasted great the next day too. Raita and Papadum was included in the meal, making it very authentic. Love!
The service and the food was excellent especially Mr Vijay best Customer service,  he recommends best sellers and cheerful guy

Athantic malayale style cusine...good taste.. restaurant flavours with moderate price. Taste was super ..will visit again with friends..as the quantity they serve is good enough to share . We have pick with limited items but it will tempt to chose all ...so may not be one visit enough..

Food is good but bad service. Restaurant was pretty empty but food took half hr because they kept packing food for the grab orders. Only served us when my mum asked how long more. Feels like they prioritise online orders more than people who make an effort to come to the shop.

My FamBam- 4 non vegetarians and 4 vegans- had lunch on a weekend. Mr Suresh, the owner, oversaw the order of the vegan items(see photo) and brought them to our table. What a personal touch! Some of us ordered the Amra juice which was like a cross between the sugar cane and the Amla fruit(Indian gooseberry). We loved it. They say: The way to a (hu)man's heart  is through his/her stomach. Grace's Pot lives up to it.Thank you Mr Suresh...for the reasonably priced finger licking food and to yours and your staff's personable service despite it being a busy Sunday dining hours:-)
Order home food delivery. The food was awesome and taste like home-cooked food. Packaging was neatly packed and delivered in good condition. Thank you for the good service.
Great service, owner was friendly and understanding! Food was great, especially the chapati dip (tasted fresh, with a hint of coconut).
I ordered Vegetable kottu parrta really it was tasty , they added appropriate vegetable with kottu. I enjoyed it

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Try their mock mutton briyani meal: $8.50. Generous portions of mock soy mutton and vegetable. Tasty too! I don't fancy their thosai though. Have tried it a few times; the chutney doesn't seem fresh to me.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: They never giving important to dine-in customers. No proper queuing system to collect the ordered food. Ordered Mee Goreng it was worst taste and cucumber not fresh.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Must visit  for yummy scrumptious Traditional South Indian 🇮🇳 Food! Awesome crispy vadai ! Masala dosa Indian style which tastes like home cooked food! Such a satisfying breakfast ! Deserves the 5 star!  Bru coffee was top of the world !

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content:
GF-322T dt.15Apr2022. self-pickup.
Delivered wrong items Gobi Pakoda and Veg puff for Gobi65 and Paneer Puff. Last time they skipped one item. Beware of this kind of cheating. I gave a chance but got cheated again. Grab should black-list such cheats.
Last timeMasala Vada tastes so horrible like a rock!

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content:
importance and priority given to those take away. Me who was dining had to wait 25mins for my food... Indian veg meal, all diluted gravies and bland tasting food, for $8.50 is awful experience...
In the past we used to order occasionally when the uncle was there...we really loved the taste and food. But now it's awful...

The young man, is burdened up with lots of orders to serve, to pack and for those delivery orders... Whilst the  cashier lady is just manning her cash register... She should instead help with serving those whom are dining to clear the que faster...

Lets hope this matters sorts out with a good solution and coordination. Hope that next time I will get a pleasant experience. Thanks 🙏.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Decent full set meal. Very delicious, hearty meal for $9.50. Fairly reasonable. The potato , mock meat masala and payasam was the highlight. Well done guys. Keep it up!

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Samosa looks nice but a bit too cold wo warming up. Veg. food set the rice cold n selection limited. Pricept relatively higher than shami next dr. Will not visit again. Not impressef.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content:
I have visited many times , food is good but the service is not good.
They will make you wait for long time just to b order the food.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content:
Worst service ever.. If u guys planing to buy food via grab. Just forget it, no matter hw many times u order always gt missing items.
They always will forget to give important items.

I have experience 3 to 4 times

Buy idli they forget to give chutney and curry.

Buy vegetarian briyani and tauhu sambal.
They forget to give briyani.

Ridiculous.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: The restaurant keeps making mistakes by not giving full order. Once forgot to give vada with Pongal and pickles with curd rice. Also the number published is not in use. So beware as they r cheating customers

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Very very poor services, very2 slow staff, have to wait more than 45 minutes for Foodpanda delivery.  Waste of time waiting and poor customer have to wait more than 1 hrs for her orders

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Havent prepare food but they took order. Waited for 30 mins just 1 meal. Subpar service.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content:
Fresh food.
Thick sambar.
Pocket friendly.
Light on stomach.

Coffee is good here. I liked it. Something different I tried as I visit Komalas regularly for Indian Vegetarian food.
Service could have been lot better. Know how to handle the pressure please.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Yummy and tasty set meal for lunch. Worth every dollar spent 👌🏻😊

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Paper dosa not bad, but a bit oily. Mango lassi superb!

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: I got severe heartburn ❤️‍🔥 & acidity after eating here. The veg Biryani is probably the worst I had. Staff work like clueless. Slow in taking orders, a lot of confusion. Though my order was served early could see the annoyed faces of other people who ordered & kept waiting indefinitely.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content:
I m very disappointed and disgusted with the service all the frontline today. My order was for 8 thosai n 6 vadais. They took about an hour that after i approached them after numerous attempts. They just totally ignored my order. And when they did my packing i realised actually the thosais were prepared long way back. And after an hour i asked the staff whether the vadais were done, she didnt have the decency to admit that they are still making it Instead she said she is packing it.
I would never logo there again n for extra sambar they charged me $6,fter i spent $47.
They don have the respect for timing. And i feel sorry that the food delivery guys had to endure the same as me. I sincerely feel the management shd look seriously into this. The staff is rude, unapproachable and just have a sickening attitude.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Very unprofessional people. They will always default on the delivery. If I order 5 items, they gave 3. When I call guests for food, it is so embrassing.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Waited 20minutes for a plate of fried rice. Very bad service.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Food taste is not good at all, and they served spoiled  dahi vada and fried rice

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: The best food makes my day😍 "Rathana bhavan" simply delicious, variety of dishes melting my mouth with smell of Indian spices. Worth for money and good customer service. Guys don't miss it, must try!!

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Such a terrible services, waited for almost 2 hours and then they said the food I ordered don’t have and cancel my order without my concern. Don’t even wish to give one star

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Such a terrific food I have ever tasted. I would rate -5 if available. Stay away!

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content:
Fresh food.
Thick sambar.
Pocket friendly.
Light on stomach.

Coffee could have been better.
Service could have been lot better. Know how to handle the pressure please.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Ordered 1 naan set and waited forever ...  The front is very disorganized and everything is just slow... Food is not bad though
