restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Went with group of my friends . we had variety s of Indian vegetarian food it's very delicious 😋 yummy... Even thow very bc they did very good customer service.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Worst experience in pickup. Waited more than 30 mins and they keep on ask us to wait. Finally collected order after 1 hour.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Very worst food in North Point mall. I went there eat some food all spoiled and very oily.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: ok.. so when are they closing down?

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Worst gril working there, she so rude when i walk off  and ordered at neighbour shami restaurant. The girl walk there and talking to shami staff about me. Worst service.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content:
Charge you extra to compensate your kopitiam card discount.
A bit expensive compared to other kopitiams.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: 100% vegetarian food . Great place for a good vegetarian food. serving south indian and north indian items. Had delicious food.Very friendly staff.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Slow service. Long waiting time nvm. Rude staff even worst.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: It was very bad experience we have several tea and coffee and other stuffs but owner refuse give 1 tissue paper

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: A perfect restaurant for Indian vegetarian cuisine. Homemade taste.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Very nice food and very friendly people 💚..am recommend to all . Must try.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Friendly customer service and very delicious food..😍

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Extremely slow service

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Delicious.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Bad attitude counter girl ask me to wait but didn't expect at more than 45 mins for 3 items. When I ask them to escalate my orders, one girl asked me to go to kitchen and check myself. Terrible! Only one nice lady did hear my complains and apologized. Been a pure vegetarian, totally disappointed with such attitudes in the shop.

restaurant name: Rathana Bhavan Indian Vegetarian Restaurant (B2 Kopitiam) - Yishun North Point
content: Service poor. Priority given to take away orders. No team coordination within workers. I hope owner take swift action into this matter as it frustrates customers to wait for their food for 20minutes.
A small but nice Indian Muslim restaurant. the Roti Prata one of the best around the area. the mutton soup is normal...not salty enough for me.

I order pattaya rice without veggies takeways, he said okay and did it. I open the pack and obviously i cant see the inside because its covered with eggs and i trusted that they did it correctly but turns out theres a lot of veggies inside when i checked the inside at home. Do they hear the order correctly?

Food is good , place is cosy for chats and lay backs. Only service is severely lacking as workers are more keen in chatting among themselves than paying attention to diners who wants to order despite a not crowded weekend night.
Solid indian/malay/chinese food  . If they put their place in delivery apps im sure there will be more orders than they have currently 👍🏽
Breakfast menu like prata, masala thosai, vadai was delicious. Dont forget their teh tarik! Only problem that their dine-in are always crowded with people. Best is take-away if you cant wait.
The briyani was Fantastic. The prata was crispy and fluffy. The curry was superb.

I stay nearby this restaurant and like so much with their "rojak mama" i ate tht repeatedly in a weak after worked. The rest of the food is so nice too. Recommend to eat here and service is super fast though the place is with limited seats especially fully pack on Sunday morning....teh tarik is wonderful nice and hot .  Guarantee!!! wants u eat u will sweat hahaha u see my rojak mama and my favourite gravy yummy 👍👍👍👏👏👏😘
Good ambience. Food was delicious and price range is match with what they served.
Some selling roti prata,didnt put the notice of foods price,every Roti prata shop the price is different.

Prata that is a cut above the rest without being expensive. Even though Elahe has low prices and is open for long hours, their food is consistently very tasty. Despite having ate far too much prata to the point where it all began to taste the same, this store made me enjoy it again. It is savoury and full of flavour without being too oily or too dry. Even their briyani is quite good, and lacks many of the issues that make briyani from other stores unpleasant (dry chicken, tasteless rice, too little curry). I might or might not always order more prata from them than I am supposed to.

Note: This is a review based on older visits. It is part of a series of reviews for stores with excellent customer service.
Friendly staff! Amazing food! They sell the best Indian rojak in Singapore!
Food is reasonably tasty but the portions here tend to be rather small. It is also quite far away from my house.

Food is pretty good, prices are reasonable, and the people are friendly. Only gripe is that it gets really crowded during peak hours, and seating can be hard to come by - especially with the pandemic restrictions.
The staff is friendly and quick response to our order. The price is reasonable. There will be queue early morning for breakfast.
A mixture of Chinese n Malay food available

One of the best Indian muslim food restaurants in Chong Pang! Indian rojak, mutton/chicken steaks, their masala dosa's red chilli chutney is super nice better than some that I have eaten previously, they also make nice drinks too eg. Teh O limau panas just nice not too thick and not super sweet and their Milo kosong is well done with just the exact amount of Milo powder portion!

Personally I prefer this Indian stall to others around the area. The standard of food is there and the variety of choices available is also there. Their western is a super worth while option because for a whole chicken cutlet combo with coke cost $6.50 or so(for those seeking protein til 11pm) friendly customer service and jovial owner. Easily accessible by private transportation but may need to walk a bit if taking public transportation. Really close by the wet market for shopping
Staff very friendly to kids. Food is serve quite fast. Very windy. However if you want to order takeaway or drink at the counter, staff does not even attend to you until you stand in front of them.
The boss is friendly. After so many years patronising this place he is like a friend.  All the food is good. My favourite is the roti prata delicious. 👍👍👍👍👍
Best breakfast n lunch
Food n service  good 👍
Staff is nice and friendly! Food comes extremely fast as well even during peak timings. Ordered bomb prata and tissue, gotta say its such a guilty pleasure
Prata is super nice most of the time. Teh tarik and halia are good. Often have a long wait to pay for the food, but it's worth the trouble.
Great and tasty prata time with family and friends.
Rojak is nice but service needs much improvement.. Waited for an hour for my paratha, ended up cancelling the order.
Staff very friendly

they got variety of food & most of'em are  tasty.
takeaway service  was not good .There can be plenty of miscommunication can be happened during takeaway
Every Sat& Sunday l have my breakfast there or dinner good 👍 and nice Roti prata including Tosai very good curry TRY there U will not want to miss it .
Nice friendly staff. Great and crispy paper thosai. Also try the equally delicious ghee thosai. Prata are fresh and crispy. Nasi goreng ikan billis is also tasty.
regularly coke to this stall for their special Roti john ... can't get this `Mutton Banjo` elsewhere
usual place for breakfast on a weekend for me. usually good but this morning - jun 2019 was not good. prata served cold. no sambal chilli.
Prata,murtabak,nasi goreng ikan bilis, Indian rojak is good compare to the rest of the other similar Indian Muslims outlet in Chong Pang, this is the only place I will Go for Indian Muslims food
Elahe is the best place for me and family to dine in...most of the menu i have tried and its very super sedap.
Not so good!Find seat to eat also problem.Crowded and cramp place to enjoy ur food.
The nasi lemak wounder full and their laksa very delicious.. friendly staff
Their mee hoon goreng is one of my favourite meals whenever i visited their premises.It is located in block 103 chong pang city.You should try them.
Fast serviice nice cook.boss and workes very friendly.i like that.👍
Decent Indian food. Always crowded but nice communal vibe to the plave. No frills.
Best Indian Rojak I ever tried. Clean food in clean place. Must try at Yishun Chong Pang!!
Good service and very very affordable... its yummy food
Always great service and food. Family eating place.
Need to improve  the service
Great murtabak,rojak,bonesteak and other indian food. Not to forget their teh tarik....is to die for.
Good food , cheap food and good staff's
Reasonable price with good portion size 👍👍 we're here for their Fish Curry and briyani

The place is always packed.
However, the Service is good n fast.
I love the nasir briyani.very tasty.staff very  friendly n serving very fast.
Muslim Indian restaurant. U all the Indian food available. Nice customer services.
The best indian muslim food ever been coming here seen 2008....
The food is better than other mamak food in Yishun and the price is reasonable.

Quick service. Arrived on Sunday at 7pm with queue but turnover service is fast.
Good quality Japanese food at reasonable price.
Service is attentive but I feel not personal as staff were quite clumsy, hence deduct 1 star.
Where I was seated at, very sticky floors.

Good sushi in the heartlands! Went here with my wife as we were craving for sushi. Have to say, we were pleasantly surprised at the high quality food and service.

As soon as we were seated, it felt as if we were transported away from the heartlands with the high class decor and atmosphere. The service was top notch with each staff being very welcoming and prompt. The sushi and sashimi were delectable and tasted fresh. My wife went with their Udon which had a very delicious broth and springy noodles. I went with the Yakiniku Don and it had strong beefy flavours and savoury sauce.

Don't sleep on their dessert offerings too, this is one you won't want to miss! The Matcha ice cream was great but I can't stop raving about their Chocolate Wafer! Vanilla Ice cream with great quality thin chocolate bar in the centre sandwiched between wafers - every bite kept me wanting more and luckily for us, the portion was very generous.

Overall, I highly recommend a visit here if you're ever craving for great Japanese food.

Located near the original section of Northpoint Shopping Centre.
Best to avoid meal times to skip the crowd.
Wide variety of Japanese food selection, from sashimi, sushi, don and noodles.
Prices were still considered reasonable.
Services rendered was very basic. Nothing outstanding or worth mentioning about their services.
Maybe because, all the orders could be placed through the iPad, so minimal contact with the staffs.
Still one of the classical places to go for sushi in Singapore.

Good service and huge variety of food options.

Golden Roll - Good amount of mango, prawn was okay.
Chawanmushi - Average and tastes like how it should be.
Mentaiko Squid - This was really good, generous mentaiko and huge piece of squid!
Hanasaki Ika Tempura - This is the must order whenever at Sushi Tei, crispy and delicious!
Hotate Tamago Udon - Average

Good place to eat with a group of friends given the large menu. Will be back for the Hanasaki Ika Tempura and Mentaiko Squid.

Staff -
Staff were attentive and kind, quick to respond and aware of our needs.

Food -
To be honest, the food was not great. We ordered the Zuwai Chanwanmushi, Salmon Aburi roll and Kani Mentai Mayo Roll. We much prefer Itacho Sushi’s rolls.
More affordable, and tasty.

Environment -
The environment was chill, but it was busy as it was on a Sunday night, we waited 15 minutes to be called for our turn.
Really tasty and fresh sashimi and sushi. Pork cutlet wasn’t that nice. I will skip that next time. Sushi tei tends to quite consistent across branches.
Nice pot of sukiyaki, beef. Sparkling peach from Japan, abit sweet. Enjoy the wonderful ceiling jazz strings music. Was the one customer to go at 940pm.

Finally we are back to Sushi Tei NPC outlet.
Something is missing...Zuwai Crab & Seafood Fried Rice from the menu which is the all time sold out in SG as it is really one of the best fried rice I have ever tasted.
But You can try Zuwai Gani Chawanmushi.
Service was good. Foods are delicious. Always kept their standard. Sashimi is fresh.

Is a Saturday evening, having family dinner hence  we finally came.  Tonight we ordered as if we are in Johar Bahru. Ordered 20 over items.

The sashimi is fresh, curry is nice, upon is nice, fried cuttlefish is awesome.

Wow a very well spend dinner together with my family.  A little waiting time and is all worth it.

Staff here are all super friendly.
Happy mom happy kids.

Joining their membership is good deal, pay $68 and get 80 points in return which is equal to $80 (to be used in 12months), every meal gets 10% rebate , birthday month gets 20% rebate. 😀
Since unable to travel this time, here is the best place to indulge when miss 🇯🇵 . Food was nice, staff was friendly and nice ambiance.

We are big fans of Sushi Tei but the last time we dine here we made a mistake of ordering a supposedly ramen noodles that came as reinvented Instant Noodles with sautéed onion, chives, meat and egg. That was the biggest disappointment, we were looking forward for a decent ramen. We ordered a plate of Sushi with supposedly crispy salmon skin at the centre but that too failed us, it was gummy and chewing was a struggle.

We still love Sushi Tei but next time probably stick to the safer and premium choices we've always loved.

A decent Japanese outlet to go to in the neighbourhood. Not the cheapest u can get but definitely one of the better choices.
Beef salad is always my best bet and salmon mentaiko is equally great!

The operation/service quality is a disappointment. Brought my family here for dad’s birthday dinner, ordered some sides & 3 mains within 10mins all the items was served except for 1 main
After asking the staffs to check for us a couple of time the dish finally came! Took a 30mins gap to arrive! The staff (Rachel)black uniform if I see correctly wasn’t even apologetic when serving it to us 👎🏼
The pork katsu was tougher than my life 🙃
Many times came here before.. but now the prices increased! Too pricey 🙈
Good quality Japanese food. Attentive service. I like it that there is a relatively high level of customisation allowed too.
At least this place have a decent sushi. Try to avoid lunch time or dinner time. Always long queue. Price on a high side . Can be cheaper

This is next to Swensens, in the old wing, second floor. Great service. Most of the food we ordered came quickly. The dishes that were decent were the specialty roll, and the wakame salad. The pidan tofu was not bad. The pork cutlet was tough and hence disappointing. The chirashi don was the worst with little seasoning - just a few slices of sashimi topped on lots of rice. They don't take reservations here. Green tea is refillable. Our bill came up to $73 + for three of us.

Been eating at Sushi Tei since the late 1990s. Very sad to say, their standard has dropped.... the place didn't look too clean too. Many nice new sushi restaurants of better value and quality have sprung up all these years....

Had the shrimp-vegetable fritter on rice. There was way too much flour and not enough sauce, so it was a very dry meal. The enoki wrapped in beef was good as usual. Service was sufficient, ambience was serviceable. …

Consistently yummy & fresh sushi and sashimi; even their edamame is served warm and slightly salted. Prices are just a tad high compared to other mainstream Japanese restaurant chains, but it's worth the food quality and pleasant service. …

Revisited after few months and there's good improvement to the quality of food. Ordered Crispy Salmon Mentaiko, Iberico Pork, Salmon Sashimi(limited time 1-1 promo with UOB) and a Tendon. The Tendon fell short of expectation, but that again …

I don’t really anything to complaint about this place. Specialty rolls are super good and I’m a fan of Ramen 🍜 and theirs is very good. Prices are a little high but in general acceptable for the location and food quality …

Good service each time I come. The place is quieter in the afternoon but dinner is a like a screaming restaurant especially when you are seated near kids. The food is not consistent especially the salads. Sometimes you get nice vegetable …
Food was ok. Ambient was a bit dark for our liking. Sushi/bento/ramen/udon quite a selection of Japanese dishes.

Comfy seats, nice ambience at almost every outlet. Sushi tei is the go to jap restaurant for a quick fix to your Japanese 食べ物cravings. Food quality is almost consistent and quite fresh. Firm favs remain the mentaiko salmon, sashimi salad, …
Prompt service. Been to this outlet a few times even during weekday dinner, no crowd. The food was quite standard. Love their chawanmushi thou
Good Quality Japanese food. Service is very fast even when the restaurant is packed. Staff here are also friendly.
Love the quality of food they served and their service is simply awesome! 👍 …

I've always enjoy the food from Sushi Tei. It's very fresh and they always have new seasonal items. today I had the lobster roll 1-for-1 because of UOB card promo, then a must have Kani Chawanmushi, with a piping hot Yosenabe. so good! …

Very disappointed! It could be the Yishun brand is not up to normal sushi tei standards: very salty for every dish, the chef loss the taste or … ; curry rice the curry sauce is salty and artificial … seriously not a good experience.

Ambient was good. Not too noisy. Food came relatively fast enough.
Simple to order through the tablet

Nice place to eat with family.
Like the quality of their sushi.
Great taste of Hot Sake...
Service is great and had a good time there. Not rushing and nice food � …
Food is nice and reasonable price
Nice and quiet, sushi is delicate and much detailed!
Always love the sashimi salad! I think it's the best among the Japanese eating outlets.

Food is adequately fresh
Good service!

Lunch promotion was lackluster... Food are quite good..

Price wise it's on the higher side..
Services were still good, however it may be a little slow or required multiple attempt to capture the personnel attention. Food items offered are still of high quality.
Have a good variety of dishes to select. Great food and ambiance.
Crowded as expected. Waiting time of about 10min but the staff was helpful. Food was slight above average. 5 stars for overall service.
Prompt service with friendly staff! Ingredients are very fresh too with quite substantial portion.

Food is really good but unfortunately, the service provided in this restaurant at Northpoint was subpar. Grill cod fish was served cold, with diluted/watery teriyaki sauce. Service staff was almost non-existent. Sushi took about 35 minutes to serve. This was after I politely reminded the staff that I still have missing orders.
Fresh ingredients. Only problem was the wait time for table. But I guess is normal for peak hours. Will definitely come back again.
Always my favourite Japanese restaurant ❤️

Brought customer for lunch yesterday, 3 of us rejected by the stuff here..

I said: We are not living in the same address …
It tastes good, every dish choose is delicious.
One of the go to place if I want to have food indulgence.. I love that they open their branch here..

My family and I went to the outlet at Northpoint City to have dinner. We ordered the Yakitori Don and many others. When the Yakidori Don came, I was surprised to see that the amount of chicken was much lesser and made the remark the moment …
